text: Easily the most disappointing Mexican restaurant experience since I moved to Charlotte. Now, I will say the tacos were pretty good. We tried a few variations between the two of us. Perhaps this isn't fair, being from South Florida but how dare these people call that shameful drink a margarita. It was awful and for eight dollars (the house), it should have been spectacular. Of course we didn't learn our lesson. My husband ordered a fourteen dollar margarita, in a vain attempt at putting the last one behind us. If you like battery acid and mediocre food, go there.

Grabbed lunch here was quickly seated the waitress was very nice and helpful to my coworker and I who are first timers to charlotte. I highly recommend the guacamole they have side dishes for two bucks if you don't want to spend nine on the big bowl. Their chicken taco with cilantro was awesome, wasn't big into their side dish red rice it slaw but the taco and guacamole more then made up for it. Reasonably pieced too for seven bucks. Will be returning here when I am on my next business trip
Great service and the food has been excellent in our past visits too. Will be back for sure !

I really enjoyed the calamari taco and brisket taco.The salsa was way too salty :( sadly. The plate came with a choice of 2tacos rice beans and cole slaw. I got rice only and my cousin did substitute the slaw for another side she picked the butter corn which was also good. We were a party of 4 and went on a Thursday night with no wait at 8.
Great tacos and margaritas.  Really enjoyed my chips and salsa and great craft beers.  Spot in place and best to come during happy hour.

Call me crazy but this has everything I want in a Mexican food place. Great chips and salsa. Great guac. Amazing Volcano Queso. The food is fast and the beer and margaritas are cold. They've got TVs to watch the game and an outdoor area when the weather is nice. I've never had a bad experience here and it's one of my "go-to" Mexican food spots in the area.
Paco's Tacos did not disappoint! It has great food and the excellent service that you've come to expect from the FS Food Group. I highly recommend checking it out.

This place has excellent food and drinks. Which is why it's a shame I won't be coming back. The last two times I dined with you I witnessed managers yelling at employees. A female manager jad gathered servers in the kitchen and started yelling and cursing about something. My children even remarked about the "bad words" she used. Normally I would brush this off as maybe a bad day but it was the second time I noticed this. My previous visit an older gentlemen yelled about dirty tables. I think asking for help will get you further rhan berating employees. Your servers are most likely hard working and under paid as it is. I refuse to support an establishment that treats employees that way. It's unfortunate.  I feel horrible for your staff.  There are better ways to communicate issues and more effective means of dealing with problems besides yelling and cursing.
Love this place.  My favorite taco place in Charlotte.  My GF and go here at least twice a month.  Get the brisket, it's da bomb
Service has been the best. Extremely attentive host and waiter. Food and margaritas equally good.  Tops in my book in charlotte for tex-mex.

First experience here!  Love the music and décor!  Waiter seemed to 'roll his eyes' when I was thinking about what  kind of taco I wanted.  The tortilla soup was poor.  Served in very small bowl and the chips on top overtook the actual soup.  Taco was good but for what I paid, it wasn't full, like most Mexican Restaurants serve tacos. Very skimpy. Waiter left work so we had the hostess helping us and then she left?  Had to take my bill to the front.  Poor experience.

Very well may be the best shrimp tacos I've ever had, slightly crispy. Really good guac, can do the make at the table variety but I opted just for a side. The house made salsa was real good and the table side Mex hot sauce had kick! They have the "healthy" tortilla options which is nice as well. The Paco Taco was bomb and be sure to get the Charro beans - so good! $2 pint of Shiner doesn't hurt their case either.  True Tex-Mex taco shop with all the random Texas decor on the walls.   If you are in Southpark area - this is a must try!
Great food, service, & Tequila! Will definitely stop by again on my next trip to Charlotte.
Awesome food!  Paco's taco is a unique, awesome taste and they have the best Chicken Tortilla Soup that I have ever had!

Lunch on a Friday One guest had grilled chicken burrito that was the days special. I had veggie quesadilla and both entrees were delicious. Service was great and it appears that everyone works together to make your experience pleasant. Prices reasonable and chips and salsa were very fresh. Will definately go back.

Much better than Cantina 1511! The salsa verde was really good. I was a bit disappointed at the fact that they had to smother my enchiladas in queso to make them vegetarian - where's the enchilada sauce!? - but it was pretty decent. I will likely go back ... and next time, have a margarita. They looked yummy.

Paco's does quite pack enough punch for my taste.  Due to location, it's incredibly popular, and there's usually a wait for tables.  No worries - you can put your name on the list and grab a seat at the bar while you wait to be called.  Oddly enough, when I asked for one of the buzzers to notify me when our table was ready, I was told that its range was really bad and it might not go off, even though the bar was 6 feet away.  Luckily, the anticipated 45-50 minute wait was cut to only ~30 minutes, and we grabbed the pitcher of blood orange margaritas to drink at our table.     While our server and service was fine, I unfortunately found the food to be unremarkable, with the free chips & salsa being the best thing all night (although Ben mentions the tomatillo salsa, we only received the smokey red one).   We started with the table side guacamole, and while it was heartily devoured, it lacked much heat or flavor outside fresh avocado.  I ordered three tacos and tried the chicken, skirt steak, and ground beef options.  On the plus side, with three tacos, rice, and my choice of charro, refried, or black beans, there was more than enough food; on the con side, none of it was overly remarkable... in fact, there wasn't much to remember on any part of my plate.    Of all the Frank Scibelli's restaurants, Paco's proves to be my least favorite.  I've tried it twice and have been underwhelmed both times.  Maybe third time's the charm, but with all the other great eateries around town, I don't know if I'll give Paco's a final chance to wow.

This is one of our favorite places to eat in Charlotte. My BF LOVES (yes...an all CAPS kind of feeling) the Pacos Taco. I usually switch it up and try something different all the time. I've never had anything I didn't like.  One thing I get every time is the El Dorado Margarita on the rocks...I'm not a huge Margarita fan, but this one is tasty!! The service is usually pretty awesome...the chips/salsa are fresh and we have a hard time not filling up on those and the queso (white cheese) that we always order.  We are definite fans of this place and go at least 3 times a month.

I don't know if there is a real Paco out there , but I want to kiss him. Hard! This is by far the best Mexican/Texmex I've  tasted thus side of the country.  Yeea-haw, Señor Paco. Ride on! Ps: fajitas are pricey but come with a whole second plate of fixins, and for my tacos, I mixed and matched and the brisket in tacos was Di-Vine! I'm really happy now...purr-purr
Absolutely love pacos!!!! Phenomenal food for an amazing price! Pacos hits it out of the park every time I come!

This was my first time eating at this place and everything from the service to the food was amazing. The server Robert was excellent and knew  the menu really well. Some of the best salsa I've had at a Mexican restaurants and the tacos were well portioned so you can really get away with just one for your meal. Will definitely be back to this place!

Every time I am Charlotte I will eat here. We wound up here because it was right behind our hotel. The atmosphere is fun. The food selection is great and very reasonably priced. If you like pork go for the Al Pastor taco. The free salsa was delish with a nice little kick. I want to go back again tonight!

Really good food, prices are okay considering the location.  A little bit of a corporate chain feel, but the food is very good.  Chicken quesadilla has carmelized onions which really put it over the top.  Also had the tres leches for desert which was awesome.  Give it a try

I went here with a friend the other day and I have to say hands down best steak quesadillas in town! I had the wood grilled skirt steak quesadillas. I also had their watermelon margarita which was very refreshing. The service was also great. I will definitely be going there again!

This is decent tex-mex. I had the "pacos taco's" and they were pretty good. Not a fan of the beans and I love beans. My margarita was ok but they are not generous with the tequila. We were there for lunch and it was not really busy. I could tell from the set up that they probably have a great happy hour.
We ate here in late Dec.  Food was good, service was excellent, atmosphere enjoyable.  The problem was that we both had real stomach issues the next day.  Has anyone else had a problem?
Possibly the best restaurant in Charlotte. Tacos are amazing especially the Al Pastor. Large portions, great list of beers and tequila. Can't say enough great things about this place. A must try!

this place is consistently great. i have been here so many times and have never had a bad meal or bad experience. the shake down shrimp tacos are delicious and it is more than enough food. their salsa is also great! perfectly spiced. would highly recommend this place!

I thought this place was great.  A really nice atmosphere and great place for kids.  I read the food reviews in advance and tried the chicken taco and my husband had the chicken taco and bbq shrimp taco combo.  The tacos were great, although, beware, the bbq taco is quite spicy like it states, but very tasty.  The portions were large.  I ordered a single taco, beans and rice and was full and my husband had the two taco combo and was stuffed (guess it could have been those two beers as well!).  He was also pleasantly satisfied with the beer selection.  For those who have small children, the cheese quesadillas are quite tasty.  Generous with the cheese and not grilled to a hard exterior like most places.  And all kids meals come with a free scoop of real vanilla ice cream.  That kept our 20 month old busy for a while.  And the customer service, albeit it the place is still relatively new and trying to make a good impression, was outstanding.  We are pretty picky when it comes to restaurants and it's nice to have a good option for good food when you're in the mood for mexican.  We will definitely be going back and I would highly recommend it if you haven't tried it already.

This place is a gem! I HATE tex mex with a passion and I was weary to try it out but we will definitely be back! It was seriously so good! I got the house margarita for $5 and the tequila they used was high end. The queso dip and salsa were both spot on. I got the veggie enchiladas and they were to die for! Smothered in a black bean sauce they were seasoned well with goat cheese inside. A-maz-ing. My date got three tacos, the fried chicken was his favorite but the steak one was a little fatty he said. Other than that, I can't wait to go back!

Fun restaurant located in the very popular South Park area. Made an 830p reservation and were sat within minutes of our arrival. Justin our waiter was on point and incredibly friendly. It was restaurant week. We opted to order off the menu instead of have the $30 per person coursed meal. We ordered Guac for the table. While it's made table size, they never asked how spicy we wanted it and overall I thought it was too bland to order again. Next time we will try the chorizo queso. The shrimp tacos are very tasty and pineapple margaritas amazing. Our table enjoyed the peanut butter pie as well. Service is quick but they don't rush you out. We will be back.
Definitely the best tex Mex restaurant in South Park! Everything is good but the stuffed jalapeños and the brisket tacos are my favorite. Service is always great, too.

With all the great reviews we decided to try this place.   Wasn't happy, of course were used to Texas Mexican food.   The refried beans taste funny to us.  The tacos weren't anything to writ about.  I guess a lot of NC's love this place,  but we won't be back.  We r too spoiled with our Mexican restaurants in Texas.

One of the best dining experiences I have ever had. The service was spectacular! (Jaun L)  Drinks and chips were constantly refilled and the food came out quickly.  Up there with just about the best Mexican we've ever had. Tacos are excellent and everything is very fresh. I can see why this place is so busy.  A must go for anyone that likes Mexican.
excellent food and service. not your average tex mex. the avocado cream is outstanding - never had it before. i recommend the chicken enchiladas. this place is just what south park needs!

Absolutely fantastic meal! Shawna the Manager on shift was amazing. She visited our table at least three times and at exactly the right time. Wait staff was as good as any that we have experienced including high end restaurants.   Now to the food - guacamole was simple but excellent- margarita with no name was simple but excellent - Paco's tacos - shrimp - turkey were the best.   We will definitely be back.

Atmosphere: a little noisy but not unbearable. Fun decor. Good energy.   Food: Chips and salsa solidly delicious. I had the combo plate - everything was pretty great, but didn't knock my socks off from a flavor perspective.   Service: Tyler was awesome. Super friendly and took care of everything we needed   Drink: I probably should have asked about what was in the Mexican Mule. It tasted pretty much like a margarita but pretty sweet and sour. Not my favorite!
This place is great!  Awesome Tex-mex menu options, fun atmosphere.
I love this place.  It's a regular stop for my co-workers and I during the week.  I normally get one of the enchilada meals but last week decided to try the Taco Salad and it was amazing!!!
We had a reservation but still had to wait a long time to be seated.  The food was Ok but for the price not that great.

Good chips and salsa? good guac? Check! Location and ambiance? OK.   Service:  It had potential to be good but our server kept coming back every ten minutes, even after we told her we would be taking out time. Maybe she had good intentions, but we felt very rushed. It was later in the night and although the restaurant was kind of full, there wasn't a wait for other customers.   Veggie tacos: LITTERALLY some cabbage. That's it. Oh, and one slice of a pepper. Huh?

Great food, great drink and great service. Every time I have been here, which is often has been a great meal.   The tacos, burritos and enchiladas are amazing and trumped only by the cheese dip. They could stand to have a better beer menu, but that's the only flaw I can find. Eat here and I'd get the tequila flight if you are a tequila fab.
Food was good, service was good.  Glad we made the reservation.  There was a 45 minute wait but we walked right in and sat right down.  Nice Job Paco's Tacos!!
Excellent food. Attentive service. Dining room was a bit dated but otherwise great value for the price.

The hubs and I visited for lunch over the weekend. We started with white queso and added ground beef. The chips seemed very fresh and like most queso, we made it disappear quickly. The salsa was excellent. We both ordered enchiladas. His were "de Dennis" and looked a lot better than my run of the mill cheese enchiladas. Service was prompt and friendly. We will definitely give it another go.

Love love love this place!!  It's my new favorite!  Delicious Mexican!!  And, what makes it really great are the AMAZING margaritas!  It is SO worth paying a little extra for quality top shelf.  Service is always 5 stars as well!

Went here with my girlfriend on a Friday night, made reservations for 6pm. Sat at a 4 top which was nice. Chris was out waiter, he was awesome. Knowing this was our first time there he gave us some suggestions. Atmosphere was good, family friendly too. We'll definitely be going back with a couple of our foodie friends soon. Oh, and the margaritas are on point too.

I like this place for its drinks and food. Nothing fancy but reasonably priced good  food. Great after work stop  for a drink or cold brew salsa and chips. Friendly staff. Definitely Tex-mex with good brisket. The tacos are the draw, but there are lots of other items on the menu.
Good, inexpensive Tex-Mex food. Nothing really outstanding, but a fun place to go.
Great atmosphere, food excellent and staff very friendly.  I've been many times and always consistent experience!!!

LOVE Pacos Tacos!! Every time I dine here they deliver - good service, tasty food and fun upbeat atmosphere. I recommend going if you haven't been and make to order the table side guacamole and the signature Paco taco!

Had 3 tacos: Al pastor - Paco taco - Smokey Brisket....Came with rice, slaw and ordered refried beans.  All 3 tacos were horrible...rice and slaw no flavor.  Salsa and chips were good.  Service was ok.  This is not a Mexican Restaurant by any means. $13 for 3 tacos? Not unless the cow or pig was brought from the Sahara desert.  First and last time for me.

I really like this place. It's a Mexican restaurant for Americans. What I mean by that is the food is not too complicated, yet completely delicious and a great place to go when you're looking to fill a "chips and salsa" void. I've been here at least five times and I haven't yet been disappointed.   It's a great place for a group of young people looking to have a good time and drink margaritas ... as well as a great place for a family with small children. It accommodates just about anyone ... young or old. And that's why I like it.   Before I dined at Paco's Tacos I thought it was a "dive type place" with cheap Mexican food. The name kind of led me to think that.   Well, once I finally went to Paco's I discovered it's just the opposite. It's not a little "Mom and Pop" place, nor is it a dive restaurant. Paco's is not super cheap but also not crazy expensive. It's a little more upscale than the majority of Mexican restaurants in the Charlotte area. With that said, if you're looking for fancy, there are a few nicer upscale "Spanish influenced/Mexican restaurants" in the Charlotte area.  Anyway, as far as Paco's Tacos goes this place is yummy. They give you chips and salsa like all Mexican restaurants and are great with refilling both as needed. There salsa is chunky and slightly spicy and really gets your taste buds going.   The past few times I've been there I've ordered the Taco's. You can get two or three it's up to you and the options are endless.    They give you the choice of house made flour tortillas, house made wheat tortillas, low carb tortillas, crispy yellow tacos or soft corn tortillas. "I like the crispy tacos". Normally when I'm going to Paco's I'm craving Americanized Mexican food and this place is perfect for that. When I'm craving more complicated Spanish influenced food I go somewhere else ... but that's another review.  Your taco meal is served with red rice and citrus chipotle slaw and your choice of charro, black or refried beans. I really like both the black and refried beans.  I normally get two tacos but my three favorite to choose from are the:  GRINGO BEEF Taco Seasoned ground beef, lettuce, pico de gallo, guacamole and mixed cheeses. "Very all American"  PACO'S TACO - a slightly spicy Beef Brisket Taco. Before you get it the chili rubbed beef brisket is slow roasted for 6 hours with caramelized onions and chipotle bbq sauce. YUM!  or the:  WOOD GRILLED CHICKEN Onions and bell peppers, lettuce, pico de gallo, guacamole and mixed cheeses "This one just tastes fresh and delicious"   I've had a ton of other things at Paco's but I keep coming back to these three taco choices. They're just YUMMY!  If you're looking for a drink and aren't sure what to get their margaritas are perfect. I'm pretty simple when it comes to drinks so I go with a traditional margarita on the rocks with salt. Try it you won't be sorry.   If you're looking for a starter while waiting for your entree go with this one:   UNHOLY GUACAMOLE 9 Yum ... and the best part is it's made fresh at your table.   Honestly you can't go wrong if you stick with the Mexican staples. The food won't disappoint and the ambiance is great for just about anyone.   Enjoy!

I work nearby and LOVE this place! Service is quick and friendly and the food is always delicious. The unholy guacamole and queso is a must - they make the guac right in front of you exactly the way you like it!! Single taco + salad is a great deal for those that can't help but gorge themselves on the salsa and bottomless chips beforehand. This place rocks, I've never been disappointed!!!

Outstanding meal and fun place to eat. My wife and I enjoyed the drinks, the atmosphere, and the wonderful food. Excellent service! The chips and salsa -really good. When dining for Mexican food in Charlotte, we will definitely be coming back. Try the quesadilla or the chimichanga - you will not be disappointed.

Love this tex-mex restaurant. The tacos, especially Paco's taco, a brisket taco, cannot be beat. Unfortunately, they "had" the best fish taco, but changed the recipe and the new one is not the same caliber. When choosing a restaurant I look for drink specials, quality of food, and atmosphere. This place hits all 3 well! Would prefer TV viewing from all tables in case a game is on and I want to post up. There can be a wait and not always able to get my preference of table to meet this goal.
I love this place!! Their guacamole is one of the best!  Love their brisket tacos too!  Love coming here!

This review is based solely on food and experience. I did not get to partake of any tequilas or margaritas, but I was not looking to drink alcohol on this lunch occassion.  To start with, we ordered some chili con queso. Our server then prompted us, "do you want the white queso, or the chili con queso?". Only the chili con queso is listed in the menu, so I had to ask about the white queso. $5 gets you a small bowl of Velveeta product with some rotel in it. Something you can easily make at home.   For lunch we ordered a chicken quesadilla (for my partner) and I ordered the chopped salad. Once again, we were prompted with an option that is not listed in the menu- "would you like the small salad, or the large salad?" Our server had a hard time explaining the difference in size, but eventually she got it out. I'm glad I got the small size, but if you want the small size and you want to add chicken to it like I did, be prepared for a $11 salad. The dressing was tossed in with the salad, but I wish I'd asked for it on the side, because I was underwhelmed with the overall flavor of the salad as a whole. The chicken appeared to be pounded out flat, and was dry. Nothing special here.  While we were waiting on our food, I took a look around at some other plates...Now, I get that the tacos are what they're known for, but $11 for two tacos is just absurd in my mind. I am a taco afficianado, and the ones that i saw on other plates just didn't look all that great. Best way to serve a taco is simply corn tortilla, meat, onions, and cilantro. Authentic, and less than $2 at a true mexican restaurant. I get that it's tex mex, but if you're out for authenticity, Paco's Taco's is not the place to go. Venture on to South Blvd, or Eastway if you want the real deal.... you could feed four people for the price of two here.

love this place! they have the best fajitas ever, and they use amazing ingredients. The bbq buttered corn is my favorite side... i dont get the beans and rice so they will give me two sides of corn instead.very accommodating. my favorite place to eat Mexican. the drinks are great too!

My visit to Paco's Tacos was mixed.  I was immediately disappointed to learn that they no longer offered the option to "build your own" margarita. I had been looking forward to that after reading about it in a number of reviews.  Instead I ordered from their decent list of "specialty" margaritas. I had the Paco's Eldorado on the waitress' recommendation. It was good margarita, but perhaps a bit too sweet for me. In fairness, the waitress said it was one of the sweeter ones and she was right.. For my second drink, I had the Firestarter which has their homemade jalapeno-infused tequila and ginger beer. This drink was really good, but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone who has a low tolerance for spicy food but I would definitely order it again.  For my meal I had the three taco combo.  First up was the Paco's Taco, a beef brisket taco "slow roasted chili rubbed beef brisket with caramelized onions and chipotle bbq sauce."  This one had come highly rated from a friend and several of the online reviewers.  Honestly I don't get it.  What I got was a tortilla with a huge lump of dry flavorless meat. I didn't detect any onion or bbq at aall. A huge let down.  Next I had the Big River Fish Taco. This was better than the Paco's Taco. The mango salsa was a nice touch.   Finally the Shake Down Shrimp Taco. This was by far the best of my three tacos. Nice flavor and the right amount of shrimp.  The shrimp were not as hot as I would have liked but tasty nonetheless.  The complementary chips and salsa (both red and verde) were good and the staff did a great job keeping our chip bowl full.  Our waitress was also quite good and checked on us frequently but not so much as to be a nuisance.

Well, Charlotte's access to Tequila certainly does NOT suck! I wrote a Guide to Tequila last year for a magazine, and got great help at Paco's. We received tremendous service, despite the place being typically jam-packed on weekends. The tacos are always good, though I have seen some limpid side salads here every so often...
I came on a mini vacation to Charlotte, and decided to try Paco's Tacos. It was a great pick. The waiter was very attentive and welcoming to our needs. I highly recommend, the food was excellent.
Great Mexican restaurant with excellent atmosphere and delicious food to boot. Ask for Lance...the best waiter and bartender in Charlotte!

Not many bad things to say- chips weren't hot and needed a little salt but main dish was amazing.You have the choice of whole wheat or white flour, crunchy, or low carb tortillas. I got one pacos taco (beef brisket, queso fresco, cabbage, caramelized onions & cilantro) and a turkey club carnitas taco (shredded turkey, avocado, lettuce, jalapeno bacon, tomato, avocado ranch )both on whole wheat tortillas- the turkey was UNbelievable. Came with choice of charro beans (pintos cooked with brisket and bacon), black, or refried and a side of rice and slaw. Pretty big crowd for a Tuesday night, would recommend getting there before 6 on a weekday, and earlier on a weekend.
Very good - higher end- Mexican food.  Very unique tacos.  I got the bbq flavored taco and the shrimp taco.  Would definitely order again.  Clean, good service, good atmosphere.

The chips and salsa are so fresh and tasty that I could fill up on just those. They're addictive! We love the Paco's Taco with braised beef and charro beans. They have so many different tequilas & their drink menu is extensive and impressive. Margaritas are unbelievable. Highly recommended.

Stopped by this place as we were heading out of town from a business trip. It was a southwestern type authentic Mexican food restaurant. We both had tacos. I had the skirt steak taco and husband had skirt steak taco and their Paco taco. Lots of choices for different types of tortillas and beans. Both plates of food came with choice of beans. We tried the retried and black beans which were both good as well as their rice. It was too early for margaritas as it was on a Sunday and NC law requires you wait till 12 to drink. NC residents should vote that law away- lol. Great place for Mexican food. Service excellent.

YIPEEEEE HALF-PRICED FAJITAS EVERYDAY 4-6!   Whoops, I got carried away.  Shall we proceed with the review?    I can't believe I've driven by this place so many times, and missed it's existence.  Tucked away in the back corner of the shopping center featuring William Sonoma and Bricktops, you almost have to know it's there or you could miss it.   The service was really friendly, quick, unpretentious, and as soon as we sat down, a bowl of hot crispy chips appeared at our table, with two salsas.    I was THRILLED with my steak and shrimp combo fajitas.  The tortillas are made fresh in house. LOTS of juicy, caramelized peppers and onions, and some kind of butter melted over it for extra decadence. Plenty of toppings and goodies (which is what I love about fajitas!) mean lots of ooey-gooey-drip-down-your-hand-and-arm goodness.   Our server also recommended the Paco's Tacos and shrimp tacos, which were also super flavorful.  The brisket is smoked for 6 hours, and extra tender, perfectly seasoned...the shrimp, breaded and fried, and a bit sweet from the cabbage. If I weren't such a fajita fanatic, I would have downed both tacos.   Notes: Lots of drink specials.  Manager walked around to check up on us several times. Nice dining room area with booths and TV's...another bar area with LOTS of tequila, and another side section of dark polished wood stools...and an outdoor seating area. Next time we have friends in town, this would be a good place to have a gathering.   Bottom Line:  I'm not a connoisseur of Mexican or Tex Mex or whatever Paco Taco is associated with...but it's mighty tasty, and just feels like a comfortable restaurant I'd like to come back to again and again.   PS:  Had the fried ice cream...which is good, but what I liked about it was the marshmallow fluff on the side!
Excellent fajitas, queso, and pacos tacos. Good prices. Good atmosphere. Great service. Highly recommend.

I read the reviews and since it was a rainy cold day and I was walking this looked like a great choice for an early dinner.  When I got there I was promptly greeted and took a seat at the bar.  I ordered a bowl of the Chicken Enchilada soup and it was huge!  It was filled with pulled chicken and was certainly a meal all of its own!  The flavor was good, but was missing something in the broth.  That being said, I would definitely order it again but just a cup so I could try more tacos!  The chips were warm and crispy and the salsa had a great slightly smoky taste.  They were fantastic!  The bartender also made me a margarita on the rocks and it was really good, however it was too sweet for my taste and I didn't even finish it completely!  I really wanted to try a "street" taco and ordered a fish taco.  It was good, the batter was a bit salty, but overall it was good!   I will definitely go back on my next trip to Charlotte to try something else on the menu as overall this was a very tasty meal and I would recommend it.  The price was relatively inexpensive and was a good value for the quantity.

Stopped in for lunch and we were seated quickly. The menu had plenty of options and I went with the soup/salad on a rainy day. The tortilla soup and chopped salad with smoked pork hit the spot! I will return and recommend this place for lunch or dinner.
These posers don't allow dogs on their patio. Way to turn away customers! Suck it nerds!!
Great food and always get good service reservations really help when you want to get seated quickly, the house is always packed!

Good food and excellent service!  Had the brisket and bbq shrimp tacos with charro beans and rice.  All excellent! (and mine was not fatty at all)  Also they have a good beer, margarita, and tequila menu!  Best of all - the service was great.  Our server was attentive and personable and really seemed interested in our comments on the meal.  The only reason I did not give it a 5 is because I think they are still working out some of the menu items since it is so new and I am not sure I am a fan of the warm tomato-y salsa (although the chips were great!).  I will go back!

This place was awesome!!! The customer service was great and everyone was very pleasant. The food was really good and even though my taco came out cold they took it back and brought me a fresh hot one in a timely manner. Our waiter was very knowledgeable of the menu. The pineapple mint margarita was fantastic!

Having lived in Texas, we are continually on the hunt for great Mexican food. Sadly, we will have to continue hunting. All 3 of us had their fajitas, and we were all dissapointed. Both the chicken and beef were bland, the onions and green peppers over cooked with strong butter flavor, and the beans were not "tasty". Why the 3 stars then? Well, they are doing the tortilla shells correctly. Freshly made, and very good. Its a start. And their chips were great, and service prompt and friendly. Hopefully they improve everything else...(along with their marg prices. $14 for a reg size. Really?)

After my 3rd visit, I figure I owe this place a review. I originally discovered this place one Sunday afternoon while in search of a bad-ass margarita. Winner Winner Chicken Dinner! The cocktail list, or rather, Margarita list is awesome. I usually don't care for new twists on classic cocktails, but these guys got it right. I suggest the "Firestarter" a vodka martini w/ fresh muddled Jalapenos, it's aptly named. And their newest addition, "the Ruslty El Camino" which is essentially a classic margarita w/ blood orange puree. Their tacos are awesome, even if you don't eat meat: check out their whitefish taco, or their calamari taco, they both rock. Bonus points: I took a vegan, and there were numerous options, all of which she enjoyed. It's hidden in South Park, so I've never had to wait for a table, and they play great music: lots of Wilco, Johnny Cash, and even a little Drive By Truckers. Great, now I'm hungry.

Authentic Mexican taqueria? Nope! Paco's Tacos is unabashedly Tex-Mex fusion at its best. Shortly after opening, it became our go-to spot in South Park and hasn't fallen from its lofty perch.  I honestly haven't had a bad item on the menu, but some of my favorites are the (free!) tomatillo salsa, the Shakedown Shrimp taco and the fajitas. Yes! Fajitas! These aren't your typical chain restaurant fajitas, but ones made with top notch ingredients fried in drawn Mexican butter. Oh, and don't forget about the namesake Paco's Taco, made with spice, tender beef brisket barbecue, that sums up the Tex-Mex fusion philosophy perfectly. And the margaritas are good, especially the tequila infused Firestarter. And the guacamole. And the specials. And they always have a Shiner Bock seasonal on tap. And... OK, you get the idea, right? At Paco's Taco's, it's ALL good!
Awesome shrimp tacos. Best mexican rice! Tabelside guacamole! !!! Great service. Looking forward to being a regular.

We ate here as a family with some out of town guests. Everything about it was fine. The food was fine. The service was fine. We ordered the guacamole app and everyone liked it. My son and I split the fajitas and the chicken was decent. Overall, I would go there again if someone really wanted to but felt like I could make better Mexican at home. The food was far from authentic and it is a Mexican restaurant for people who consider The Olive Garden to be real Italian food.

Why did you change the chips and flour tortillas!? They were the best part about this place. Definitely a few of the things that set you apart from other Mexican restaurants in the area. My husband and I were so bummed the past couple of times we have been in. The changes might not be noticed by newcomers but if your loyal paco's fans you notice the difference right away!
The bacon wrapped jalapenos can't be missed. Also don't forget to eat the enchiladas deDennis, whoa!!! Wait staff is friendly and service is quick!!

While this isn't Mexican food per se, it is really decent for Americanized Tex-Mex. Very friendly and attentive service, good decor. The margaritas are made with lime juice, not sour mix; always a welcome item. Fresh made table side guacamole is really good as well, and can be tailored for spice/seasoning level. I usually get the Enchiladas De Dennis, but the fajitas are good too, and the charro beans are on point.  Great place for lunch too, they service a large business park, and know how to turn and burn for lunch time.

Ive been here a number of times now and can safely say its one of my favorite tex mex restaurants in town. To me its Mexican with a texas kick. its not your traditional Mexican menu. I like that!  Mixed drinks are great, Ive tried a couple and im not a mixed drink kinda guy. but ill do it here. I don't know why manzettis (if that's how you spell it) didn't make it. the layout of this place is perfect in my book.  Staff is very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. if they tell you its good it is.
Super close to where I worked so I went frequently and can say the service was never poor and the food was awesome on point! The Queso is delicious!

Their food is pretty good. I would go back if others were suggesting it but probably not a choice I'd make on my own. I enjoyed the food and atmosphere, but think there are better Tex-Mex options in Charlotte.

Really enjoyed my experience at Paco's Tacos last night.   Had a group of 10-12 people we were planning on, was able to call in and make a reservation with no problem, even though some of our party wasn't going to be there until after our reservation time.  Waiter and helpers were fantastic.  Did a great job explaining the different drinks and different menu items that were new to us.  The appetizers are pretty good, especially the unholy guacamole.  The bottlecaps/pickle chips appetizer was ok, however I was disappointed by the amount of fried jalapenos we got, they were hard to find and the dish was mostly fried pickles.  Entrees were great.  I got the Paco's Taco (brisket) and BBQ Shrimp.  Others were raving about the Gringo taco, Enchiladas, Skirt steak and Chicken.  No one was unhappy with their food.  Drinks were inventive, including the mango infused vodka drink with ginger beer.  You also can't beat a 20 oz. draft of Shiner for $5, at least not at a restaurant.  Overall was a great experience.

I'm not from Charlotte, so when looking for Tex Mex, a friend highly recommended Paco's. I've been there three times and have always had an excellent experience. It has a good clientele, great food, great drinks and great prices. It also has a warm, pleasant atmosphere. I can't wait to get back down to Charlotte!

I think this place is pretty badly overrated.  I like it fine, and the size of the tacos is pretty great, but I don;t think it is the greatest and I would be perfectly fine not going there again.  Better than last time, however.

I enjoy Paco's Tacos & Tequila when I need to get my Tex Mex fix in Southpark.  I can't get enough of their salsas and chips.  I am also salivatingly into their beef brisket tacos.  They are a must-get.  I had an interesting cocktail called firestarter or firebreather or something.  Its primary ingredient is jalepeno infused tequila.  It was pretty cool.  It astounds me that a drink has been created that is spicy and sour at the same time.  I don't know how good it is for business though because it prompted me to sip slowly.  There was a 30 min or so wait on prime time Sat night, but service was good and price was reasonable.  2 brisket tacos with rice, beans and chipotle slaw for $10!

This is a great tex mex place.. There food is always good and the service is great. Lots of tequilas to choose from and they have good Margarita specials as well. They are well know for the good tacos but this time I got the chicken chopped salad and it was great.. The portion was very large. I got a small and it was more then enough. We really like there white cheese queso..

Tried it for restaurant week. I don't think they realize this is supposed to be Mexican and not BBQ. Queso has smoked ground beef as do the tacos. Pork carnitas ., same. Tortilla soup tastes like Campbell's vegetable soup in a can. The chicken was shredded bits and it's all veggies. No tortilla strips! We thought the food was just awful

Stopped in with my husband and two kids because we happened to be in the area on a Friday late afternoon. The service and good were both amazing and the margaritas were top notch!! Will definitely be back!

We went here for lunch.  I've been here a few times now.  I usually order a burrito, but I don't reallty like the sauce they put on top of them and I always feel so full and tired when I got back to work afterwards.    Yesterday, I went with fish tacos and they were really good!  Homemade tortilla which tastes great and the taco itself was delicious.  It comes with a side of rice and beans.  I got the black beans.  These were both meh.  It's a good place to go if you work in Southpark for lunch-they are really quick about getting you taken care of for a quick bite.
I loved this place! Affordable quality food. Bottomless chips and salsa! Great service! I could go on!

First, to say that I'm passionate about anything that resembles Mexican/TexMex would be an understatement.  My first issue was the 10 minute wait, meanwhile, 25% of the tables were empty. Salsa was average, soup was uninspired and my meal (1 fish taco 1 skirt steak taco) was average at best.  If you live near Southpark and absolutely have to have Mexican, it might be worth a shot.  Otherwise, stick with Cabo or Loco Lime.

Pacos's has the best tacos in Charlotte, hands down. The Paco's taco is definitely my favorite on the menu but the gringo beef is another, more traditional option that is also fantastic. Do yourself a favor and order some guacamole before dinner, they make it right in front of you and it never disappoints.

We had a reservation made one month in advance, called to confirm day of as it was a larger party. When we arrived there was a party taking the only larger table and we had to wait 1/2 hour before sitting.  Once the bill came, it cost $210 for 3 pitchers of margaritas, what??? Should have ordered 3 amazing bottles of wine anywhere else for that price. Heads up management, pitchers traditionally are what you order to save money! My food was decent (shrimp tacos) but other people complained about dry beef etc. Disappointing to make a reservation for no reason, inexcusable!!

I've visited this restaurant several times now so it certainly has that "IT" factor that keeps ya coming back for more.  I typically come in the evening times so its usually fairly busy but never to where my date & I have to wait to be seated. In face we've managed to get the same exact booth on every single visit (what are the odds of that LoL) The staff is really good about letting you know what drink specials are offered as well as food to recommend. My date has always been a huge fan of the "unholy guacamole" (and now i'm a fan too) which is freshly prepared right at the table side to make sure it's just like you want it. The classic margarita is solid but the grapefruit version wasn't all that tasty (or was just mixed poorly) so drinks maybe hit or miss there. The main course usually does not disappoint, I have been experimenting with various tacos, the traditional seems to go better with the hard shell, but the soft shell works better with the more exotic choices on the menu. The meals are filling and haven't been able to muster up room for desert but they do make sure to offer it to you if you desire it. The atmosphere is pretty lively, they have a patio area if you choose to dine outdoors and there are also plenty TV's locked in on sports if you want to catch a game. I'm looking forward to hanging out here Cinco De Mayo or really anything you are in the mood for a good mexican dish, I would make my way over Paco's pronto!

Great food. We got in late to our hotel from our flight and were looking for a place to eat. Friendly staff and they were more than accommodating to my wife's allergy. Recommended if you're visiting Charlotte. Minor nit - they may want to consider some wall hangings or white noise to dampen the background noise.

if you like tequila then go here. what a great selection!   chips great. salsa  really nice. tomatillo sauce outstanding. the very best tortilla soup I have ever had. delish.  fish tacos were really good.  good feel in the restaurant and the servers / bartenders were extremely friendly and helpful. check it out.
Just moved to the area and we found us our New Mexican spot! Tasty as all hell and super neat interior! Service was excellent
Service when you sit down at bat should not take 10 plus minutes to order.  Hire more help.
Best margaritas in town!  Food is affordable & very delicious! Best chicken tacos I've ever had!

This right here is some goooooood tex-mex food. Probably my favorite in Charlotte. Who am I kidding, definitely my favorite in Charlotte. They have a very small outdoor patio (3 or 4 tables). There is literally always a wait here so come early or plan ahead with a reservation. Food has tons of flavor and is prepared perfectly.

We made a reservation for my wife's birthday and we were glad we did. The wait on a Thursday night was 45 minutes. Also, it should be said that their salsa tastes like straight hot cilantro. So if you're not a cilantro fan - stay away. We ordered the large queso ($8) - it tasted like the stuff that we get it of the plastic bowl from Harris Teeter. I ordered the quesadilla and it was okay - small and the chicken lacked flavor. My wife ordered the tacos and the carnitas were dry. Our service was sub-par especially when we sent our tacos back and the server kept asking us if "everything was good" - we basically will not be going back to Paco's again.

I came here for lunch with work for the first time last week. The place was packed and the inside looked pretty fun, so I was expecting everything to be amazing.  Nothing here was bad, just lackluster.   In the restaurant's defense, I ordered a salad... which I guess is pretty boring most places, but I think it's a restaurant's time to shine. Anyway, I ordered the Chopped Salad, which is vegetarian EXCEPT for the dressing. So I substituted the Chipolte Bacon Ranch for the Honey Cilantro Lime dressing. Otherwise the salad was good, just boring and VERY skimpy on the toppings.  Highlight of my experience? The chips and salsa were good!   Even though the place was slammed, we did have really great, quick service. Well, except for my friend asked for no sour cream on his salad and it was there anyway.. but that's a kitchen problem I suppose.  I would be willing to try Paco's again, but can't say I'm terribly thrilled to do so at this point.

I've been wanting to try this for almost a year, since I first heard of it. It good good ratings and reviews. So instead of Cheesecake factory I convinced my wife to go here instead. Wish I hadn't! Only thing good was chips and salsa served before the meal. If you like bland, tasteless, flavor deficient, Americanized Mexican food you'll probably like this food. I however can count at least 5 maybe 6 Mexican food restaurants around Charlotte better than this place. (Verde, Vida, El Paraiso, Que Onda, Pio Pio, On The Border) Besides the flavor deficient food, the furnishings were old and dirty, whole place needs a good cleaning. Waitress didn't listen to my order very well, and brought me something I didn't order. So that was a wasted $50. Never again will they get my money. I was sadly disappointed!
My husband and I absolutely love this place. I'm quite picky when it comes to Mexican food. I lived in Mexico for a while. However, this is by far the best in my opinion. Price isn't bad either!
Love this one!  The guac is sooo good!  I'm also a fan of the chicken fajita soup!  The service and food is always consistently good!

Found this place on yelp.  In a nice little very clean shopping area (the restaurant was packed but they text you when a table is ready so having the nice shopping area to walk around helps).  We took one lap around, went back in and found a seat right at the bar so we were able to cancel the "reservation".  The guac is made tableside and is a must.  All the typical ingredients including 2 avocados.  Almost a meal by itself.  My wife and I split three tacos (fish, pulled pork and I cant remember).  All were excellent.  Margaritas, the defining item at a Mexican restaurant were really good!!  We had both with and without the house made mixture.  Not too sweet or sour or acidic.  Very nice!!!  While we were staying at a close by hotel, this place is worth a side trip.

We used to like going to this place. With the gluten friendly options it was a pretty decent place to eat (aside from the fact they can't seem to find a way to season ground beef without wheat - yet other restaurants do it all the time). However last month we stopped in for dinner and I got the Turkey Club carnita taco (along with the Al pastor taco). The Turkey club taco contains shredded turkey which one would think is safer than eating something like fish that might contain random inedible objects. However I unfortunately chomped down on a rather large piece of BONE after I had eaten 3/4 of the taco. Luckily I didn't swallow it but it didn't feel good on my teeth! I put it on my plate because at first I had no idea what it was. The waitress came by and I showed it to her. She apologized and asked me if I wanted them to make me another taco. Well no - if there are bones in this one, what about others? Plus I had pretty much lost my appetite. So she took my plate away and a few minutes later the manager came by. He explained how the bone possibly could have gotten in there and apologized but didn't even attempt to offer anything to me. No drink, dessert, nothing. So we thought no biggie - most places won't charge you for something like that happening. When the bill came, we noted there was no discount on my meal (I had a BONE in my food people). I've had other restaurants surprisingly give discounts when food came out wrong/late! Now I'm not a person wanting to find fault in restaurants and get stuff for free or discounted but a bone in someone's food that I could have easily swallowed is a big deal to me. So we just paid the bill and left. The next day my fiance called to speak with the corporate office about the issue (since obviously the manager at the restaurant wasn't concerned). He left a message the first time he called. After several days, there was no response so he called again. He spoke with the receptionist who took his name/number and indicated he would get a call back immediately. It's been over 6 weeks and no one ever returned his call. Pretty pathetic customer service and the food isn't that great. We'll never go to Pacos again.

Restaurant located in a mall, next door to hotel...let's just say I had my doubts walking in, but I was pleasantly surprised. The soft tacos were delicious, the atmosphere was good and the staff was friendly.
Salsa is not good - sorry!! I'm from Texas and the salsa just tastes like lime juice.  Got the chopped salad and added chicken - super great salad!! The tortilla soup is solid also.

How this place doesn't have 5 stars is beyond me. It does get crowded, so make reservations. The volcano queso is to die for. And they have the best tacos in Charlotte. The margaritas are on the sweeter side but still fantastic. Def one of my favorite spots in the QC.

I've been here a couple times and love this place. I had lunch here today and it was amazing. The chips are thin and warm and the service is great! I had the turkey taco with rice and beans (one for $7 and it's HUGE) don't let a turkey, lettuce, avocado, and tomato taco fool you, this was absolutely incredible. By far my favorite. Idk how they cook the turkey but it tastes almost like a really good pork belly (minus the fat) and has a really great taste and texture. The guacamole is always delicious and made table side. The quality of food you get here for the price can't be beat!

I was excited to check this place out after reading the reviews on here. Unfortunate location though---across from South Park Mall but with the entrance facing the Marriott.  We went here on a Saturday afternoon and there were a few other patrons there (mostly with kids, it seems like a good place to bring them) and we were promptly greeted by the server. I was confused by the theme of it though. It has a menu full of Mexican food, the decor seemed more Western Route 66 -ish and the music was random as well. Being one that loves random stuff, I enjoyed it. Service was great and the manager even stopped by after to see how everything was and how we thought everything tasted and if it needed any more flavor or seasoning. I thought that was really awesome that they asked our opinion (even if they really didn't care). I got the ceviche why was served like a parfait in a dessert cup so I found that different but it tasted great as well did the chips and salsa.  Personally, prices seemed a little steep. $7 for one taco? No thanks, I can make one at home for $.80.
Becoming mediocre.  Went on a Friday, crowded as usual.  Food was lukewarm and margs were watered down.  Overall seems to be on downhill slide each time we go.

Great place for lunch.  Quick service, and friendly staff.  I had the taco and salad combination,  that along with the complimentary chips and salsa was almost too much food.  The slightly smokey salsa is quite addictive.  Great food at a good price.

Excellent margarita, chips and salsa, but wouldn't go back for the food.  Our server, Ashely was great and the manager came by when she heard we were disappointed with the food and offered us something else.  As we weren't hungry we didn't take her up on her offer but appreciated that she came by.  It's very noisy in this restaurant, but if you're just looking for a drink and chips and salsa, go here.  We will return when we stay at the Marriott again, but will not order food.
I've only been in Charlotte a month. Paco's is my New Mexican restaurant of choice. Chips and salsa are great and tacos are the best

Here's an update to my earlier review.   As stated before, I really WANT to like this place. However, I lunched there the other day and, sadly, have decided I'm done.   The chips and salsa are awesome and my toddler daughter was pleased with her chicken fingers. But my wife and I split the lunch chicken fajitas and they were, to say the least, the weirdest fajitas we've ever had.   I'm no Tex-Mex expert, but my experience with fajitas is that they're strips of chicken, onions, and peppers served sizzling on a cast-iron platter.  The vegetables are typically cooked just past the point of tenderness.  The fajitas brought to our table consisted of chunks of what appeared to be a small baked breast atop a pile of what appeared to be an overdone pepper/onion mash which was bitter to the taste.  The sides (guac, pico, cheese, lettuce) were excellent though.  I'm still a big fan of Frank's Cantina 1511 and Mama Ricotta's but not crazy about Big (Bad) Daddy's though or now, Paco's.

5 stars to the beverages, chips and dip!!   =)  2 stars for the food! =(     Beverages.. -Strawberry Rhubarb Margarita -Texas Mule  *Both were outstanding!!!  Food.. -Shrimp Tacos: my friend said they were not great, but not the worst.  -side of rice: the red kind, gross. It's like spicy tomato sauce on rice.  -white rice: more like the Mexican rice but still not great  -side of sauteed zucchini: burnt and very spicy
Best tacos in Charlotte! The drinks are always awesome and so is the costumer service. Anytime we are near the Southpark area we always go here!
FANTASTIC Mexican food!!!  I had the chicken & steak fajitas - Yum!!!  Also we had the beef brisket tacos & kids chicken & cheese quesadillas.  Everything was great!

We decided to try this Tex-Mex place out after reading positive reviews. The best items we had were the refried beans and chips & salsa. The salsa was richly flavored with enough heat to satisfy everyone at the table. The refried beans were delicious. Smooth and flavorful with melted cheese on top. We all had different tacos and they were fine. The margarita special that night tasted more like limeade but it was not their top shelf variety. Still on the lookout for a good Mexican restaurant.

Holy Guacamole Batman! Second time I've ate at Paco's and I must say, they live up to the great reviews and I'm not even a Mexican food kinda guy, but sweet fancy moses they have great tacos. Not like your ordinary cheap tacos - these are well made with great ingredients. Always...I mean ALWAYS order the Unholy Guacamole - they make it in front of your and it is delisioso...I believe that is Spanish for tasty. The girls digg the margaritas too and I'll always toss back a Corona while I'm at it. Gracious once again Paco.

This was my first time here. There was a wait for a Thursday Night since they had $10 top-self margaritas, but we ended up getting seated within five minutes. The food was very good and filling! You get chips upon arrival to the table. Our food came out hot and faster thn excepted and the whole staff was attentive, constantly checking if need anything and getting us refills. The reason why I didn't give all stars because in our bowl we had an overload of beans, more rice or cabbage would have been great. I will like to come back and try their tacos.

I was excited to finally try Pacos after much delay on my part getting there. For me it was just OK. Service was really good, which was a nice surprise. The food; however, was a separate surprise. Granted it could have been what I ordered too.   Ordered the enchiladas (can't remember the exact name) and there was so much cheese sauce/queso all over the dish that it was hard to gave a bite of anything, including the rice & beans, without eating cheese. Being from Wisconsin, I like me some cheese, but this was too much. Either way, I'll give it another shot because the location is great!

We went to Paco's Tacos & Tequila this past Saturday night for a late dinner (around 9:00).  It was still pretty crowded, which is impressive considering there's very little signage leading you back to this new restaurant that sits hidden in the back of a parking lot.  I guess word-of-mouth does wonders!    We were impressed by the transformation from the former Manzetti's to Paco's.  The new decor added to Manzetti's dark wood was perfectly suited for a Tex-Mex place.    A friend of mine had been recently and recommended (since I like spicy food) the jalapeno margarita.  (I think it was called the "Firestarter" on the menu?)  I ordered it, and it was fantastic.  There were other jalapeno-infused beverages offered that sounded appealing, too.  Mind you, these are ONLY for people who are serious about spicy food; they're damn hot.  Be sure to order a glass of water as an accompaniment!  The chips and salsa they serve (free!) to start were fantastic.  The chips were very light -- both in weight and taste.  I didn't feel like I was truly stuffing myself with them (which was a good thing!).  There were two types of salsa served with it -- a sweet green tomatillo one and a red spicy one (possibly habanero?).  Both tasted incredibly fresh and flavorful.    As an additional app (because it was late, we were starving, and they sounded so good), we ordered the fried pickle chips and jalapenos.  It was the perfect combination for sharing between spicy food lovers and non-spicy food lovers.   I ordered two tacos for my entree -- a fish taco and a shrimp taco.  The fish was just okay. I think it's the coleslaw that ruins it for me; I'm not a fan of cabbage.  The BBQ shrimp taco was awesome, though.  I think next time I would order a quesadilla like my partner had, since I don't really need the rice and beans.  The quesadilla was huge, packed full, and came with fresh-made pico de gallo and guacamole (with chunks of avocado in it).      Would I recommend Paco's?  Heck yeah.  For many reasons.  It's a great casual dining experience, offers drinks and salsas that other Mexican restaurants don't, and it's fun for all.

Loved it!  The food was fantastic (tortilla chip encrusted fish was outstanding.)   The first time I had Paco's Tacos was catered at a birthday party.  I swore we'd make it to the restaurant SOON after I gobbled 3 plates of tacos, fajitas, salad, chips, guacamole...  Anyhow, FF a few months and we finally made it there.  I was worried it would be too much of a bar atmosphere for our little high chair patron, but was so excited to find it extremely kid friendly.  Crayons and other toys to distract the little ones....we were able to enjoy a wonderful meal of perfectly spiced guacamole, wood fired chicken (exquisite taste), and I love that they offer whole wheat tortillas.   Love the tomatillo salsa - and lots of Shiner beers on tap to choose from.  Fantastic!  DEFINITELY warrants a trip back!

Bar staff was attentive although very busy. The tacos were creative, non-traditional, and yummy! Interesting tequila infusions. Cute spot tucked away in strip mall heaven by Southpark mall. Great patio!
The atmosphere is amazing, bar is plentiful big! Tacos and black beans were phenomenal. Huge beer selection! We will be back!

Loved every bit of being at this place. It is a little tucked away so you can't see it from the street but I am so glad we found it. While we were waiting for a table, my coworkers and I grabbed a drink at the bar and they brought their chips and salsa right out to us too. Now this isn't just the normal salsa you get at every other Mexican restaurant, this salsa had a kick to it and it was so good. When we got seated at a table and again the chips and salsa came right out with no hesitation. Our server came over and she was was very friendly and gave great recommendations. Starting off we ordered the volcano queso with no pineapples and it was absolutely delicious with chopped up bacon on top. I want that recipe haha Everything on the menu looked great but I ended up going for the chimichanga and my friends went for 3 tacos each. The food portions are outrageous and I love it. I wasn't able to finish my food but really wished I could. My friends also couldn't finish and could really only eat 2 tacos.  We saw on the menu brussel sprouts and bacon and we were sold, but unfortunately we weren't impressed at all. This is a dish that is best left simple. We would suggest not shredding the brussel sprouts and maybe keeping them whole or cutting them in half. It turned more so like a slaw with the shredding and the tomatoes and we wished it wasn't.  Overall, this place is amazing! I would suggest it to everyone. Though we didn't like the brussel sprouts, everything else was to die for and this place definitely deserves a 5.

This place has authentic food with a modern American theme. The salsa was on point and delicious. The smoked Jalapeño was good but not very spicy however everything is better with bacon so still worth it for an appetizer. The Paco's Taco was melt in your mouth tender but the Skirt Steak Taco was the star on my plate. The sides are strong but not outstanding black bean, slaw and rice are nice but again not outstanding but sides shouldn't steal the thunder anyhow. Staff was friendly and efficient without being over attentive. All in all a good experience it would have received 5 stars but as is common in Taco spots the temperature of the food was a bit on the chilly side.

I loved everything I had!   Chips & salsa had a fresh quality to them with a little kick.  I had two tacos... Huge!  After the first I didn't think the second could match it but it did!  Go to this place and you will get the feel that you discovered a gem and a go-to place!

We had a great time at Paco's Tacos on Cinco De Mayo! Since I knew they would be really busy that night I made a reservation on Open Table so when we arrived our table was ready! Our server Aaron was awesome, friendly and attentive. It was really busy but he still took the time to make recommendations on food and tequila choices.  We all had tacos. The Paco's Taco was amazing and they have a huge tequila menu.   Fun, lively atmosphere.  The staff is great at making sure your needs are met. We will be back for more!
Great service, atmosphere and food. Would definitely recommend and go again. They make the guacamole right in front of you, catering it's texture (chunky to creamy) to your desire.

I am from Los Angeles and we know real Mexican food and this is not Mexican food.  The refried beans are from a can, you can taste the preservatives.  If you like boxed Mexicans rice this is the place for you.  The service was amazing they truly give you the Noth Carolina hospitality smiles.  I came here because of the reviews and I am sure the regulars here might like it and think this is Mexican food but I compare this place to Chilis bar and Grill, if there is one here. It's the Taco Bell of Mexican food.
A hidden gem!  Tacos that make you moan or is it the purity of their margaritas? No fake stuff here!

Chips and salsa were the best part of the meal. And they kept filling the basket of chips! Had the shrimp and grilled fish tacos that were ok. The fried shrimp taco was a little too salty for my taste.   It's your average Mexican food restaurant that serves the usual standards. I was hoping for something on the menu that would set them apart, but found nothing.

Paco's Tacos and Tequila was a nice time because of the choices of TK, atmosphere and service which were all very good.  Where it fell short was in the appetizer size for the money - I enjoy chicken nachos that are stacked high since tortillas are so inexpensive and taste great!  Paco's was good tasting but the chips were a single layer of chips smothered soggy by the chicken/cheese topping.  rate 2.5 The main meal was good but what I want to mention is the "fried" ice cream which another customer had about the same comments regarding the coating and presentation.  I could not tell what the coating was made of and there was adequate ice cream to share but it was soft and did not seem crispy.  served on a plate rather than in a cinnamon/sugared tortilla shell it was not what was expected.  It was eaten because I wanted to taste it and figure out what the coating was...rated 1.5 Would I return - maybe for the margaritas and chips and salsa - however, consider a TK klub and punch a card for each different tk tried and award a food item, tshirt, or discount for a meal, or something to encourage patron ship.  Will I give the food a second chance...maybe but they need to reconsider the fried ice cream...

Up and down experience. Salsa was very salty. Asked for replacement. Same. Must have been bad batch. Table side guacamole was good. Asked for spicy but no kick. I blame the jalapeños. Sometimes they are mild. Good flavor however. Asked bartender best tacos. Al Pastor. Very average and bland. Usually very flavorful at other places. Did not finish.

I'm always up for trying a new Mexican place!   For me the food is just okay, but the drinks are the real winner. We started with the guacamole and it was chunky and fresh. I loved it. The salsa here is not for me. I think the flavors and consistency are a bit off.   Whatever you do...order a margarita. They do them right here. I ordered the Rusty El Camino and it was perfect! Just the right amount of liquor with blood orange puree...gimme another please!   For my meal, I ordered the two tacos - one shrimp and one fish. Both were okay. Meh, I didn't like one more than the other. I hate the rice and slaw but the charro beans were pretty tasty. I could have done without all the sides and just tried another taco.   Either way, it's a good place to grab a margarita and some guac.
Good food. Love the outdoor seating options and appreciate the strong margaritas. Just make sure you have time to wait as there's normally a wait on the weekend.

We are not sure which was better the service or the food- both were fantastic! Our server treated us with the highest level of service that we have had in quite some time, I believe CJ was his name. The tacos had amazing flavor and the menu prices were affordable and a good value for the price.

I'd classify this place as 'solid.'   Not necessarily something I'd go out of my way for.  But,  if you're in South Park already, it's better than settling for Cheesecake Factory.  In an area of town inundated with national chains, this place feels more organic.  Also - You can get intoxicated off of the margaritas, which is a plus.

My husband had a meeting for work in Charlotte. I decided to tag a long and while searching for a place to have dinner, we realized Pacos Tacos was walking distance for us from the Marriott. Not knowing what to anticipate... Our expectations were met for sure. Great food, wonderful drinks and a fun atmosphere. We would highly recommend this restaurant as a date night or for families. Also would recommend the cucumber jalapeño margarita! Cheers

Paco's is a nice place to hang out and have some decent American style Tex-Mex in a convenient location. Nice atmosphere and you can certainly tell this is a Cantina sibling. For authentic food go to Tacqueria Mexico....

Walked by here the previous day and the place was packed with a line out the door. We figured it must be good. I made a reservation for the next day, we arrived and had to wait for a few minutes while they cleared the table. Had great seats by the window. Then the wait came. We received a glass of water and then waited. We seen the server buzzing around but evidently we were invisible. Finally she came by and I wanted a margarita. Went for strawberry on the rocks. It was very sweet and hard to explain the taste. Not very good but drinkable. I went for loaded steak tacos. Ok this made up for other things. They were very good and all the toppings were fresh. The guacamole was very good. Service did improve but the evening could have been better.

Great Tex mex spot in Southpark! I came here after work and sat at the bar. I was offered chips and salsa right away but politely declined (I can eat baskets of chips). The bartender gave me a menu and took my drink order. I opted for the fiesta bowl with grilled shrimp. The fiesta bowl is basically a deconstructed burrito - very similar to the fast casual competition. It was very tasty and the avocado that accompanies the bowl was firm but still ripe - delicious.  The crunch of the cabbage accompanied well with the black beans, three blend cheese, and rice. The shrimp was seasoned well and grilled perfectly.

Admittedly, I went for the tequila selection and did not feed, but when it comes to their tequila selection and quality, I would definitely put them at or near the top of the list of area establishments.  Next time I'll try the food...I hear that their fish tacos are great!

Best Tex Mex place in Charlotte!  A horrible experience at another similar restaurant made me realize how amazing this place is. Food is delicious, especially the tacos. They have great drink specials too. You will not regret coming here.   Enjoy it, I know I always do!

This restaurant claims to be accessible but that's a lie (around 75% of the seating here is on a sunken level). My husband and I tried to eat here this afternoon but ended up leaving due to the restaurant's disinterest in seating us. My husband has recently had foot surgery and is using a knee scooter since he can't bear any weight on his foot. When we arrived at the hostess station and the hostess saw my husband she excused herself and went to talk to someone else who was maybe a manager. Whoever this person was, he never came over but sent her back to ask us if my husband could navigate the stairs...he's using a knee scooter, it doesn't take a rocket scientist to figure out the answer to that one. When we said no she said we could sit outside. It was either "navigate the stairs" or sit outside. All this while we're staring at about 8 empty regular tables and a couple empty high top tables on the level we're on. When we declined to sit outside and said we'd go elsewhere, the hostess just said oh, ok, sorry. The person (manager) she went to talk to was standing several feet away watching this whole exchange and never once came over to offer to seat us on the ground level when it was clear we were leaving.   TLDR; Go to Chuy's!! They genuinely care about their customers and their food is much better as they serve actual Tex-Mex.

My boyfriend and I came for Valentine's Day because there is truly nothing better than Mexican food. We had great service and delicious margaritas (I had the cucumber jalapeño, while my boyfriend had the fire starter). We indulged in the delicious (free!) chips and salsa and then had our meal! I ordered the veggie fajitas and they were incredible, and such a large portion for $11. My boyfriend had a combo - just $15 for 1 enchilada, 1 quesadilla and 1 taco. I already can't wait to come back!!

So we decided to venture out of our box and decide to give Paco's Tacos a try. We are very loyal to a certain Mexican joint in Indian Trail and we never cheat on them. However we had been given a gift card to Paco's Tacos and we couldn't allow it to go to waste. We showed up on a Saturday night at 7:30 and had to wait about 20 minutes. Not bad for a Saturday. The place was crowded and loud but the chips an salsa eased my pain. They were very tasty, almost to tasty if you know what I mean. The only disappointment was the Salsa was a bit to hot for my 2 little ones and they didn't have anything milder. Bummer for my kids and bummer for me because I had to listen to them complain.   On the recommendation of our waiter, who looked like Dale Earnhardt JR. BTW, we should mix and match the tacos. I had the fried Fish Taco and the Beef Brisket Taco. The fried fish was very good, light , crispy and well seasoned. It gets an A+ in my book. The Beef Brisket was pretty bad. It tasted like Pot Roast. Even my Husband agreed with me and that NEVER happens. The taco had no Mexican flavors whatsoever unfortunately. It truly tasted like a bland Pot Roast. With the Tacos came rice (I've had better) and these beans that were called Churro Beans. OMG, they were very DELISH!!!! Pinto Beans with raw onion, bacon and some wonderful Latin spices. I could have eaten a HUGE bowl of them and left very happy. My Husband had the Calamari taco and the Shrimp taco. Both were good. I will probably stick with the Fish Tacos in the future.   All in all ,Pacos Tacos is OK not great, IMO. I will most likely give it another try. Maybe for lunch next time around.
I can't say enough good things about Paco's.  Great food, great service - we have more fun each time we visit!
Yummy fresh made guacamole and several margarita options. The tacos are small and tasty. Overall a good experience.

Paco's Tacos immediately became my 'go-to' place for Mexican food after just one visit.   To start out, do yourself a favor and order the volcano queso --- bacon, pineapple, jalapenos all buried inside the cheesy goodness. They serve it with warm tortilla shells so you can switch it up from just plain ole chips.  I've only ever ordered the tacos, and the best go-tos are the Paco's Taco (braised beef brisket FTW) & the Shake Down Shrimp. The Turkey Club & Chicken Milanesa are also good options, but  not nearly as good as my first two recommendations.   Their margs are delicious, albeit a little pricey.   PS - this place fills up fast and is notorious for 1+ hr waits.

We fled Hurricane Irma and found ourselves having lunch at this outstanding Mexican restaurant.  What a delightful surprise!  This was bar none the best Tex Mex we have ever had.  The chips and salsa were our first clue as to just how good this was to be.  Then the guacamole was off the charts.  I had the enchiladas Dennis with grilled corn and Nancy had the chicken tortilla soup/chopped salad combo.  Never have we enjoyed Mexican cuisine this much.  Add their wonderful service and this was a 10 Star experience!  Thank you, Irma....
One of the best handcrafted cocktail menus in Charlotte. Good quality food. Fun atmosphere. Usually a short wait.
Excellent customer service and Delicious food. Would definitely recommend if you're in the mood for tacos.

Maybe just a bad night. Was quoted 45 minutes and waited 70. No bueno. Better to give more of an estimate and allow patrons to be relieved if shorter time. Kitchen's timing was off because 2 of our entrees were cold. No fault of our server, Nimit, who was honest and personable. Shouts out to him. Chips and salsa were consistent. Will not be in a hurry to return.
Chips and salsa are delicious. I'd return just for those. They have a wide selection of tacos and its nice to mix and match. Solid fare. Good service.
My favorite place to eat. Staff is always good and the tacos are creative and delicious. I love the nacho and chicken appetizer and the 3 taco meal. This review us actually making me hungry!

David and I finally tried Paco's and I was really excited about checking it out. It was a-ok but didn't knock my socks off.   I am not sure why I expected it to be a lot different from Cantina 1511, but on my visit, I didn't see a huge difference.    In fact, I ended up getting the enchiladas de denis which I also order at Cantina. This comes served with red rice and your choice of beans - which for me is always black beans.  It was good, but nothing I haven't had before.   If I lived in the neighborhood, this would probably be a place I would come to more often, but since we have a Cantina 1511 in the 28277 area, we'll probably stick to that instead.

First time here. Bring a friend, bring an appetite and bring home lunch for tomorrow! I had the chi ken fajitas and it was a lot of food for one person. Great price/value for what you get. Chicken was grilled, but lacked "authentic" marinated flavor. Still very good. The borracho beans were spot on! The tortillas, I doubt are made from scratch on premise as they seemed too formed and thick like pita bread. Just an opinion - again, good.  Overall, great experience.

One needs to understand that this is a jumping restaurant with a young clientele; the ambience is okay - lively and cute - but we would not choose this restaurant for its ambience as we prefer a bit more upscale environment.  With that said, the food is really excellent.  Everything is made from scratch.  Everything including the chips (homemade), salsa, cocktails, guacamole, salad (we had the chopped and a split portion was still gigantic) and tacos (the smoked brisket ones were fabulous) was excellent.  Great flavors.  It happens to also be very reasonable for the quality and wonderful service that they provide.  We have a lot of appreciation for the amount of labor that goes into this kind of food.
Good place for margaritas and tacos. rest of the food taste was ok.

Stopped here for lunch on Sunday and was blown away. Everything was amazing! Chips and salsa were the best I have ever had. Salsa was very fresh with the perfect amount of spice. The chips were light, not greasy and deliciously salty. We also ordered the chunky guacamole which was also perfect!
