I got the garden enchiladas which were topped with a tasty green sauce that I highly recommend. The fiancé got a duo of shrimp tacos, one fried, one grilled. Both were good, but as with most things, the fried was unbeatable.   This place makes pretty much everything in house including tortillas, chips and salsa, etc, and you can definitely taste the difference!  The service as awesome too! And so was my bloody Maria which was only $5 since it was Sunday.   We went 3 days ago and I am still amazed by how delicious the food was.

I've been here more times than I can count and it's so consistently good every single visit. Paco's is ALWAYS packed, so make sure you have a reservation or plan on waiting. Seriously, I've never seen a more consistently busy restaurant. My go-to order is the chicken fajitas. The portion is huge and I can never finish everything despite my best efforts. My fiancé raves about the tacos here. I recommend two tacos for a normal meal or three if you are very hungry. The tacos are stuffed, unlike some places who skimp on the fillings. A coworker from Texas agrees, this place is the real deal. Paco's Tacos is the best Tex-mex in the QC.

Go here for lunch from time to time and the only thing I will get are the salads. They come with fresh lettuce (not brown). I tried the tacos when I first came here and I wasn't a fan. Too greasy and over filled with everything but protein. Can't go wrong with the salads. Very plentiful.

This visit brought 9 of us in for dinner, thankfully with reservations!  Jordana was a wonderful waitress, very attentive & knowledgeable about the menu & tequila.  Tortilla chips - Warm & lightly salted, with not ONE, but TWO salsas! The staple red salsa & my favorite: the verde / tomatillo. Again, Jordana kept the chip bowls filled.  My kitty margarita had just the right amount of tequila & "bite" to it & was in a reasonably sized glass.  I decided to go with the shake down shrimp taco & gringo beef taco. I'm not a big fan of beans or rice, so thankfully Jordana said I could substitute other sides. I went with the BBQ buttered corn & a double helping of the chipotle citrus slaw.  Shake down shrimp taco - lightly breaded & seasoned nicely. The shredded cabbage made a nice compliment, as did the pico de gallo.  Due to my overloading on chips, I was unable to finish the beef taco or corn. I took this home to the boyfriend & he loved both. :)  Dion L. - resident foodie! :) also wanted us all to try the chimichanga, which was AMAZING! Luckily, 4 of us shared bites of it. It was full of flavor. Dion & I commented that it tasted like something yummy from the fair.  The atmosphere was cozy & warm, it didn't necessarily have a "theme" that I could tell, although their were a lot of warm tones of brown & amber. The music was rather interesting...jumping from rock to country every other song. :D  Overall, I'm pleased with my trip to Paco's.

I was very excited to try out another of Frank Scibelli's concepts. I've been a longterm fan of Bad Daddy's and Midwood Smokehouse. I had heard good things about the tortillas and their specials. Glad we finally got this concept in the books!   Tucked behind the Williams Sonoma on Morrison, it's a secluded location that comes alive for a BIG dinner crowd. Plenty of parking in the lot and other lots surrounding the shopping center.   Our visit was for dinner recently. We had tried other nights but the way can be rather overwhelming. We made it in for an 8pm dinner.   Service was great. Seated quickly, given a good rundown of the menu and recommended a few margaritas for us to try. We obliged and tried the original marg and a mango-infused marg. Sad to say, I was rather unimpressed with the mix. I'm not much of a margaritas goer, but the balance was wrong and seemed to be thrown together rather fast without much consideration for taste. I was a little disappointed since it was a bit of a slower night in the dining room(s) and the bar. On to the meal...  Chips are great. Light, lightly salted and served with an array of salsas. The standard red salsa has a twinge of heat and an smoke to the flavor. The tomatillo is freaking great. Uhh...I think I put it on everything but my margarita. Definitely worth the tomatillo alone.   Entrees: My wife, as many know, is a vegetarian. The menu actually reads "Ask about our vegetarian options." Sadly, there aren't actual "options." Our server pointed to a few regular items that can be made sans meat. She ordered the Gringo Nachos. The only options listed on the menu are chicken, ground beef or brisket. Her order only came with the standard veggies. Rather underwhelming and definitely screaming for some more cheese.   I ordered the standard Paco's Tacos. An order of two that comes with rice and beans. The rice was pretty standard and a welcome accompaniment to my tacos. The beans, however, are a "charro" style recipe. Can't say that I'm a fan. Very burnt flavor and lacking in welcoming texture. With a generous helping of the tomatillo salsa, they were in the clear! The tacos were GREAT. Love the tortillas. Made in-house, and boy does it show. Warm, chewy and perfect floury taste. I could 5 with just the tomatillo salsa. The brisket is worth a try. Never had it on tacos before, but I would definitely order it again. Seasoned well and paired nicely with the other taco accouterment.   Price is rather fair. No complaints in that department.   I'd say there are a few things that could have been done a bit better, but we'll definitely be back to try some other options. Looking forward to those warm tortillas again soon! Thanks, Frank Scibelli for another option in the Queen City!

Hands down! They have the best salsa in town.  Right amount of heat and a hint of smoke.  Usually have a good meal; brisket is tops but their slaw is bland and lacking any flavors. Just a hint if cilantro and dry.  Good sangria too!

Went here with some co workers. Service was great, margaritas came out super fast.  We tried all 9 of the margaritas including the house special.  We had the fresh guacamole and chips (ate way to much salsa and guac).  We all did 2 tacos, slaw, refried beans with various taco wraps (I had soft corn, one guy had hard shells, other one did soft flour)  Very filling!  Would definitely go back to try other food items.  Probably wouldn't order the guacamole again since we couldn't stop eating it ha.  Need to save some space for the other food items.

This was one of my favorite tex-mex locations in Charlotte. The drinks are fantastic and the food is very good. If you try to go there on a Friday or Saturday night, be careful because the line can get long. There is plenty of places to walk around close by.

I really love this place!  The food is fantastic and fresh, and the service has been superior every time I've been there - which is about half a dozen times since moving to Charlotte in October 2014.  I was tempted to give it 5 stars - and refrained ONLY because the back room could use a little sprucing up, and the AC is down too low and the dining area can feel VERY cold. So....bring a sweater (or sit outside!) and enjoy!

I love their salsa! I always say i'm going to try something different but I very rarely do because I love their tacos so much.the signature Paco's Taco is amazing and when doing the combo, you never finish the whole thing but yay for leftovers!.  table side Guac -- you know it's fresh. you never run out of chips! I do have to say my favorite Margarita out of the ones they have as their signature cocktails is the Rusty El Camino.   i love the smoked Jalapenos, yes it's spicy but i'm used to it being half puerto rican. Its fun to watch my boyfriend eat them and after 3 bites, there is sweat dripping down his face! He's a good sport though. But how can you resist anything wrapped in bacon!  We go there a lot. It's a lot of food for a decent price..... best part... lunch the next day or if it's friday or saturday, try putting the leftovers in an omelet! So good!   AND MOST OF ALL FOR ME-- A GLUTEN FREE MENU as I have Celiac disease. everything for me is on a corn tortilla!
Food and salsa was great everything was cooked to perfection. One of the better Tex-Mex style restaurants I had in a long time.

Stopped in here for lunch and was a great experience! We were seated right away and our waiter, Matthew, came over seconds later with chips & salsa and to take our drink order. Chips were warm and fresh and salsa was delicious with a nice kick. I ordered the no name margarita which was quite yummy. They have a huge tequila offering and margarita specials every day.   I ordered one paco taco (beef brisket) and one chicken taco. They were both amazing and served quickly. Meat was very fresh and flavorful. Tacos come with beans, rice, and coleslaw on the side. The service was really attentive and definitely made the experience. Constant water refills and more chips & salsa before we even ran out. Will definitely be back next time I'm in town.

Came here for the first time for dinner and OMG seriously one of my new favorite places to eat at.  The salsa, the queso, and best of all the guacamole (made fresh by your table as you order) are a must have!  Definitely try the tacos, can't decide which one's you want, you can pick 2 or 3!  It's awesome!  Tried the fish tacos and the Paco's Taco (beef brisket taco) and they were amazing!  Our waiter Tucker was awesome!  Will definitely come here again and try their margaritas!

My wife and I eat here regularly, but most recently we had a life changing experience at Paco's.  We recently had a child and while that seems like a useless piece of information, it is, until it isnt.  You see, we had yet another sleep-deprived night last night (as all good parents do) and our beautiful demon baby couldn't stop screeching all morning. It's a Saturday morning, so what do we normally do? Oh Home Depot, Bed Bath and Beyond, we'll see. Might get a little crazy. Well, after we called our parents and both sets of them laughed at us, they gave us some of the best parental advice that's been passed down from generation to generation... drive her around!   So we did.  Plopped our little porkchop into her tank of a car seat (have you seen these things recently? That's why mom's in south Charlotte don't need to hit the gym. Doing curls with a 25# car seat will give you guns to rival Arnold) and off went.  Magically, it worked!  After cruising the mean streets of South Charlotte for an hour, we realized that we broke the cardinal rule of new parenting: don't forget to eat and drink plenty of water. My wife realized she didn't eat for the last 3 meals!  What are we to do? I flipped up the Yelp app (product placement) and we decided to stuff our faces with South Park's finest Mexican, Pacos Tacos.   We were nervous we were going to be the only ones there at 11:05AM, looking completely haggard from a tough night.   The good news?   That's where all new parents go for the "early bird special".   We were even more nervous that our hellion was going to lose it and we were going to be "those parents". You know, the ones who let their kid wail in the middle of church because they couldn't properly manage their kid's blood sugar?   Well Pacos had us covered there too. The dull roar of the kitchen and Willie Nelson's soothing tunes kept our daughter quiet during our entire meal. (Yes, the ENTIRE meal)  Bless you Paco, you saved the day.  You know what else is great?  Getting the first food served of the day.  My wife's fajitas were perfect.   The unholy guacamole, lived up to it's name.   My steak quesadilla, burrito, two tacos, and enchiladas?   Hot, delicious, and made with love. (So what, I'm a stress eater... want to fight about it?)   Later that day, we all made it home safely, our daughter slept for another hour and my wife and I, well we got the best hour nap of our week.  Thank you Pacos, we are customers for life!

One of the BEST Mexican Spots in Charlotte Area....  I'll jump right into the salsa of the matter here - the food was great, the service was great, the ambiance was great, the prices were very reasonable...  Food:  I ordered the giant monster, burrito, which came stuffed with caramelized onions, bell peppers and red rice, I ordered a mix of chicken and steak as I wanted to sample both of the meats.  The waitress was more than happy to accommodate me in this request.  My date ordered the steak quesadillias.  Both of our entrees were delectable and were served to perfection.  I couldn't imagine what more anyone could want from a giant, monster burrito.  It was loaded with meats, both tender and succulent.  In addition the burrito was accompanied with a scoop of sour cream, pico, and guacamole (at my request) and rice.  My date loved the taste her quesadillas and explained that the skirt steak was juicy and tender. -We ordered the Coastal Calamari as an appetizer.  It too was amazing.  As a calamari lover, there is nothing worse than tough, overcooked calamari.  SO you can imagine my elation when we received a big plate of warm, tender and not overcooked, calamari!  It included two different types of dipping sauce, a red based marinara-type sauce and another white, "mystery sauce" which was also quite tasty.   -The chips and salsa are on par with crack in their addictive powers.  The chips are perfect, served warm, fresh and with a dab of salt.  The salsa is also excellent and taste fresh.  The best part is that they bring you as much of each, as you want.    Service:  Our service was excellent.  I could not have asked for more as far as friendliness and promptness.  When we needed water refilled, they were.  When we needed more chips and salsa, it was there.  When we needed our entrees after a five minute wait, they were there.    Prices:  The prices were very reasonable, $38.69, but I was able to use my City pass coupon and save $10 (see pics).  Not bad for two adults and that includes a Dos XX Amber and an appetizer.    I don't know if Paco's is actually the NUMBER ONE Mexican spot in Charlotte, but it is certainly in the conversation and one would be remiss not to consider Paco's Tacos and Tequila when looking for good Mexican in the Charlotte area.    I'll leave you with two statements:  1. This place is waaaaay better than the new La Paz at the Met.  2. I'll be back here soon.
Paco's Tacos was a great experience. I had the Fiesta Bowl and I loved it. The service was awesome and the atmosphere was fun.

I enjoyed my trip to Paco's Tacos & Tequila, but everything I ate was just solidly good.  It's about a 40 minute drive from my house, so unless it was a place that friends were wanting to meet, I wouldn't go out of my way to dine there.  If I could have given a 3.5, I would have.  I ordered Paco's Taco which came with Spanish rice, slaw, and a choice of beans.  The taco itself was good and the first bite made me go, "Wow!" but apparently all of the sauce in my taco was in that one bite.  After that, it sort of fell flat for me.  The rice was okay, but the slaw was pretty dry -- like just shredded cabbage.  I didn't taste the citrus or the chipotle in it.  The side of Charro Beans was the most flavorful thing on my plate -- and I did enjoy them.  The salsa at Paco's is also really good -- perhaps the rest of my meal just suffered by comparison.  We did receive good service from Henny!

Just a great place to get lunch or dinner. I usually get the crispy Tacos and there are daily drink specials. Bloody Maria on Sunday. This is a restaurant you can feel very comfortable when eating alone

Gosh yelp really fooled me on this one. I saw the reviews thought this place would be good and it was not close to good at all. I was so disappointed. We had the chicken and steak fajitas. The veggies underneath the protein was mushy and old. Felt like they had the veggies sitting there until someone decide to order the fajita. The steak was okay and chicken was bland. The sides for the fajita seriously came out of a can I do not think anything was fresh! We also ordered the firestarter Margarita and that was horrible as well, there was no liquor just juice and jalapeños :( watered down. I should've walked out when I stepped into the old, run down decor. Our server was really sweet too bad the food fell short.
A new twist on Mexican food. The beef brisket taco is superb.  The service was great too, despite being packed on the weekend. I highly recommend.

Favorite tacos and margarita in all of Charlotte!!!!!!! Love Love Love this place. The Firestarter margarita is the best in the world and has a great kick. The bar has a cool vibe too. Volcano queso is the best queso in the world and their house made tortillas are also the best in the world, but their machine broke and they haven't made those in months- the only thing that's made me disappointed with this restaurant ever. The Grilled Skirt Steak Taco and the Tanked Up Taco are my favorites. It really isn't the same since they haven't made their house made tortillas and I haven't gone as often as I used to because of it, but I will still give it five stars.

This is around the corner from my house so I should come here more often, but for some reason it wasn't until recently that I checked it out. I like that it is part of the dining rewards program so I get Delta miles for my purchases. They have a decent selection of Mexican and Texas beers.  My friends were enjoying the build your own margaritas. I had the ground beef tacos and they were good.    I will be back.

Great tex mex!  Try the charro beans and the maverick margarita! I would highly recommend this restaurant to locals and out of towners.  Also our waitress was very knowledgable about the menu and tequilas.
I went back a few days later.. Service was great. We were sat right away and had a really knowledgeable, fun server- Chelsea! Good was great as it always is!

Amazing Mexican food. From the chips and salsa, to our meals. The service was great. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful with the questions we had about the menu. We would definitely come back if we are in Charlotte again.

Great tacos (I had the shrimp tacos) that come with a satisfying platter of food w/ beans, rice and slaw. Delicious slaw. Our table got the chili con queso to start and it was disappointing - flavorless, needed spices/salt/anything to make it more interesting. Didn't even have green chilies in it, just cut up bell pepper. Service was good and our chips/salsa stayed filled throughout the entire meal.

Great little spot in South Park, by the same owners as Big Daddy's. Has that same feel to it but with a Tex-Mex flare. The salsa is a bit different, in that they serve it warm as opposed to cold or room temp. It's different, but good. Had the Beef Brisket Taco's and they were amazing! Get them on the homemade soft tortillas. Yum.

This is one of our go-to place when we want to grab some margaritas and tacos.  It's always busy so prepare to wait - we usually sit at the bar/bar area.  The tacos are always good and the warm tortilla chips with salsa are fantastic.  The service leaves a bit to be desired.  On our last visit we waited for almost a half hour just for our drinks.  If you can visit on an off day or time, you'll love it. If you're patient enough to wait, you might love it also!
This is one of my favorite places for "Mexican" food. The salsa is spicy. I really like the enchiladas and the rice . Good beer selections.

Expected more from the likes of  Frank Scibelli. I am a rabid fan of his other establishments but Paco's just fell flat for me.   Chips and Salsa = forgettable The margaritas were strong, but the food was just like that appetizer - forgettable.   Worth giving them a few weeks and checking it out again, but the location was odd and along with a pretty uninspiring meal, I won't be rushing back.

I'm from Houston, TX and have been trying to find a good Mexican restaurant for almost two years. So glad I found this place! We got fajitas, queso, and guacamole. Delicious! It's expensive but most good Mexican food is.

I love this place! Came here with my family at lunch, and the service was great once we told them it was out first time.  The fajita's were on par with the best I've ever had. Chips and Salsa are better than Cantina 1511.  The serving size was generous, and one could share the fajita's easily. Good vareity as well for vegatarians.
Great food all around (from the chips n salsa, volcano queso, to chicken enchiladas), drinks (huge tequila selection and make your own margarita), and good service!

Tried for the first time on a Sunday during game day, so thankfully it was slow. The service was very quick and gave wonderful suggestions. The chips were warm and crispy and the salsa was very fresh with a roasted or smoky, but authentic taste. Tacos were delicious with a very good flavor in the pork and brisket! Definitely a great place for the family as well. Lots of seating and a large bar. Must try if craving tex-mex or just good family dining!!

Visiting from out of town for a wedding and all I can say is WOW. That bacon wrapped jalapeños were excellent. The tacos were some of the best I've ever eaten. Highly recommended and I will visit again when we are back in Charlotte to visit my parents.10 stars
David our waiter was outstanding. The place was packed but our food came piping hot and was great. Will put this place on our list to come back in the future.
Wow! First time here and crazy impressed! Do you like fresh and light and amazing atmosphere with amazing food this is an iconic destination!

LOVE THIS PLACE! Best guac and chips and salsa. Salad is good too. The wait here on the weekends is a bit nuts, but the food is usually worth it. Staff is friendly and quick to get your beverages and appetizers. This is one of my favorite Mexican places to eat, will return!
Annie is the best. Loved the food and great service!!!  Delicious. Brisket is amazing.

I really go back and forth with love and hate for Pacos.  I think the food is really good.  The service can be awful.  For example, one time the waiter dropped a whole tray of waters on my one year old son and other than bringing some napkins over, did nothing.  A manager never came by.  He didn't even comp my sons kid meal.  He was soaking wet and we had to leave.    Another time the waiter forgot to put the kids meals and anyone with kids can guess what ensued when it took 15 minutes after our adult food arrived for the 1, 3, and 5 year old to get theirs.... again nothing whatsoever was done.  We get mad, wait a few months, go back, repeat....
Yummy fresh chips and salsa. I love spicy food and adult beverages.  A must try is....the "FIRESTARTER",

Our favorite Mexican restaurant. The food is delicious, portions are generous, and atmosphere is always fun and energetic. The bar area is nice it has bar seating as well as table seating that is next to a wall of windows. Very fun place to eat.

My sister has been raving about "Taco's Pacos" since she moved to Charlotte a few months ago. She basically lives across the street, so we added it to our must-see list on my recent visit. We met our cousin and her daughter for lunch and I was very impressed. The staff was on their game; the chips and salsa were delivered quickly and were yummy, and our waters were always full.   I ordered the small chicken quesadilla with a side salad. In hindsight, I wish I had just ordered a large salad because the side salad was one of the best I've ever had! It had a little too much dressing (ask for it on the side) but there were chickpeas, peppers, avocado, corn, etc etc etc in this salad. SO YUMMY. The quesadilla was good with a decent amount of salsa/sour cream/guac on the side, and it was a good value for the lunch. YUM.

So we started out heading to Chuy's and were shocked to discover they had moved. What to do now? We were in the mood for Mexican but had no idea where to go in the area. Thanks to this very app., we were suggested Paco's and were not disappointed. We had the feeling that we were on the right track as people seemed to all be heading in the same direction as we approached. We could shortly see why. Upscale, delicious Tex-Mex. would be the simplest way to describe Paco's. We both had 2 delicious tacos and can't wait to go back for more. My only complaint would be to have a beer special every day. Otherwise, perfection.

My love affair with Paco has come to an end. It is not as thrilling as in the early days of a new restaurant. The chips they used to have were light, thin, and they seemed freshly made; I couldn't keep my hands off them. The last time I was there they had the thick corn that was seemed like it was purchased in bulk. In addition, the flavor that once kept me coming back for more, seemed more muted.   Granted, the food is still okay and the service is still friendly. Perhaps "it's me, not you."

This is seriously one of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte. It NEVER fails.   We came a few weeks ago on a crowded night and were sat and waited on promptly (we had a reservation).  We ordered drinks that came quickly and the tableside guac - which you HAVE to order because it is so delicious. I got a blood orange margarita, which I always get, and I swear it is the best margarita I've had.  I usually go for three tacos - although every time I order 3 tacos I remember I cannot eat 3 of their tacos. So delicious, you can't go wrong ordering tacos. You can select a combo of any of the tacos on the menu.    The service is great, the atmosphere is lively and fun, we will continue to be Paco's patrons!

Pacos Tacos is awesome!! Beautiful home made tex mex food, beautiful 100% blue agave tequila, and a friendly, upbeat atmosphere and staff here. The guacamole is amazing, whether it's done table side or already on your tacos. Portions are large and good for sharing to mix and match and try a few things! Yee haw, Pacos! Well done.

First of all guys, if you wanna see a menu of Tequila do check this place. White, Gold, Aged - all types are there and yeah - you can get your fresh margarita made out of them if not interested in having it neat. Best salsa - it's fresh, spicy, tangy and tempting. I am from India and let me say Yeah its TANGY !!  Tacos as per ur wish, soft, crisp , etc etc. awesome service and a must at the South Park area.

As a former Texas resident with high standards for Tex-Mex, I was made aware with the first bite of a brisket taco at Paco's that North Carolina does indeed have great Mexican food.  It's a bit pricier compared to what you'd pay for a similar meal in San Antonio or Austin, but I'm not complaining.

I was just not impressed at all by this restaurant. I went a few weeks ago and I'm not sure why I had such high hopes for it but meh.  I had the steak fajitas and they were average not bad, just not exciting, and the vegetables were mush. The person I was with got a chimichanga  and it was really dry and tasteless. The tortilla chips were good and the salsa was really good! It had a decent heat and flavor to it and the chips seemed fresh.   The main reason I give it 2 and not 3 stars is because this place prides itself on it's tequila selection and it's "oh so delicious" margaritas.  I'm here to tell you they were not good.  The house margarita which was on special was pure sour mix and it wasn't a good sour mix either.  I had a different margarita (can't remember the name but it was the one with grand marnier), and again it just wasn't good.  My uncle makes an amazing margarita with grand marnier and this definitely did not compare (maybe I'm biased).  I was also disappointed not to see any real Sangria choices as I prefer that to margaritas when out and the wine prices are jacked up beyond belief  (I saw a few choices that they were charges by the glass the same price as you could get the entire bottle for at the store). I realize that some raising of the prices is needed to make a profit but $12 for a glass of wine that you can by the entire bottle for the same price?? Yeah I'm not buying that one!!   Needless to say I will probably give this place a second shot and update my review but currently not a fan!
I love visiting Paco's for the uniqueness it brings. Great atmosphere and great food. Everyone we've taken here loves it. Service can be up and down sometimes, but is generally good.

Paco's has great burritos, fajitas, and even salads but their white queso (not on the menu by itself but you can still order it) is AMAZING and I come every time specifically for that. They also have great margaritas and if you get lucky (which is more often than not), you'll get a server who loves tequila and can mix you a cool concoction of their own. Did I mention their sour mix is homemade??

Paco's tacos , what can I say , let me start with staff , very attentive without being intrusive for example  they replace the chips even though we were not done with it and gave us a fresh batch hot out of the oven , speaking of chips , they very crispy and well seasoned . appetizers and entrée's  were delicious . I would go . 2 thumbs up.
I've eaten here twice and both times the food was much too salty for my taste.

WOW! One of the best Mexican restaurants I've been to in Charlotte! (we're originally from AZ) Great food!!! & they serve REAL jalapenos! :) We had chips/salsa (best I've ever had), chimichanga and fish/beef tacos, they were awesome! Good drink deals and the service was perfect! We will definitely be back!

Client took me here for lunch and was just amazed. That salsa is incredible. Don't usually get excited about salsa, but man it's so good. Came back in town two weeks later and tried to eat at the bar, but the wait was too long (guess that is a great thing if you own the place). Ordered a pint of salsa, another huge delicious taco and the enchiladas to go back to the hotel.   Just can't say enough good things about this place.

I Live 5 freakin minutes away and this was my first time here.....seriously? Well that's because the damn place is hidden away BEHIND the Williams Sonoma. I mean, Williams Sonoma has "stolen" thousands of my dollars and I never saw this place behind it.....I must speak with the architect!   OK, so now I know what all the fuss is about. Authentic Mexican? Not a chance. However, this place does serve REALLY good Tex Mex!   Fresh chips and excellent salsa? Confirmed! I added some delicious Chili con Queso and voila, excellent way to start off the lunch.  My friendly waiter made some recommendations and I went with them. He suggested the slow braised beef brisket, and I also selected a chicken fried steak taco. Man both were really excellent! Very flavorful with sweet/heat contrasting flavors. But while i knew the brisket taco would be good, the chicken fried steak was even BETTER! Halleluiah! Crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. Highly recommend this one!  Oh and the beans. Can forget about the charro beans. They have brisket in them with onions. Very savory and tasty. The only negatives was that the rice was average and the cole slaw sucked. But who cares when the mains are this good, right?  Overall a great first, but certainly not last, dining experience at Paco's Tacos!

We came here for a Saturday lunch and were seated right away.  The booths are comfortable and the waiter was helpful and attentive.  Maybe it's because I now see this place is "Tex Mex," but there was loud country music playing.  I like country, but this was very hillbilly country.  The food was excellent.  I opted for one of the combos and got a chicken quesadilla with the small chopped salad.  Both items were good although I think if I went back I would just get the chopped salad since it was so yummy.  My family enjoyed the quesadillas and tacos as well.

This restaurant is a little hidden so just be aware that it is in the back of the shopping area. I enjoyed both the green and red salsas and split a pitches of margaritas with my group- which oddly our server did not recommend to do. He said the pitches makes the margaritas get a little too watery- which I think could be fixed by not filling it so high with ice and having glasses full of ice to pour into. Overall it was a great drink $35 for a pitcher of house margaritas which had about seven pours.   Let me just say. This brisket is banging. I also has the charro beans which despite being cooked with bacon were nothing to write home about. Get the brisket. Prices are also pretty fair considering its Southpark and all.

Would you like it Chunky or Creamy?   :) Fresh Guacamole made to order at your table, IS the first thought that comes to mind when I think of Paco's.  Super fresh, delish, tasty guacamole every time, served with those complimentary chips which again is very tasty. The complimentary salsa is damn good too, would love it a bit more spicy though. We ordered couple corona's and order the mix and match taco's.  Couple Al Pastor and Wood Grilled Chicken taco's.  Phew 3 tacos sound like small portion right, but these are huge taco's served with rice, beans and slaw.  That's a huge portion enough for two.  Loved Al Pastor -  the pork was perfectly cooked and it was juicy and delicious.  What could go wrong with chicken taco it was perfect as well.  The beans was just as delicious and so was the rice. Always love the vibe at this place, and our waiter mentioned that Paco's was ranked 2nd best tex-mex in the country last year. Interesting!!

After an awful experience at San Antonio's we decided to try Paco's Tacos and Tequila. We have been back three times and each time has been wonderful. The beef brisket tacos are amazing, and the jalapeno infused tequila margarita is the best margarita I have ever had. Everything is fresh, authentic, priced well, and service is great! Thank you for putting this great restaurant in South Park!

I've heard from plenty of people that this place has the best hispanic food in Charlotte. Thus far, I haven't found better.  Its always crowded, which is a testament to their good food. Its a bit loud, but with all the people they have crammed in that restaurant, its to be expected.  Table side Guac was very delicious, and I LOVE their salsa (Free chips and salsa of course). I had a chimichanga and it was very delicious and very filling.  I'd love to come back, but its just so hard with the crowds that are always there. I wish they'd open another location. If you can find a time to dine there, know that its well worth it.

My favorite Mexican place in charlotte. They make their flour tortillas in house in fresh batches. If you sit at the bar you can see them make them! I recommend reservations on OpenTable to ensure short wait time. I recommend the fajita platter and the tortilla soup. The skinny margarita as good flavor, but can be too acidic at times for me. Chips and salsa are complimentary, but try to avoid filling up on them before the food comes! Service is generally good and the quality of the food matches the price. Parking is self Park, no valet. Can be tight during peak hours and may have to wait for one to open up.
I had tacos al pastor with pineapple, very good. Ships are light crispy and fresh.  Do not like being sat by the bathroom though
Love this place. Fantastic Mecican food, across from South Park Mall. Unreal fajitas, enchiladas and pork carnitas. Service is always excellent. Make a rez. Can get packed in weekend nights.

Had lunch here today, taco and salad combo.   Fresh and full of flavor.  ordered special tuna taco, which was overdone, but management was responsive and courteous.  Excellent wait staff.  Table side Guacamole was ample serving, especially compared to Cantina 1511.   Don Pedro's still does it better, adding radish or jicama for crunch, cilantro, and lemon juice. Margarita was well blended and tequila options were impressive.   Wait staff was impressive!   How Chuys stays in business so close to this place is impossible to understand,

Start off by saying the food was AMAZING! You start with chips and salsa like most Mexican restaurants. The salsa was really good! I also got the house margarita, also really good. Not your premix margarita, this tasted freshly made! I had 2 tacos. A paco taco and smokey & the brisket. Oh my so delicious! You could taste the smoke in the brisket! I liked the smokey & the brisket a little better because it had a fresh tomato salsa that made the taco very refreshing.  My husband had the open face pork quesadilla. He would not stop raving about how good they were.  The services was fantastic! We made a reservation and did not have to wait on a Saturday night at 730. Our waiter was also really friendly as well.  We will definitely be eating here again!

The food is in a class beyond "Mexican". The location is easy to access, the atmosphere is so, so relaxing especially at night. The staff was attentive, observant and kind. We made a reservation and ended up at a booth by the back right window beside the emergency exit - couldn't have asked for a better spot, honestly!  After tasty chips and salsa upon being seated, we ordered:  Jalapeno cheese filled bacon wrapped appetizer -      // Oh my God. Amazing fresh, but even better after sitting out / refrigerated. Order another and box it up before you leave!!  Enchilada di Dennis -     // Is this even real? It was PERFECT. The flavors, the smooth creamy texture, the temperature, the sides were okay but next time I'm definitely getting the 4 enchilada sampler.  This is my new favorite restaurant, period.
The food and atmosphere are both excellent, but it's the staff that has won my heart over. They are attentive, friendly, and really care about the details.

Been meaning to go here and finally did.  These are the best tacos in town!  The home made wheat tortillas were excellent. Also had the guacamole prepared at the table.  Will definitely be back when I get the itch for some tacos.

I'm seriously torn about how to review - as two stars or three.  This would have been four had it not been for the shortcut to an unplanned weight loss.  Business traveler, dining alone, weekday night.  Fairly busy. Sat in bar area at high top.  Prompt service.  Asked for and promptly received water, chips, salsa.  Salsa tasted great and had a good amount of heat.  Waiter made a few recommendations, including the pork carnitas.  Carnitas are always risky - I've had way too chewy and overcooked, I've had ok but stomach ache for a week and I've had "damn, I should order that every time" - but all from different establishments.  It was really feeling like more of a fish taco night so I compromised and ordered the Tuna Carnitas.  Sounded interesting and tasty!  Waiter came back and apologized saying they are taking it off the menu.  Hmmm.  I decided to not pursue the seafood angle based on that so rather than fish tacos instead went with waiter's original recomendation of Pork Carnitas - he reaffirmed my confidence in my selection by saying "Now that's a great choice!"  So I felt good about it.  And I have to say, they tasted excellent!!  Only, as I was walking to my car after having had a good amount of salsa and the carnitas (didn't really eat the beans which came with it) I felt the first "uh-oh" moment.  My hotel was literally only minutes away so I kept going.  That almost did not work out...within about 20 seconds of walking in my hotel room door I think I had literally lost 5 lbs.  My stomach is not that sensitive but this must have been caused by something I just ate to have had such a quick and unpleasant reaction.  On the positive side, thanks to the "cleanse", my suit pants weren't too snug the next day and I gave an unbelievable presentation to my client!  So 3 stars.

If I had to die, my last meal on earth would be Mexican. I love it so I rate it very highly. And after a recent bad experience at a competitor's Mexican restaurant I decided to try Paco's Tacos for the first time.   I came here on a Thursday night around 8 with my husband and a friend. It was pretty busy, but we got seated right away. Our server greeted us with water, chips and salsa. The salsa was great. It wasn't chunky (my husband isn't a fan of tomatoes) and had the right amount of spice. The chips were light and crispy. They tasted homemade. They were too good I couldn't stop eating them.   I ordered the two taco combo, which came with rice, slaw and beans. All for only $11 (they are full size tacos too!)  I got the charro beans. It reminded me of baked beans and was something different from your typical black or refried beans. For my tacos, I mixed and matched. The shrimp taco was my favorite. The chipotle ranch sauce was on point and there was TONS of shrimp on it!! There had to be at least 10 pieces. I also got the turkey carnitas. The turkey was moist and not dry. I would recommend the shrimp instead. My husband got the Paco's taco (beef brisket), which was my second fav.   Overall good vibes at Paco's tacos. I would highly recommend it to anyone and I will be back soon!   Ps try the slaw with your rice. It's awesome.

Paco's Tacos is the real deal! In spite of the great Yelp reviews, I still had my reservations about eating at another TexMex chain. How good could it be I thought? Well they totally nailed it, from the complementary chips and dip to the sauce stains on my napkin!  The dining area was empty and only a few people were at the bar upon my arrival for a late lunch. Adlai our server was very helpful with recommendations and was knowledgeable of the menu. I had a overstuffed grilled chicken taco which arrived with Mexican rice, mixed cabbage coleslaw and, their own, Charro style pintos, all at the incredible price of... drum roll please... 7 Bucks! My buddy tried Paco's Taco which is shredded beef and was equally as tasty. Servings are huge and everything was fantastic.   Premeal chips and salsa were delivered to the table immediately. The chips are very thin and were very fresh. The place was clean and attractive. Sanitation rating was a 95. For those long time Charlotteans like myself, you may remember this place as the old Manzetti's.  I'm going back soon! This place is a Gotta Try!.

Woah! This place has some seriously good tacos! I have been to Paco's previously for drinks and taco salad, but always heard good things about their tacos. It's true y'all... they are good!   My husband got Paco's Tacos (recommended with cabbage inside) and a stuffed jalapeño which was stuffed with cheese and wrapped with bacon. They were "bomb" as he said.   I got the Tanked up Taco (grilled) and the Crispy Shrimp. Both were delicious and FULL of flavor. I usually get guac on the side to dip my tacos, but I definitely didn't need to.   We will definitely be back!
Great place!   Half price fajitas on monday nights after 8:30.  Great service.  You have to try the fried ice cram and brownie.  Even if you take it home for later.  One of the best brownies around.

I'm a fan of Cantina 1511, Big Daddy Burger, etc....so I had to try out Paco's Taco's.  My husband and I stopped in on Sunday for an early dinner.  The place has only been open for about a week, and it did not disappoint.  The beef brisket taco is excellent, the service is excellent, and it's exciting to have this place close by in Southpark.  We will be back!

Chips and salsa are awesome!! Service and cleanliness was horrible!!!  Food was just ok... I got the taco salad and the pita bread was HARD AS A ROCK and the flavor of the meat was not good! My husband got the cheese enchiladas and they were really greasy!! The older gentleman that works there is NOT friendly or helpful.  He would not ask if anyone needed more to drink and just put chips and sals on table.  We are a basket of chips and he just walked past seeing we did it have our drinks still! HORRIBLE HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!! We waited FOREVER before our waiter acknowledged us! Won't be back. There are much better places for Mexican food than this place!!!

Really dissapointed. First, we were told it was a 35 minute wait but could count at least 8 empty clean tables.... One of which we sat at 35 minutes later. Second, other than the queso the food was just so so. The tortillas were great but the meat was somewhat bland, too much cilantro, and the rice tasted like it came straight out of a Zatarains box. I don't think we would go back for food, but maybe a drink. They had a decent list of tequila.

Can not give enough kudos to Pacos Tacos and Tequila. I thought we would never come across a decent tex mex in Charlotte. Yay! The Holy Guacamole done at tableside is perfection. They put just the right amount of salt and lime to get your mouth watering for one of their great margaritas and don't be afraid of going all in on the chili. It's a nice compliment to the avacado and not very spicy at all. We also tried the tortilla soup which was made in a nice light broth and chicken burrito that could have been shared by two men with big appetites and completely satisfied them. Overall the food was outstanding for Tex Mex and the price was great.  Our server was very friendly and the food came out right when we wanted it to. We also really enjoyed the setting. For me the only thing that could have made it better would be some Chili Rellenos on the menu, but other than that I was a happy camper. There has been a lot of thought put into the upfit of the restaurant space. We were seated in the back of the restaurant which has a great decor and nice natural lighting coming through its roof which is plastered with skylights. We all agreed this will become one of our regular Charlotte haunts. Thanks Pacos!
Get there early as they get packed. Tues night special $3 NC drafts. Love their queso. The Paco Taco and carnitas are awesome tacos. Can't wait to come back again next time I'm in town.
Great Restaurant Week deal during Queen's Feast. Fun atmosphere, good margaritas and delicious guac. What more do you need?

This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Charlotte, and it's even better when you sit at the bar. The tacos are delicious and I don't think I've ever had a bad meal here. Take out is great too.

The great Charlotte taco hunt continues, this time we landed at Paco' Tacos with high expectations. Cool place, insanely popular, plan on waiting a bit (we went and poked around some nearby shops for a few).  When I time came we were promptly seated and delivered chips and salsa, which were delicious. Definitely dig that salsa!  We ordered 4 different tacos, ground beef, pork, chicken, and steak. The chicken was tasty, the pork with pineapple salsa was awesome, the steak was dry and chewy, and the ground beef tasted like dry beef jerky.  I could eat tons of the Mexican rice, that and he salsa were my favorite parts of the meal.  Honorable mention for the fresh made tortillas, the flour tortilla was especially tasty!  A little bummed overall, we were hoping the tacos were going to be bangin' but they left us wanting to look elsewhere to fill that gaping taco shaped hole in our hearts.

Food - 2/2 *I've eaten here multiple times and I've never had anything I don't like.  The tacos (all of them) are excellent.  My favorites are the skirt steak, tanked up and shake down shrimp.  But my personal favorite menu item is the mac and cheese.  It a delightful Texas style mac/cheese that has a kick to it. It's creamy and delicious!  My go-to upscale Tex-Mex restaurant in South Charlotte.  Service - 1/1 *No complaints here.  Friendly, helpful.  Nothing extraordinary, but solid.  Price - 0.5/1 *A little higher than I'd like to pay, but that's what you have to expect in Southpark.  Let's be serious though - $9 for guacamole is outrageous.  Atmosphere - 1/1 *Fun place to have dinner.  Packed on the weekends, but if if's packed, you can still walk around different shops and they'll call you when you table is ready. One night I found a table in the bar area, while it was crowded, and still had a great time.   Listen, all of Frank Scibelli's restaurants (Mama Ricotta's, Cantina 1511, Bad Daddy's Burger Bar, Midwood Smokehouse, and Paco's Tacos & Tequila) are 5/5.  I've come to like this place better than Cantina 1511.  It's the best place to have tacos in the city.

I am a part-time Uber driver in Charlotte and I've picked people up from here a few times. Since it's near some hotels, I sometimes recommend it as a good spot for a nice meal and good margaritas. However, today was my first time actually dining here after meeting one of the chefs and taking him home from work.  We were window shopping at the South Park mall and decided to come here around 5:30 on a Sunday. We were sat quickly in a comfortable part of the restaurant and immediately greeted with a smile and the customary chips and salsa. My wife, who doesn't like spicy things, really enjoyed the sauce which had just the right amount of kick! We also ordered some table-side guacamole, which was fresh and tasty but felt a little bland. We make our guacamole at home with lime juice, so that is probably a matter of taste.  That night, they had a special edition "blackened salmon" taco which sounded delicious, but we did not try it. I had the "enchiladas de Dennis" and my wife had the roasted vegetable enchiladas. She got some fried plantains on her plate, which were sweet and delicious! Great rice and beans. The plates themselves were a little bland, but nothing a little salt, pepper and Tapatio can't solve.  I also tried the Pineapple & Mint Margarita, which was like a cross among a Mai Tai, a margarita and a mojito. It was a really creative drink that I enjoyed.  Overall, I would say it's a great spot. Good, affordable food, quick service, good drinks and a great atmosphere. Would definitely recommend to just about anyone.

I've wanted to come here for a year... I just love the feel, decor... Nice comfortable fun atmosphere. Our waitress was amazing! Between the 3 of us we ordered 4 dinners and had leftovers. The chicken something enchiladas was so yummy! Fish taco (minus spicy sauce) grilled was my favorite. The beans baked with beef and onions were such an awesome touch!! Loved those instead of refried (which they do offer). Great food, efficient friendly waitstaff and fun place :)

I am in LOVE with this place!! I have been here a few (dozen) times and they never disappoint! Most of the time I take out but I ate in once and the staff is great! I love how when you are waiting for a table they sit you at the bar or a smaller table to provide you with water and chips and salsa! I love getting the vegetable fajitas!! And I always ask for them to put cheese and Jalapenos on my fires and they never have an issue doing it even though it's not on the menu that way. Just writing this review makes me want to go there right now! Awesome awesome food!!!

Nice place.  First time here.  Service was quick.  Sat at the bar since I was alone.  Fish Tacos were great. Would get them next time, too.  I actually went solely because they participate in UPromise.  Glad I did!

My favorite tacos and favorite Mexican restaurant in Charlotte.  To drink try a firestarter. A spicy marg that is delicious. All pretty pricey specialty drinks but all the ones I have had are good.  I only get queso, salsa, and guacamole and tacos here but I've been with people who get other things and they all like what they get as well.  All the tacos I have had are very tasty but my personal favorite is the Pacos Taco which is a beef brisket taco slightly spicy a 10 hour slow roasted chili rubbed beef brisket with caramelized onions and chipotle BBQ sauce.  I have also had the Al Pastor, Chicken Milanesa, and Chicken Fried Steak makes me drool just thinking about these.  GO HERE!!
Good place to go eat. It reminds me of Texas with the way it is decorated. A little pricy but a fun at atmosphere.
Not Bad!!! Reminds me of Texas!!!! Had the Chimichanga just have them hold the Queso for the side might be too much sort of smothered everything else. Enjoy!!!!!

Food and atmosphere was great.   If you're paying for a big party, be sure to check all the items on your receipt.  Evidently, my waiter snuck in a couple of Margaritas on my check.  Because the assumption is, is that you will not likely check what everyone ordered and would just pay for it all and sign.  Read your itemizations before paying!
This place has great prices and and amazing food. I had the fajita  but everyone around me was getting pacos tacos.

Dang good tacos! I thought it a bit pricey for tacos. Once I tried them though - I knew it was well worth it. Mix and match - one of my buddies didn't realize you can do that so I thought I would mention it. If you are looking for possibly the best tacos in Charlotte - this is the joint!
Second time I'm here with my husband, and it was amazing Our favorite Mexican place. Wonderful service, friendly atmosphere. Defiantly will be back
I had the pork tacos. Yummy. The salsa was great it has a Smokey flavor with a touch of heat   ALso our server was great and friendly  I will be back

My girlfriend, her parents and I made a reservation here for NYE. We showed up a few minutes early and were seated immediately.  We ordered a pitcher of margaritas, white queso, and the table made guacamole to start. The margaritas were good, but could have been a little stronger. The queso was delicious- duh. And the guacamole was awesome because you can customize it since its table made- it's also a huge portion. The server also brought salsa and chips. The salsa was SPICY! We also got tomatillo salsa that was less spicy and tasty. The chips are super thin and you will eat way too many.   I ordered enchiladas de dennis with charro (pinto beans with onions, bacon, and brisket) and my girlfriend got the 3 taco combo with rice and retried beans. Both entrees were $13 which was very reasonable because it was a LOT of food...or maybe we were full from all the chips.   The enchiladas were so good, covered in cheese and tons of flavor. My girlfriend got the Paco Taco (10 hour smoked beef brisket), Tanked Up (beer battered white fish), and Shake Down Shrimp tacos. They were all delicious! The tortillas are thick, more like pita but they are stuffed full so maybe the thickness is to hold it all in. Whatever it is, it's good!   My girlfriend has already said she wants to have her birthday dinner here, which is 7 months away. There was a bacon, egg, and cheese enchilada we might have to try out.  Overall the restaurants atmosphere was relaxed and funky, the service was good, and the food was amazing. Check this place out ASAP!

Best Mexican restaurant i have eaten at in a long time.  The service was great and the food extraordinarily fresh for a mexican restaurant. Chips fresh with tasty salsa.    I got the veggie enchiladas and they were fantastic.  I will be back with family in tow.

Quite frankly, I think i was Hispanic during my past life or something because I absolutely loveeeeee Mexican food! Now you cant really find authentic Mexican food around this area but this place is pretty legit.   definitely recommend the steak tacos and brisket nachos!! Yum!

Lots of bang for your buck! The place was crowded for a Wednesday night and now I know why. The food was excellent, reasonably priced, and the portions were large. Too bad there are no pina coladas on the menu.

This is my go to restaurant, if my boyfriend and I don't know where we want to eat or aren't craving anything, let's go to Paco's! They offer 3 different kinds of salsa, all amazing. Queso, so great you'll never not order it (not if you love cheese as much as me!) I've had most of the tacos on the menu and have yet to try one I don't like. I highly recommend the Rusty El Camino margarita, but be careful if you're driving because it's a deliciously strong one!   Let's be real, you can go to RuRu's tacos and tequila but not get free chips and salsa and pay the same amount for a margarita that's half the size of Paco's. By far, best Tex-Mex the the CLT, and yes I've tried quite a few places.
Yummy yummy YUMMY. Unique flavors. Great service. Excellent margaritas. It's a must try!

Tried this after Taco Maco fell down and let us sit on the patio for 10+ minutes without waiting on us.   The margaritas were amazing and food was equally good.  The table side guacamole was awesome!!!  Ask for Shauna!!!

Very good salsa. If you like heat they will bring hotter out. Also the bacon wrapped stuffed jalapeños are great. Their brisket tacos are the best meat tacos I have ever had. And they have a good selection of beer and tequila.

Have been hearing amazing things about this place so had to go try it out. We ate lunch here today and boy the food is good. I had the shrimp and fish taco, it came with coleslaw, beans, rice. It was a plate full and was just the amount if you are quite hungry. If not very hungry, I'd say one taco is good enough. The pineapple margarita was very tasty!!! I am sure to come back to try other items in menu :)

I don't get the somewhat middling rating for this place. This place is amazing. The chips were good with two decent salsas - one green and one red. Had three different tacos. The Paco Taco which has a slowed cooked chili-rubbed brisket in it. Unbelievably good. An amazing fish taco, the best I've ever had, which unfortunately will not be offered on the restaurants new menu. Too bad because it was delicious. The last taco had skirt steak in it. It too was great but the Paco Taco was even better. The platter had rice, a slaw with amazing fresh ingredients like corn sliced right off the cob, and awesome Charro beans. Everything was hot and seemed incredibly fresh. $2 Shiner Bock drafts on Thursdays was a plus. This is now my go to place when I spend the night in Charlotte.

I am a frequent visitor of Pacos Tacos, my husband and I usually come here every Sunday after church at 11 and are the first customers to open the doors. The food is always amazing (I have never had one bad item), the service is good, and we enjoy the music selection.   Since I come here so often one of my friends gave me a gift card to here for my birthday (she knows me well). That next Sunday we put it to use only to find that the money she put on it did not register on the gift card. The manager came over to let us know this and was very apologetic. I spoke to my friend in regards to the amount that was on the card and the manager put that amount on the card and more for our troubles, no questions asked. The customer service she provided went above and beyond what she needed to do. We thought we loved Pacos before but now we know this is the best place in Charlotte.   Since this is my favorite place I will also give some recommendations on the food I love here: Veggie fajitas, enchiladas de dennis (I usually see if I can get it with ground beef instead of chicken), the beef chimichanga (we get this with queso over the whole things instead of the half and half sauce), chopped salad is amazing as well as the chicken tortilla soup, the guacamole is made fresh at the table, the queso is amazing, the tacos are amazing I love the pacos taco, gringo beef, wood grilled skirt steak, and we love the BBQ buttered Corn.   Again I cannot recommend Pacos enough, thank you for showing quality customer service and the best Mexican food in town.

This is my second time here after not having a good first experience & giving a huge amount of time away from the moment to come back again to give it another try. First time was a hair in the food. Which I have to say they took off of the menu (Ceviche apt.) This time just didn't do anything to make me go back again. I would rather go to an On The Border.  Nice bar selection, but it doesn't make a difference if the bartender can't make a drink. We sent back our drinks 2 times & then I just gave up. Food wasn't anything special either. The quesadilla that should have chicken in it was mostly just filled with cheese. Hubby ordered the beef beef brisket. It was way to salty & cold. I had the fajitas which were tasty. The one great thing is the salsas they offer. Great flavor & heat! Unfortunately it's not enough for me to return. I think this place gets such a high rating for it being in South Park.   No Thanks!

This place is amazing! Both the food and service were A+. Both my girlfriend and I did the three taco entree. It's really cool they let you mix and match and get any three tacos. The Chicken Fried Steak and Smoked Brisket were the best, but really can't go wrong. The tacos are a very good size and the soft shell is nice and thick. I added a bacon stuffed jalapeno which is a must if you like spicy.  The service was just as great as the food. They refilled our chips before we were even done. Not just putting new chips on top of the ones still in the basket, but giving us a full basket of fresh ones. Also, the manager came around and refilled waters. I would say we had a total of three plus our waitress serve us.  Overall we can't wait to come back to Charlotte and for Paco's to be our first stop!

Love the food. Liked it even better when they had the trivia game, but they got rid of it. Sadly we probably won't be going as often without it, but still a good choice when you want a good tex-mex meal.

Super solid place to grab lunch. I was visiting a friend and she loves this place so off we went. The place was pretty busy for Saturday lunch and our server was prompt and kept up with his busy tables pretty well. I ordered the fajitas and it was a good portion, I wasn't super hungry so I split with a friend and it was more than enough. The veggies were seasoned perfectly and I could have just ate those and skipped the chicken. My friends ordered the lunch taco plates and they were all satisfied. The chips, queso, and guacamole was also a pretty tasty started. I mean can you ever really go wrong with queso?! We had a bit of a hard time finding the place since we parked in the back lot, but the signs were fairly clear to help us find our way!

I love this place for the out of the box type of Mexican. I always get the chimichanga and last night it delivered, as usual. The salsa happens to be my favorite in the surrounding area, not too runny, not to chunky with the perfect heat. The cadaliac marg was refreshing, but not too sweet! Wait staff was decent, but they are steadily busy all night.
Love the tacos queso!  Yes, the QUESO is important!  Great atmosphere and sides.  Fantastic fajitas!

Wonderful place to catch up with some old friends! Our waitress kept the chips and salsa filled on top of being attentive. The food was good. The margaritas were great. Overall, wonderful experience! Also, I liked the atmosphere too - many cool decorations!

I was meeting a friend here for linnet. Around 4, so definitely not lunch but a bit too early for dinner. Anyways, I had never been here before and the restaurant is actually a decent size. We sat next to the kitchen entrance, right in front of a television (it was football Sunday!).  When I sat, I was almost immediately greeted and asked if I knew what I would like to drink.  My friend and I were chit chatting a bunch (we had not seen each other in quite a while) and she did check on us twice before I was ready to order - which was perfectly fine! She was very polite about it. When it came down to it, I asked her opinion and I took her suggestion.  I ordered two taco platter; the paco taco and the shrimp taco, no beans.  The food came out relatively fast. But I was munching on chips and salsa (the salsa was a bit hotter than I expected, but definitely delicious!). The rice was nice, not dry! They did provide a slaw but I did not eat it too much - but it wasn't that bad. The tacos... the brisket one (Paco's) was flavored nice but the taco was over stuffed and when I bit into it I grabbed wayyyy more meat than I wanted and it was a mess. So instead I just ate it with my fork. The shrimp taco was good (but not enough sauce). The shrimp and battered and fried. The server was super nice and sweet. She checked on us just the right amount of times and was not overbearing.  The food, was not the best but pretty good. I definitely will be back!!
Top tacos in Charlotte. Paco's Tacos. Bring your appetite!  Bartenders do a great job as well in case you're thirsty.
Best chicken tortilla soup around. Very hearty and brothy at the same time. Delicious!

I decided to try something different tonight and ventured out to try this place. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I ordered the white fish tacos which were absolutely delicious! Compared to most Tex Mex places its a little more expensive with slightly smaller portions. I will most definitely go back to this place.

I visited Paco's for the first time during Restaurant Week along with a lot of others! My friend made 7:00 p.m. reservations on a Tuesday night and the place was packed! The only sour note was that, even with reservations made, we still had to wait around 15 minutes to be seated. However, it was worth the wait....  The restaurant week menu offered A LOT of food plus a margarita for $30/person. The drink special was the No Name margarita (very good!) with offering of four other courses. First course was choice of queso (beef, white, or yellow) - my table ordered each one since there were three of us. ALL GOOD!  Second course offered choice of pork nachos or guacamole. Two of us ordered the guac, which is prepared table-side with choice of it being smooth/creamy or chunky and level of spice. I asked for chunky guac and for it to be made 'medium' but I didn't really taste much spice.  Third course was choice of tacos, various enchiladas, or fajitas. I went for the three tacos (get choice of tortilla): Shrimp, fish, and turkey club tacos. The shrimp taco was my favorite with choice of beans and rice.  For dessert, choice of tres leches cake or brownies with strawberries. I went for the brownies.  With all of the choices offered, you would think the portion sizes would suffer but they did not. Everything was delicious and generously sized. There was no way I could finish everything so I had my remaining guac (which I was able to snack on for three extra days) and tacos packed up to go.  I will DEFINITELY be going back to Paco's because I think I've found a new favorite Mexican spot.

I typically don't write reviews -- so you can take this with a grain of salt.   I tried to order take-out and was placed on hold. I waited 3.5 minutes before deciding to hang up and try again. I was placed on hold again... this time I waited a full 5 minutes before deciding to hang up and try again. The third time I was placed on hold before getting a chance to say what had happened. The fourth time I was told I would HAVE to be put on hold to send the call over to the bar.   I gave up.

I just tried this place for lunch with my friend and LOVED it! I had the Enchiladas de Dennis, which was recommended by the server, and ate it all up! The rice, beans, and salsa were also all very good and I can't wait to go back. The bar looked nice, and I loved the bar stools. Next time, I'll be coming at dinner time so I can also try out their margaritas :)

Loved our time here! Very nice decor in a very nice shopping center. Kendel our waitress was great! She explained the drinks in order of popularity and intensity. The house salsa is spicy which is great for me because we love spicy! The food was outstanding! I got the enchiladas de Dennis which was a great twist on your standard enchiladas and my mom got bacon wrapped shrimp which were also delicious! Would definitely come back!

Had high hopes for this place.  Made reservations for 7pm, got a table at 8pm.  First thing I ordered was out.  Waiter recommended something else.  The food was horrendous - not just bad flavor, fundamentally inedible.  This place is typical for Southpark restauarants - crowded and very marginal food.
Delicious!! The tacos are outstanding. The fried fish and the pulled pork were my favorites. The service was extremely fast and the chips and salsa was very tasty.

I seriously don't even know where to start! There are just so many great things about Paco's Tacos that it's hard to pick.   We arrived for a late lunch on a Saturday afternoon. There was a super short wait. The place was packed! I have never seen a restaurant turn over and clean tables so efficiently and well. It made my previous server heart happy!   We were seated quickly and instantly greeted by our server, Roger. He was super attentive and personable. Having been our first time here, he was also helpful in making some taco suggestions.   We ordered the chili con queso dip. It came out fairly quickly and was so delicious. It was flavorful and creamy. Their salsa is amazing. Smokey and a but spicy. Loved it!  I ordered two tacos, steak and the shrimp. It comes with red rice, coleslaw and your choice of beans. It opted for black beans. I also put those tacos in a corn tortilla. My hubby ordered the chicken enchiladas and our kiddo ordered the chopped salad.   My tacos were outstanding. My eyes were bigger than my tummy and I ended up bringing my steak taco home. I just couldn't power through. The shrimp taco was so delicious. Lots of flavor and a little bit of heat. Absolutely outstanding. My hubby and kiddo equally enjoyed their food.   I wish we had a Paco's where I live. I would eat there about every day. There were still several tacos I would love to try. Definitely will back!
Flavorful, complexly satisfying Tex-Mex. Try the enchilada sampler and 3 tacos on a date and share with each other (enough leftovers for another entire email). Superb!

Wish I came here more. Might possibly be best tequila selection in town. They have a lot of high end stuff including Don Julio Real and Clase Azul. Not too surprising because of the south park location. The service is on point and very prompt. As soon as we sat down we were greeted and the manager welcomed us with arms full of chips and salsa (; The tortillas used for the tacos are awesome! Our favorites to get are the 'Paco's tacos' brisket and the chicken 'Milanese'. Can get a little crowded on Friday nights (like most places). Try to arrive around or before 5 or you might be forced to sit and dine with one of the chatty regulars at the bar. We dig Paco's tacos.

We had excellent service. The salsa was good enough to drink! Light crispy chips and perfect guacamole. I had a house margarita. It was good, but light on tequila. For my dinner, I had the brisket tacos. They were delicious! The charro beans were good, too. Definitely plan to go.back!

Go here! Our waiter, John was awesome and helpful with our menu choice.  We had the seafood ceviche for an appetizer..$10 very good, and each of us had the combo #2 and substituted the pork tamale for the paco taco....this was a great meal!  Upgrade for $1 to the side salad..definitely worth it!  We will go back here next time we are in Charlotte!

A star has been added for OUTSTANDING customer service!!!  After writing my original review, I was contacted by "Stephanie" with FS Food Group (Big Daddy's Burger Bar, Mama Ricotta's, Plate Perfect Catering, Cantina 1511, and Paco's Tacos & Tequila).  She apologized for the error with  the $8 split plate fee and asked for a copy of our receipt to clear up the mistake.  To make a long story short, we were charged only $2 for the split plate but they did inadvertently charge us for the dinner portion vs. the lunch portion of fajitas.  Next thing you know, I open my mailbox and guess what's there???  A gift certificate with a handwritten thank you note appreciating my help!  I love a business that "gets" customer service!  Nice job FS Food Group.  I'm a fan.

I love this restaurant!  The atmosphere is fun and the service is awesome.  I like how the Chef takes pride in his food and features new dishes and specials that aren't on the menu.  The firestarter margarita is AMAZING-infused tequila topped  with a jalepeno garnish.  They give you options for a variety of beans, rice and have the whole wheat tortilla available.  Great place for an all around great experience!
Love this place.. it's cute inside, good service, amazing food.. the tortillas are homemade and everything tastes really fresh

I may be mistaken but I think these are the same people that used to own Cantina  1511 before they jacked up the prices and the quality went downhill. Regardless, I really like this place. It is in a great location tucked behind South Park Mall so people from all areas south of 277 can get to it with ease. I don't really tend to notice ambiance unless it is for a date or there is something special. However, there is something (which I can't put my finger on) that personally put me at ease here. The food is mid-range priced Tex-Mex but high quality taste. Even the chips are noticibly better than other Tex-Mex restaurants. The complimentary salsa has a bit more kick than most. It is tasty but be forewarned. I tend to always end up gravitating to the tacos and depending on appetite, and how many free chips I've consumed, I can order two or three (I can always take home that third). They have some pretty unique taco options and what is great is that you can mix and match. I have not tried a bad one yet. Although I am still working my way down the menu ;-) Also, if you are here with your friends, be festive and grab one of their signature margaritas. They are delicious!

I stopped in when I was traveling for business and have been back a few times when I am in the area.  This is a great restaurant for Tex-Mex food. The chips and salsa are addicting. The chips have the perfect amount of salt. The menu has a lot to choose from. The margaritas are good and the service ranges from okay to good depending on the crowd.  The food isn't the best Mexican food I've ever had, but it's good, it's always good, everything on the menu is good. It's consistent, it's fresh, and the portions are more than you'll need. Chicken burrito is a bit dry but works with salsa. Shrimp tacos are very good, with a decent amount of shrimp. Steak quesadilla is very cheesy (white cheese) and the tortilla has the perfect slight crispness. Food is also quickly prepared.

The food and service were excellent.  Best Tex-Mex outside of Texas.  Everything about this meal was perfect.  From the delicious chips and salsa to the entrees.  I'm not a fan of food made spicy for the sake of being hot.  Both of the salsas and the queso had a spicy flavor without being hot.  One of the highlights was the three Shiner beers on tap: Bock, 102, and the Ruby Red.  All fresh and cold, and only $5 for 20 oz.  We had two entrees: the barbacoa special and the enchiladas.  I've never had better.  Usually enchiladas are just a mess of cheese and a sauce.  These were flavorful and bite after bite you could taste the distinctive flavors.

Normally, I don't put a lot of thought into the service I receive. Take my order, bring my food, and drop off/pick up check. My main concern is always the food.  Good enough to come back or nah?  I had great food and service during my first visit to Paco's.  The food came out fast and my waitress was really nice and helpful. Can't remember her name because of course I was only focused on the food at the time. We began with the smoked bacon wrapped jalapenos. I think there was cheese inside but I was focused on the bacon, which was nice and crispy and definitely not undercooked or burnt. I had the enchilada sampler which was good overall. My least fav was the roasted veggie enchilada.  There was cinnamon-y or something flavor that was just weird and the black bean sauce over top made it look unappealing.  I ordered the Texas mule to drink which was pretty tasty but I should have gone with a margarita.  My companions had the outlaw steak fajitas and the ambushed shrimp.  I tried the shrimp and it was really good but honestly anything wrapped in bacon is gonna be dynamite. I left Paco's stuffed and planning a return visit.  Yum!!

Love this place! Really nice staff, competent servers, delicious food. (And very reasonably priced! Bonus.) My kiddos love anything that involves beans and rice and this restaurant is within walking distance from our house. Perfect. Endless chips and salsa for the kids and a margarita for mama. Does it get any better than this?  My husband and I have also ordered take out and were pleased with that as well. The other night I really just wanted to order chips and salsa to munch on while watching March Madness, I had no need for a huge meal - much to my surprise I could order an individual taco for $4. I ordered the crispy shrimp taco in a crispy corn taco shell, my husband ordered a veggie quesadilla (Friday during Lent for all you Catholics out there...no meat!) and our grand total came to $14. This $14 included a HUGE bag of crispy chips and two kinds of salsa. I felt a little guilty paying less than $15 for dinner! But I got over it.  Thumbs up! It always looks busy so I guess people keep coming back. If you haven't given it a try, I recommend you check it out.

Delicious Mexican food and absolutely amazing jalapeño margaritas. Location is hidden so it is hard to see. I was recommended here by a co-worker and now always tell everyone to go there, because otherwise you may not know it is there.

I just love this place!  Whenever I'm in South Park I make an excuse to come here for tacos! My absolute favorite is the turkey carnitas tacos.    Things to remember about the tacos- they are BIG.  If you aren't a big eater two may be a lot.  They also come with slaw, beans and rice.  There's a ton to choose from.  I also like the fish, but any are delicious.  They also come with a choice of 4 or 5 different tortillas which include wheat, corn, flour, low carb...maybe another!  Try this place out for delicious Tex mex...but with a place like Pacos Tacos- trying the tacos is pretty much required.  They also have different drink specials depending on the day and a nice little patio.  If you're having a taco craving in South Park, this is the place!

Mmm. Mmm. Mmm. Some places you can tell are going to be good , just by walking past them and getting a whiff of what they're cooking. Pacos Tacos is definitely one of those places. I tried this place for the first time , after completing a Barre class at a studio within walking distance . I ended up getting a chicken taco bowl ( on the menu it's called a Fiesta Bowl), that was awesome. The fajita chicken was grilled just right, none of that rubbery chicken business. I will definitely be keeping this place in mind the next time I visit the South Park area.
This place is awesome!! Don't go on weekends as the wait is awful.  Food is great.  A bit pricey for mexican food.

I've eaten at Paco's a bunch of times for lunch over the past four years. My employer's regional office is in South Park, so this is one of a handful of restaurants my co-workers frequent when we're in town for a meeting or training. I've never been here for dinner, but I highly recommend Paco's for a tasty and hearty lunch.  I typically get the tacos- they have several different combos that are good. Brisket, fish or shrimp, skirt steak, and gringo beef are all good. The sides of rice and refried or black beans are a good compliment. My favorite other than the tacos is the "bacon egg and cheese" enchilada. It has jalapeño bacon with a chili/gravy and a fried egg on top. Not the healthiest thing in the world, but so tasty!    Service is typically good. It can get slow during busy times like many other places, but I don't remember any issues. I can eat here once a month or more and still keep coming back.
