Tasteless .. please save your money and do not come here. This is anything but authentic Mexican food. Guacamole was literally just smashed up avocados with zero seasoning. I really dont know how this place has a high rating

You know when people rave about a place and then maybe your expectations are too high?  Maybe that's what happened here cuz I thought it was sorta average.    Good food but not the wow factor I thought would happen.  The chili was beanless (yay) and came with sour cream, cheddar, and scallions.  The flavor was good, but would have liked more kick.  Also had a shrimp taco, and while it was also good, I wouldn't make a special trip for it.  Great service, ample seating, but it's the kind of place that I'd probably never argue if someone suggested going, but the suggestion wouldn't come from me.

Good sangria. Food mediocre.   Food - I was able to finally gotten around to this place. Heard good things from the hubby. I had ordered the "Dennis Enchiladas," and was let down by the dry meat, dried rice, and it was not satisfying.  The only thing that made me happy was the delicious red sangria.  Price - it was not that bad, the price was decent, especially when you get a large portion of food on your plate (that I was not expecting - suddenly, I felt full).  Service - We had a kind waitress that was attentive.  The Tex-Mex food was alright and nothing to rave about. As a native Houstonian, I was disappointed. Ah well.
delicious, great service, was extremely busy and we still got a table, prompt & delicious food, the Guacamole is yummy and made fresh in front of you! Of course you must try the Tequila.
Their chips are amazing and I have tried so many of their tacos. It is an amazing place to eat and has a great environment/setting to eat in. Definitely one of my top 5 places to eat of all time.

I stopped in for tacos during the evening around 9:00 pm and there were people there but it was not overflowing.  Since I went by myself I sat at the bar.  I was greeted promptly, my drink order was taken and the chips and salsa arrived quickly, always a plus.  I ordered the smokey and the brisket taco and the  fish, which comes grilled or fried. They offer a choice of tortillas, corn or flour and hard or soft tacos.  They have charro beans, refried or black.  The food was very flavorful and the portions were generous.  Two tacos with the beans and rice was a large meal.  I chose the charro beans and they were great.   If you aren't real hungry, one taco would be enough.  The only reason I am not giving this five stars was due to the follow up service from the bar.  No one asked if I wanted another drink or checked back with me once the food arrived except to drop the bill and they weren't that busy.  Still, I would recommend and return to try some of the other tacos.

Well I had never had tex-mex before and I was very curious!  This is my first experience eating brisket (I was told this is the best thing to order at a tex-mex place) and it was delicious!  ....And there is a but....So I am a Northerner and I probably have this wrong so please forgive me....but am I allowed to compare brisket to bbq in the sense that good bbq usually does not have a lot of fat or grisel or bones?  Is brisket supposed to have clumps of fat in it?  If so - and if I am clueless, please forgive the reference to it and skip my review, but if you are the tiniest grossed out by big pieces of fat, dont get the brisket here.  Ok fat conversation over.  Other than that the brisket that I got in my tacos was very tender and delicious.  Yet I was kind of wondering 'where is the rest?'  I gave this place only two stars because the hard-shelled tacos I got had probably three good mouthfuls of brisket and no lettuce or other fillings in them so they pretty much came out 1/3 full for over ten bucks?  (I ordered two tacos but I think you can order 1 or 2 or 3).  No amount of dry Spanish rice on the plate could make up for it.  The meal also came with your choice of beans which were very good.  The pic posted shows the truth of portion size so judge for yourself.    Service was excellent and they were constantly adding chips to the basket on the table.  Sigh...in the end I couldnt get over the fat I had to pick through or that it cost so much for so little.  I hope to try this place in a few weeks and add more stars.

We went there for the first time on the reviews on YELP. It was very good and the service was very good. Emily was very friendly and she kept up with our drinks. She knew the menu very well and steered us toward the best tacos on the menu.  We will be back even with the somewhat limited menu. We would have liked to see burritos, but everything else was worth the visit.
Love this place!!! The choice of tacos is incredible. My favorite is the Paco Taco, but I don't think you can go wrong with any of them. Get the queso with the chips. Great atmosphere.

Paco's is pretty good, but not great. The chips and salsa are incredible, but they were more flavorful than the tacos that I had. My wife had the chimichanga, which was average.   The chips and salsa as well as the drinks will bring me back here, but I might skip the tacos next time.

great food and margaritas. I normally don't like margaritas but tried theirs and they are fantastic.  chips and salsa are also very good..salsa has a little kick to it of which I am a big fan. Try the tuna tacos..tons of food and great taste.  tons of sushi grade tuna in the tacos. desserts are very good too.

Wow, I enjoyed eating at Paco's Tacos. Try their Unholy Guacamole to start. I enjoy their beef burrito and enchiladas too.  The portions are large and the prices are reasonable.  I have never had room for desert.

Paco's Tacos automatically gets a star for awesomely rhyming their name.  I could say that all day...Paco's Tacos.  Well done, branding team!  But really, that's not why I come here.  As far as Mexican Restaurants go in Charlotte, Paco's gets a solid gold star.  This place is always packed.  Usually I sit at the bar so I can be a bit more relaxed.  The bartenders won't bother you because they are running around making drinks for the tables, so if you want something, you have to flag them down.  Decor is pretty standard and welcoming.  It's not a modern or rustic or modern rustic vibe.  Just good ole' Mexican Restaurant decor.  Food is, well, YES.  I recommend starting with the cheese dip.  It comes out quick and it's really good.  You can add beef or chicken to give it some extra flavor.  TIP:  Add a side of Tortillas for $1.  It's like you can make mini quesadillas while you wait for your meal.  If you're not full by then, order the tacos or fajitas.  Usually I am full, so I end up with the small chopped salad with grilled chicken.  The menu is pretty "health friendly" if you can stay away from the chips, but has lots of the good stuff for those who want to splurge.  Margaritas are a little on the sweet side, service can be a bit slow, and this place can be a zoo around 7pm.  If you're willing to put this aside for some decent Mexican Food in the South Park area, Paco's Tacos is your place!  FYI-Bar is great for a date or hanging out with friends or by yourself, while the rest of the restaurant is family friendly.
Great Mexican. Clinton is a fantastic waiter. Knowledgable about food allergies!  Fantastic

Wonderful place! The jalapeño margarita is insanely good. They have some healthy options and they have both white or yellow queso depending on your preference which is nice. Found my new marg spot! Great service and nice patio! We were able to sit outside but still see he TVs during a football game.

In CLT for the GAMECOCKS vs NC State; met a couple that are a couple, good Friends of Life, Many Moons, Howl @ The Moon, Tall-Tales, and Adult Libations at 1145 AM....Menu similar if one has been on the Pacific Coast of Mexico "Americano got the Sleepy Eyes", Ahhhh "Yes please"....a cold Pacifico Cerveza, Shrimp Tacos/Sliced Cabbage/Pico de Gallo and a pre-celebratory shot....chilled "Casamigos Gold"...Damn tasty and smooth....We returned after Da-Game for dinner....Smoked jalapenos wrapped in bacon (Have to keep my Infidel Status current), a platter of "Ambushed Shrimp" shared with my Lady by my side, several tasty margaritas....Staff was friendly and constantly greeted with a Smile !!!!  By the Way.....GAMECOCKS WON; just saying.......

We got guacamole to start and the had a taco salad and enchilada for lunch. The food is good for Tex Mex, but nothing too special.  It wasn't too crowded for lunch, so it was easy to get a table to relax before shopping at South Park Mall.

I forgot I came here years ago, didn't think it was all that. Came back and even years later food not that good. A very poor take on Mexican food. Not even close, but at least they don't pretend to be a Mexican joint.

If you can get a table the food isn't bad...nothing great...average and certainly acceptable. On several  times (usually Friday -Sunday) my family has strolled in for a casual dinner to find a 45 to 60 minute wait. Frustrating and certainly not worth it.
Great place to grab a quick bite. Not the best taco's I've had in my life, but everything there is well above average. Prices are very reasonable.
Great homemade margaritas! Have gone back twice since I first went. Gets better each time.

Delicious! I went with a big group and everyone was very satisfied with their food. We had a bit of a wait due to being with a large group so we sat at the bar and had some margaritas. I would recommend sticking with what you know. I ordered the cucumber margarita thinking it would be refreshing but it had a little too much cucumber flavor and pieces (kind of chunky..yuck). I then ordered the classic and it was too sweet and had too much mixer so if you don't like sweet, let them know before they make it! Drinks may have not been the best but the food was phenomenol. I recommend the combination platter becuase you get a little bit of everything! The tortillas are the best item hands down.If you get tacos, make sure to get soft tacos!! All of the food was delicious, you can't go wrong!

Pacos Tacos never disappoints! The portions are huge enough to feed a small army. Ha! You gotta try the margarita! They have a lively bunch crew & not bad to look at. Don't fill up on the chips & salsa
Atmosphere is great plenty of food. We found this when we were in charlotte. One time on way back from up North this was the place we thought of. We will return often.

Very big fan of the food & service is fairly good for Charlotte. Always packed at lunch which tells the story... My issue is the drinks are exceptionally weak.. You wonder if they even put tequila in the margaritas.
Not a huge fan of tex mex but this place is pretty good.

Paco's Tacos, like most Mexican restaurants, brings you out a big bowl of chips and salsa to start with.  This is great, but unfortunately the salsa tastes like marinara sauce spiked with hot sauce..  We tried the No Name Margarita and another one which I forget the name, but it was fruity with some orange flavor.  We honestly did not like either flavors but they were definitely strong.  The homemade guacamole is pretty good and we ordered quesedillas which were good as well, but the food came out much too quickly.  If we wanted fast food we would have gone to taco bell!  We were hardly able to enjoy the chips and drinks before they brought our meals out.  Overall I really don't recommend, there are much better Mexican places out there!

Went here when I was 39 weeks pregnant for a lunch date. I have been obsessed with all food Mexican for the past several months and am all about good Tex-Mex.  atmosphere was good, lunch crowd was busy but not overwhelming. Our server went over the specials and I decided on two tacos.  One was shredded pork and the other was chicken and they were both very good.  Nothing outstanding..... I would be open to trying a margarita there and another more authentic dish.

Been wanting to try Paco's for a while. After Reading all of the great reviews for months we finally made it. Tucked away in South Park, the area the restaurant is in very cool.   The service was very friendly, lots of smiles which always makes the meal taste a little better in my opinion.   We ordered their drink specials. A rusty el Camino and a peach margarita. Both were lovely. the el Camino was really good.   I ordered the fajitas. the portion was smaller than I expected, but the steak was good. I left full. My wife ordered the tacos al pastor. It wasn't what we expected. But I believe the place is Tex-Mex. The meat was pulled pork. A nod to the geography, I guess. The taste was good, but my wife said she bit into fat a few times which turned her off.   Overall, the place is cool if you are looking for Mexican food in South Park.

Mexican food especially Tex-Mex is my absolute favorite. I have traveled all over the country and even Mexico to find some of the best tasting Mexican food. Paco's Tacos is by far one of the best places in the country. I truly recommend you make the effort to try this delicious food

Love pacos! The service is great and the food is delicious! They have a great variety of tacos from your regular chicken to pastor. The pastor is definitely my favorite along with the carne Asada. I also love their rice here so I always ask for that as my side. If you visit you must try the margaritas! Can't go wrong with Tequila and Tacos!

This place is always busy whenever we go. We went on a Wednesday night and we got sat right away but it was def packed. The salsa here is delicious its got a hint of spice in it which is great since it is not plain. They had good drink specials, tonight it was $3 Mexican beers. I got the enchiladas and they were so good. There was 3 of them and super filling. My friends got the small salad and it was huge too. Our waitress was very sweet and very attentive. The prices are a little more than traditional Mexican restraunts but with the amount of food we got it was worth it. Great tex Mex place to go.

Every time I've been here l've never had a bad meal. I especially love the Smokey & the Brisket taco, along with the skirt steak taco. The taste isn't of a fast food mexican joint rather of a  gourmet tex-mex spot in either mexico or texas.  Pacos Taco & Tequila is a step outta the box.

This place is located across from South Park mall in a mini shopping center. Upon entering I was greeted immediately and seated within 10 minutes.  We were sat at a booth and offered water upon being sat. The waitress came and shared the menu. but only highlighted the blood orange margarita drink. She didn't ask what we liked or typically drink to get a recommendations and I'm not a blood orange fan.  We placed our order of margaritas.The house sour has a unique taste to it. Didn't quite like it and I recommend asking to taste it before you place your order. The light margarita drink was clear and crisp and I don't typically drink light drinks but this was good and tasted way better then the one with the sour mix. Many of the drinks are made with the house sour mix. I got the tacos- chicken and shrimp which were tasty. The rice was stick, but I liked the refried beans I was nice to dip my chips in. The price was good for what was paid.  It's a nice addition to the area.

I know a ton of people have been here already,  but I just got had my experiece recently for my birthday.  It's not #1 on my list because it's far out, but definitely worth the drive and time.   First, I'll say I love a good margerita, a different flavored margarita (apparently from my previous review at Verde). They had a Honeydew Margarita. Pretty good. Not enough Honeydew flavor, but the alcohol content was on point. :)   Food was very satisfying. My girlfriends and I got the combination item - 1 Taco, 1 Quesidilla,and 1 Burrito. Great section of everything plus you got both rice and beans. Everything was very tasty. I got a a chicken burrito and taco and beef burrito. I'm partial to burritos mainly because I like the sauce. This one proved to be worthy,  as well. Our table also got a Guacamole and Cheese dip to share. Nothing fancy or overly superior in taste, but always a good addition when you go Mexican.   I liked that the location wasn't overall crowded either. Very steady for a week night but still space to sit with no wait. Only reason for a 4 was location being too far out and the margarita wasnt that sweet. I will be returning.

Brisket tacos - not to be missed. El Dorado Margarita is fresh and tasty. The only downside to Paco's is that it's pricey. It's worth it once in a while, but can't be an every week kind of a place. It's hard to find - behind Williams Sonoma in the shopping center across from South Park Mall. LOVE this place - feels like Austin, TX at a tacky BBQ joint but has great mexican food.

I have been to Paco's Tacos several times so I must say I was a bit disappointed with my meal on Saturday.  Overall the taste was just OK and there was a hair in my food.  The salsa was smokier than normal and overall I thought that flavor was just blah.  My server was excellent though, and I enjoyed a Mango Margarita on the rocks which was delish.  We got there at 5:30 and by 6 it was packed and VERY loud.    I will go back again and hope this was just an off night for the cook.

Don't be fooled by the four star rating after 300+ reviews! I was, and again reminded that the rating doesn't always guarantee good food! I knew the moment that I pulled in to the outdoor, upscale shopping center, that this was going to be a typical chain Mexican cuisine with inflated prices. Yes it's like walking into a Chili's with Mexican decor! The margarita special of the night had no tequila in it, and it was so tart and sweet that we kept pouring water in it to dilute it! The Chicken and Steak Fajitas combo we ordered to share was delivered with skeptic looks from us. For $19 I was expecting even more than you'd get from your favorite American Mexican spot! Well it was more like a 1/3 of that amount with a separate plate with a dab of sour cream, guacamole, shredded cheese, tomatoes, and a couple of shredded lettuce particles! Despite the overpriced incredibly small portion size of this dish, the skirt steak was really good and equally impressive was the tender chicken breast slices! Despite the quality of the two meats, they tasted like anything you'd get from Applebee's or Chili's. The rice, charro beans, tomatoes, guacamole, and cheese were all just bland. The one highlight though is the house made tortillas! These are phenomenal and straight out of some street vendor in San Diego! Perhaps I'm spoiled now? Perhaps I'm just over these mall style Mexican restaurants with their weak $12 margaritas? Or perhaps we should just expect better? You could certainly do worse than Paco's Tacos, but you could pay half that and find something way better in the ever more available taquerias that dot every city's landscape!

I came here for brunch when all the breakfast places were packed on Sunday and was not disappointed. The cucumber jalapeno margarita was the best margarita I've ever had, super refreshing. The queso with pineapple was unique and awesome. I also had the shrimp and fish tacos and they were cooked and seasoned well. Highly recommend, I'll definitely be back.

These were the most amazing tacos!! I love the fact you can mix and match which your tacos. Now lets talk margaritas... Holy Tequila!! I imagine you can't go wrong with any choice, the tequila menu is so large, I don't know how to choose, but all I can say is YUMMO!!

Possibly the best tex mex in Charlotte, NC. We don't have a lot of great Mexican restaurant around but if someone was to ask me where I want to eat for Mexican food... I would either suggest Paco's Tacos or Sabor Latin Street.   I have sampled a few of the tacos and they're all pretty delish. If your not as hungry I would suggest ordering the chicken tortilla soup bowl. It's perfect for cold nights and it will fill you up for only $5. We also tried a jalapeno shot. Please do yourself a favor and don't try it thinking it's cool or something. We tried it and I felt like there was a goldfish inside my stomach instantly... No bueno. Other than that everything is pretty awesome not the mention the service and the lovely dim light atmosphere. Enjoy!

Excellent food- some of the best Tex Mex I  have ever eaten.  Restaurant was about 3/4 full, which is not bad for a Monday! We were seated immediately and the service was great! The portions were huge. So many things on the menu looked really good-I had the steak fajitas and they were delicious, the flour tortillas are made on site. Definitely will be going again!

Popped into this joint one afternoon to watch some of the world cup and eat tacos. We tried a variety of their offerings from cerviche to various types of tacos. No complaints there. Food was average and everyone seemed happy with what they ordered.   My biggest complaint would be that I tried to order 3-4 different drinks off their drink menu, and each time the waiter returned a few minutes later to tell me their did not have the ingredients to make it. Not being able to make a mojito or margarita in a mexican restaurant seems kinda odd.. Especially during the world cup games when business should be booming.

I live about 2 mi. from this spot and have never been there, but man, am I happy I found this hole in a soft shell.  If you're looking for authentic Mexican food, this isn't it, but if you're in the mood for Tex-Mex, this was awesome. When we sat down our server stopped by to let us know she was a bit busy, but she knew we were there and she was coming right over! Sometimes a little bit of expectation setting can go a long way. We had the white cheese dip. The dip had the white cheese flavor you would expect, but a bit more salty and creamy. I had fish tacos and they were AWESOME! My husband had the shrimp tacos and they were loaded with small shrimp and he said it was very filling. The atmosphere was great, the service super friendly and quick and I'll definitely be back soon.
Literally the BEST salsa I've ever had!!  Sat at the bar  - great attentive service.  Lots of choices on menu - but I could have just eaten chips and salsa for dinner!  (:

So we made reservations and when we got there, the line was out the door. We waited for a few minutes at the front door. It was very uncomfortable as it was humid and there was a stench coming from somewhere? They brought us around to the back side in front of the window. That was great. But it was evident that we weren't going to get served anytime soon. Our waitress went to every table around us, including a couple that was seated 5 minutes after us???? I was calm as I wanted to have a nice evening. But I really wanted to get up and leave after 15 minutes! When her mood ring changed the right color for her to serve our table, I ordered a strawberry rita on the rocks. Way to sweet. Move on to the Dennis enchiladas. Those made everything better. They had a creamy cheese sauce on top, instead of a lump of hard melted plastic. Very good and filing. The service picked up as the evening wore on, but the place was empting out as well. this would have been a four star review, but....

How in the world haven't I written a review on this place!? It's one of my favorite restaurants in all of Charlotte!   Every meal starts with the chips, which most of the time are hot and fresh. They're free and come with salsa that is mild and a bit smoky. That's good on it's own, or you can get queso (my fav queso) or tableside guac.   For the main course I tend to rotate between various tacos, fajitas, or the top big taco salad. Never ordered anything I didn't like.   This place is also awesome for margs. The regular marg does you just fine, but if you're picky about your tequila, they've got so many options! They also tend to do seasonal ones and my fav so far has been a watermelon one.   If you get a chance to go during restaurant week, do it! It's a ton of food for the value. Everything listed above and maybe even a little more, all for $30 per person.

I've been branching out a bit here lately and decided to try Paco's for a late lunch on Saturday.  My daughter has Celiac so we have to be choosy about where we eat and Paco's has good reviews among the community of people eating in the Queen city that have allergies as a good, safe place to go.  I've been to Southpark a million times and always overlook this shopping center across the street.  Paco's is there on the side and has nice, indoor and outdoor seating.  Nice menu and the chips and salsa are wonderful and I'm pretty sure they fry them in a separate fryer so they're not comingled with wheat items.  I had 2 tacos Brisket and Shrimp and they were wonderful.  They certainly don't skimp on ingredients and the tacos were totally on point.  My daughter had the Smokey & the Brisket taco also and she really enjoyed it.  Best of all, we topped it off with $.50 ice cream for dessert.  In my situation where I enjoy eating out and have to find places that won't have my daughter puking her guts out afterwards I have grown to appreciate places like this.  Paco's will now be on our rotation for good, solid, food in Southpark!  Great job!
I had a margarita.  It was delicious--although I would call it a "East Coast" Margarita 'cause it was a bit too sweet.  The bartender was quite friendly.

Excellent guacamole made table side. Their tequila mixes drinks are very unique and very delicious. It can get very crowded on the weekends and there's not much room to wait inside after the bar fills up but every time I have been there they get you seated within 20 minutes.  Wait staff is always great. They sent us home with a bag of chips and salsa to go once. Another time my boyfriend left his iPhone at the table and  the kept it for him until he got back to pick it up. Highly recommend this one

Food is good and get alot of it, I did love the re fried beans that they serve. Two taco plate will fill you up for sure.   Serves was slow but it was a Friday and place was busy when we first got there, but then sorta emptied after that first dinner rush.   Best part of the whole experience was a young man that worked there Jeffery was so nice and really took to talking to our daughter. But just watching him he seemed to work so much harder then the rest of the staff and I hope he gets rewarded for the way he treats customers and his customer service.

Went to Pacos Tacos tonight for the first time and will surely be returning! Good food, good drinks, AMAZING service!!  CJ was fantastic! He asked if it was our first time and helped us through the menu with great picks! I had mentioned the salsa was a little spicy and without missing a beat he brought out another salsa for us. He was honest and helped us decide on our orders and was very attentive and super funny! CJ alone was enough to get us to come back every week! Everyone else on the staff was great, refilling waters at other tables and bringing out more chips.  I can't say anything negative about this restaurant! The only downside was that we filled up on chips and dip and hardly touched our dinner!!

Tried Pacos today after visiting the mall. It was so-so.   The goods: Flour tortillas, chips and salsa, guacamole, and the steak taco.   The tortillas were soft and warm, the salsa perfectly spicy, chips were warm (but a little too salty), guac tastes yummy, and the steak was cooked perfect.   The bads: Chicken taco, drink "specials", price, wait, beans, and rice.   The chicken was bland, drinks were over priced and watered down, pricing for two tacos and boxed rice/canned beans is $11 (way too much), watched many tables get turned away but we were seated immediately at an open table, and there were many... I don't understand their seating here it seems strange.   The averages:  Service - somewhat lacking, she was never close by nor did she check on us often enough. I didn't like my drink, and she never asked about the full glass, but happily put the extra $11 on my tab.   The lowdown, this place is okay, not authentic Mexican food, not terrible, but not worth the price. I dunno, we might we return. We might not.

My family discovered Paco's not long after moving to Charlotte six years ago, and it's still our favorite Tex-Mex restaurant by a mile. The tacos are absolutely wonderful, particularly the beef brisket Paco's and the Wood Grilled Chicken, which come in flavorful orders of two or three. The Chimichanga and Enchiladas are also excellent, and the chips always crisp and delicious.   Every Mexican restaurant lives or dies by its margaritas, and Paco's serves up some of the best in town. My favorite is the El Dorado, now off the menu but still available by request. Service is also friendly and prompt, and the environment is fun and kid-friendly. For my money, Paco's is the best game in town if you're craving Tex-Mex in the Queen City.

The service was fantastic. However, the bacon wrapped shrimp was a bummer. I'm not sure how you create a dish like that and it taste sub par, but they did. It was greasy and some of the bacon wasn't cooked well... leaving it chewy and raw. Mojito was just ok. My man ordered nachos as an entrée and the plate was literally half empty when she brought it. We both looked at it and wondered "where's the rest??" Disappointed. We won't be back.

I'm not a big fan of Mexican food, but the moment our server sashayed with my sizzling platter of fajitas, and all heads turned to the sound and aroma of seasoned steak, I knew I made the right choice coming here.  The Outlaw Steak Fajita I had was very satisfying and are bursting with flavor. It was served with red rice, pico de gallo, and warm homemade four tortillas.  Daily specials: - Mon: $8 Espolon Resposado Margarita * $3 Beer cans. - Tues: $3 NC Pints * $5 No Name Margaritas. - Wed: $3 Mexican Bottles. - Thur: $2 Shiner Bock Pints * $10 Top Shelf Herradura Anejo Margaritas. - Fri: $9 Rusty El Caminos * Friday Night Flights. - Sat: $9 Ace's High Margaritas. - Sun: $3 OMB Pints * Half Price Bottles of Wine.  Three and Half Yelps

Excellent choice, fresh made ingredients,  chips and salsa were excellent. I had wood grilled chicken taco. Very good people was filling along with the rice, beans and cole slaw . Everyone gave it a thumbs up...excellent food and great service. Look forward to our next visit.

We came on a Friday night and the place was quite busy.  We sat at the bar and had a margarita.  I tried the Artic Margarita which is an $8 special on Friday nights (usually $12).  That's nice it's a special for $8 because I really don't think any mixed drink is worth $12 - unless it straight up. The Artic Margarita is good.  I also had the watermelon margarita with a muddled jalapeno. One of the guys had the really peppery margarita which in a way was good but you'd better like spicy.  I have to agree with the rest of the reviewers - the chips are the best!  and the red and green salsa are great as well.  I went for the 2 taco dish ($10 - can't beat that).  I ordered the grilled white fish taco and the skirt steak taco.  Plenty of food and delicious.  Everything looks and tastes fresh.  Everyone at the table really enjoyed their meal.  I did notice that there was a kids menu, so we will definetly be coming back with the kids as well.  One thing I did notice was that the bar scene didn't seem very active.  We left about 9:45p on a Friday night and the place was empty.  Seemed that people just come to eat.  Though they have an extensive margarita menu and a full bar.

Hmm...I really believe this is a 4+ star place, but not everyone is sharing my love for Pacos.  I was graciously invited to check out the place a while back and glad I did. The funny thing is I thought Manzetti's was still at that location?  I bumped into some folks from work, so this place is popular and even met a local micro-brewer from the Coast having some of his beers being tried out at the place that evening so a good time was had by all.  Tucked away near South Park Mall, Pacos is a great little place with some awesome selection of tequila, great guacamole, and a menu that I look forward to trying throughout 2011.  There are specials, but so far I've just ordered off the menu.  The bar is long and the table plenty, plus in the warmer months there is a patio...for which I don't think Charlotte has nearly enough of them.  Texas BBQ is good...and I also like Mexican, but Pacos is the best Tex Mex in these parts hands down.

Their queso and chips are amazing. They also have one of the best margaritas in Charlotte (margarita with no name). I'm sure all of their food is great but I order the enchiladas de Dennis every time.

LOVE Pacos but it's a little disappointing that they don't take big parties. Had a party of 14 and wanted to make a reservation but was told they don't take reservations for large parties from 5:30-8:30pm. Even offered not to necessarily sit together and was told they could not honor our request, the lady I spoke with wasn't the nicest about the situation either. We took our business to a nearby Mexican restaurant who gladly made a reservation.

I attended a conference at the Marriott for two days and ate lunch here both days a few months ago. As a creature of habit I sat and the bar and ordered the same thing. Tacos and chopped salad. Both were flavorful and fresh. The customer service is great, just enough attentiveness although they are busy. I would return 100x if I lived closer!
The guacamole and queso dip for the chips was delicious. Nice beverage menu and the steak quesadilla was pretty good.

Ever met those people that try and convince you they are more interesting than they are, that's pacos and everyone who raves about it. Friendly service  decent atmosphere but dang there food is just "eh". I have been numerous times and it is no better than Any other Mexican Place you have ever been. Remember that time you thought that you would try that Mexican Place off the beaten path near the airport where the hobos hung out front and it ended up keeping you up all night.... that's pretty much how pacos taste,   Sorry south park diehards but this isn't good food

Pacos tacos and tequila has really great food I always wait two hours to get a table when I go so I decided to make a reservation on open table and when I got there ten minutes early my table was not ready and I was told to wait I waited for about twenty minutes and I still wasn't seated so i left and I was texted about an hour later that my table was ready by that time I was home. So rude.
Pack Taco Beef Brisket is a must! Drinks are very good too!! Went back later in the week for Restaurant Week. Again, the menu didn't let me down. Drinks are ridiculous.

Love this place. New go-to Mexican in the South Park area...   If you are into spice, the Cucumber Jalapeno Margarita is amazing!! It is a little bit of spicy overload (even for me) with the chips and salsa but I LOVE IT.  The food is extremely fresh! I recommend getting the guacamole & fajitas and sharing with a friend :)

Can you say once you've tried one Mexican restaurant, you've tried them all? Eh...kind of.  My experience here was no different than other one I've been to.  The food came in large portions (like normal), you get your chips and salsa (like normal) and you'll leave thinking, "Yeah, that was decent Mexican food."  I will say that our server was great.  You rock Elisha!

Food was actually great but bartender was miserable.  I sat at bar for dinner, asked for skinny margarita w/salt (which tnose are sour), hot a super sweet one with no salt.  When I asked for her to fix it so its sour ( maybe more lime juice?l she insisted on sour mix (then it's not skinny) and now it was a big deal.  Ok, let me tell you the skinny has no sugar in it, what ever you did it was either wrong or too much.  Other bartender came over and remade it and took my dinner order.  I thought she was taking over, but alas not. Ot was the blonde bartender with crap attitude. No follow up, no hoes your dinner, no want another drink or dessert, ignored.   Hope management reads this. Ruined what could have been a nice dinner for this business traveler.   Moral here is if they know you're not coming back cause you're "not from here " they dont give toss. Paid bill and left with NO words exchanged, no thank you, no screw you.   I did nothing to deserve this other than request a drink that I thought was made incorrectly.    Girl, bye.

After living in Texas for five years, I'm extremely picky about Tex Mex. This place is LEGIT. It's the closest thing to real Tex Mex I've found in the Carolinas. It's the only place I've found here that has charro beans. The tacos are outstanding and I love the cheese enchiladas. I highly recommend it. It's one of my favorite restaurants of any kind in Charlotte!

Went there last Saturday night with my wife and daughter.  There was about a 20 minute wait.  The server brought the chips and salsa right away. The tomatillo salsa was very good. The service throughout the meal was excellent. The water glasses were constantly filled and the server came by about four times.  The hostess also stopped by. I shared the steak fajitas with my daughter and the meat was cooked just right and the vegetables were good too   My wife had the carnitas and was happy with her meal.  Overall, it was an enjoyable evening and we will return. Not to leave out that the value was good too.

I'm not usually a fan of Tex-Mex, but their Taco's here are fantastic.  As busy as it was, we were seated quickly, had great service, and delicious food.  The shrimp tacos there are particularly tasty.

I have been craving taco so much and I must say that the taco is to die for! You must get some. I had smokey the brisket and chicken milenesa. I was able to substitute the rice and beans for BBQ corn and French fries. Before my meal even came we had about four baskets of chips and salsa! So be careful and don't eat too much of those because you would want to save some room for your tummy. The waiter was super nice and always checked up on us. One of my friends ordered a meal but didn't know there was going to be beans in them and was willing to continue to eat it! The waiter overheard and said shed be glad to remake one without beans! Even thought my friend didn't take the offer, it just showed how incredible the service was. The tacos was so flavorful and filling. You don't think two would fill you up but it will! Just make sure you squeeze some like on the tacos to give it an extra flavor.

Quite possibly our favorite restaurant in charlotte. I usually always get the tacos and my boyfriend gets the fajitas. Normally we like to branch out but our favorites there are so good we don't dare stray... I would absolutely more than recommend this to anyone and everyone! Their margaritas are deliiiiiishhhhhh as well!

Another great restaurant from FS Food Group. The service staff is knowledgeable, helpful and caring about all aspects of service. The tacos are amazing of course but if you are looking for a real treat try the ambush shrimp or shrimp diablo. I pound of shrimp on one and bacon wrapped shrimp on the other how can you go wrong. They are starting to do daily specials on drinks and food always prepared by the well trained bartenders and chefs. So if you are looking for great tex- mex come try this little gem

After having heard many great things about Paco's, we were very excited to try it. Since moving to Charlotte from Texas several years ago, we have not found a true Tex-Mex place that comes close to the real thing. Paco's comes close, but it's got way too much "Carolina flavor" thrown in to truly call it Tex-Mex, or even Mexican, for that matter.  We went on a Friday night. Made an Open Table reservation through Yelp on the same day - super easy and convenient. When we arrived, we were seated right away at a nice window table. My 8-year old was thrilled with the kids' menu/crayon combo, and my hubby and I ordered margaritas and some guacamole to get settled in.  We made the mistake of ordering the Cadillac Margaritas, which were bright blue and way too sweet (they were on special, so we thought we'd try it). Their traditional margarita on the rocks was MUCH better!  Hands down, the BEST part of the meal was the table-side guacamole. Our waiter was enthusiastic about this, and it did not disappoint. He mixed up the guac to our specifications (chunky or smooth? spicy or not spicy?). It was perfectly seasoned and yummy to the last bite. I would go back JUST for the guacamole, it was that good.  Entrees: I am a fish taco fanatic, so I had to order the fish taco. I also got the brisket taco, upon recommendation by our waiter. My hubby ordered the steak burrito. Our son ordered the cheese quesadilla. The food arrived quickly, and was fresh and hot upon the drop. My husband loved his burrito. It was huge! The steak was tender and nicely seasoned. The burrito had a sour cream queso on top, not my hubby's cuppa tea, but he poured some of their house made salsa over it and was happy. My fish taco was supremely good - from the homemade flour tortillas to the crunchy, slightly spicy fried fish (you can also order grilled fish) and creamy slaw topping. I was very happy with this item.  The brisket taco was... weird. As I mentioned, I moved here from Texas where brisket is king. So I had pretty high expectations of the brisket. I was surprised to taste something sweet in my brisket, and it was NOT a pleasant surprise. There were caramelized onions in it, and a chipotle BBQ sauce, which made the whole experience overly sticky-sweet and ruined the brisket, in my opinion. I realize that here in the Carolinas, this sort of sweetness in a savory dish is popular, so I figured the chef wanted to appeal to the regional tastebuds. I wouldn't order the brisket taco again, though. But that's because there are several other items on the menu I plan to try! My son's cheese quesadilla was as expected - my little picky eater was pleased and happily gobbled it up.  Dessert: We were stuffed, but we ordered a Trés Leches cake to go. It was perfection, even a day later after sitting in a plastic container overnight. I highly recommend you try this dessert! It's the real deal. The peanut butter chocolate pie was tempting, too.   Service and aesthetic were both excellent. The tables were a little close, and the restaurant was somewhat noisy, but that only adds to the experience.   All in all, while we did not find "the one" we've been in search of, but we were pleased and will return. My husband still favors Cantina 1511 over Paco's, but I would have to say the guacamole was so good that I would go to Paco's over Cantina any day of the week. : )  If you're in the SouthPark area, and craving Mexican, you won't be disappointed in Paco's. Just be sure to read the product descriptions so you're not surprised when your food/drinks arrive!

Always yummy. Crowded when we came so we had to sit at a high top bar table. My suggestion would be to turn down the air a little. We were freezing! They also need seats with backs on them to be more comfortable. Our food was delicious however!

My party had a reservation and we were seated immediately. This place is good! I ordered the fiesta bowl and it was huge! I could only eat half and had to take the rest home (always a plus). The waitress was really nice and accommodating.  My friend ordered 3 tacos and she couldn't finish them. The serving sizes are huge. This place also has daily drink specials, but we did not order drinks. I'll definitely be back!

I was next door at the barre studio when someone brought in a salad with chicken that smelled amazing. I've been to Paco's 3 times to try each of their salads and all of them were great but my favorite is the chopped salad with beef brisket. The service is great with service from not only the server but a few others to refill drinks, chips, salsa, etc. and the manager coming by to make sure everything is up to our standards. Conveniently located across the mall, this will be added to the rotation of places to eat after some holiday shopping!

I can't even think of an adjective to describe how yummy Paco's is!  I ordered the 2 taco combo and the shrimp and chicken were equally delicious.  All of the food was so FRESH! The portions were huge and our server was so attentive and nice.  And their margaritas? I could have stayed in my booth all day drinking their margaritas and eating the chips and salsa.  DEFINITELY give this place a try - I cannot wait to go back!

Best vege fajitas anywhere.  Wife says the hand made wheat tortillas are the best she's ever had.   The complimentary chips and salsa are fantastic.    I feel sad I can't eat ALL of it!  It's just too much food!!

Tonight's dinner experience was just OK and did not start out well.   We called ahead for directions and were told it was in SouthPark, next to Crate & Barrel. For those who have been there, you know, as we do now, this is not at all where they're located. They're across the street from the mall, behind Williams & Sonoma. We were 10 minutes late to meet our dinner companions as we drove around the mall completely confused. A text from our friends got us back on track.  When calling ahead, we also added our name to the call-ahead seating list, even though they weren't on a wait at the time. We thought they might be by the time we got there 20 minutes later on a Saturday evening, which they were. Our friends, who'd arrived before us, asked if our names were on the list. They were told no, given a pager, and told the wait would be 10-15 minutes. When we arrived, the hostesses were not welcoming or friendly. We asked again about our name being on the list, and lo and behold, they found it. They gave us a new pager. 25 minutes later, after seeing numerous other parties seated, we were seated by another unfriendly hostess.  Sitting two tables away from the large glass windows, there was such a cold draft, I ended up putting my coat back on. I was grateful we weren't seated in the booth right up against the window. However, my table seat location right next to the aforementioned booth, meant the server's & guacamole maker's butts were right in my face when they were waiting on that booth. Ugh.  Tonight's saving grace: our server, Jim. He was on top of things. He was quick to take our order, quick with the drink & chip refills. And when he noticed my husband's chili had come with cheese on it, despite the request for none, he promptly delivered a corrected version (albeit then it was missing the scallions also).  The tableside guacamole is a nice trend I've seen in several restaurants. Paco's is just OK. It was pretty salty but lacking in much other flavor. All four of us felt the same way about that. For the price, I expected better.  Soups and fajitas were good and flavorful. Margarita was OK but overpriced in my opinion. The guys liked both their beers and thought the price was reasonable. (If we go back, I guess I know what drink I'll be getting instead!)  The menu said something about a $2 split-plate charge, which I find rather silly. We're getting the same exact meal, right? We didn't even get an extra plate. What are we paying the extra fee for? Lucky for us, our bill did not include that, which we sheepishly did not point out to our server. (Now if I find out split plates are indeed more generous portions, then I understand the additional fee!)  For the price we paid for this Saturday night out meal, (thank goodness for a $10 coupon!), I expected more from the experience.

Love eating here! We have been a few times and have never been let down. I love the Enchiladas de Dennis, if you are looking for a recommendation.  Mostly, though, I love the knowledgeable staff. Each time I have gone I have tried a new drink and they have been able to offer a great break down of tequila varieties and what may suit my dish or my mood.  Very kind and attentive, every time.

I will start of with saying I am not a huge fan of soft tacos, but these tacos were REALLY good! I was worried that the two taco meal wouldn't be enough to fill me up, but boy was I wrong. I was really hungry and I could only get through one taco with the rice and beans. The beef brisket is PHENOMENAL and coupled with the homemade coleslaw and sauce made for a perfect, flavorful combination. My husband had a burrito, which was also a large and satisfying portion!  If you're in the mood for flavorful street tacos and other Mexican cuisine, I would give this place a try!

YUM.  Paco's has been on my list for a very long time.  Got to check it out the other day and it lived up to my self-created hype about it!  Tried their queso which was steaming hot (it a good way!).....   went well with their chips and salsa.  Ordered a Calamari Taco and a Paco's Taco and both were delicious.  The tacos come with beans, rice and a slaw salad.  It was a lot of food for a decent price.  I'd like to come back to try their larger specials and margaritas.  Service was prompt and friendly.  Waters always refilled and chips and salsa kept coming!  A good experience.

I haven't had the best of luck lately with Mexican places but I was craving it tonight and decided to try someplace new again and ended up here.  Everything surprised me here.  With the chips and salsa, normally the red salsa is the spicy one.  At Paco's, the tomatillo salsa is the spicier of the two.   The chips were kind of average though.    I had trouble deciding on a margarita so I went with the Firestarter which contains jalepeno-infused tequila and ginger beer.  That was actually the spiciest thing I had tonight which wasn't a bad thing. It just caught me by surprise.    I ordered my meal (Paco's Tacos) and I swear two minutes later it was sitting on my table.  What surprised me about this is the sweet sauce on the tacos which was a nice contrast to the spiciness of the salsa and the margarita.  It also came with Chacco beans, rice, and a slaw.   Considering I am not a big beans and rice person, the rice has to be good for me to finish all of it -- and it was.  For dessert I tried the Tres Leches cake which came out beautifully presentted and well it didn't go away the beautifully but it was gone by the time I left.  All in All, Paco's is a nice surprise.  Prices are decent, the service is excellent and the food is wonderful.  This is definitely worth coming back to!

Absolutely love visiting this place. The food is super yum and fresh and their salsa is one of the best I've had in Charlotte.  I love their choice of drinks and my personal favourite is the jalapeno one. The staff is friendly and helpful. THeir suggestions with respect to food and drinks always proved to be nice. Every meal starts with complimentary chips and salsa and you get to choose from their list of tacos, quesadilla, burrito (both bowls and wrap) and fajitas. The menu is that of any mexican restaurant, but the flavours are really fresh and definitely mouth watering.  I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves mexican food or wants to try it out for the first time. THe price is a little bit on the higher side, but I'm not complaining , since it's totally worth it!

I'm starting to look something like a foodie. It's Queen's Feast aka Charlotte Restaurant Week and I had to try it out. The reason I give it 4 stars is because we still had to wait an extra 30 minutes for our 8:30 reservation to get seated. The best part was our waiter Jake who took very great care of us. He went through the entire menu with us and took the time explain what is what. It's $30 for a 4 course meals including a margarita so go before it's over. I will definitely be returning.

As a native Texan, we were anxiously awaiting authentic Tex-Mex in Charlotte, and if anyone could do it right, it would be Frank Scibelli.  Overall it was very good.   Just a few things that could be tweaked - the salsa wasn't quite as good as the salsa at Cantina 1511, and the chip basket needs to be bigger (Texans love their chips and salsa),   there should be some frozen margaritas on the menu, and please add some more draft beer choices.  While I love Shiner and Dos Equis, Lonestar and Pearl are welcome favorites too.  The service was excellent! We look forward to coming back soon.

Stopped in for lunch on a Saturday and had a great meal. Chips and salsa were really good. We tried a bunch of different tacos and were pleasantly surprised. If your a tequila fan this is the place for you. We will definitely be coming back
Had great service. Absolutely delicious food. Got an order of three different tacos  only got to try two: skirt steak and al pastor. Fantastic. Will 100% return here.

Had business lunch here today and I absolutely loved it. The place was tucked away and not super loud, decor was cool, staff was attentive and friendly.  Best of all the food was great, my turkey taco was amazing, the server recommended the brisket taco which was good...But I could have ate three more of the turkey taco's.  The guacamole was way better than average.  Think I find my new favorite Mexican place.
Food is good but service is always lacking.  35 minutes wait time for lunch is unacceptable especially when you only have an hour for lunch.

If you are looking for the place to get delicious, reasonably priced Mexican food with AMAZING service, this is it. Every single time I have ever been to Pacos Taco, I have been blown away. Their margaritas are incredible with tons of variety and seasonal specials. Their tacos are out of this world delicious, and I personally love the Shake Down Shrimp tacos. Their guacamole is delicious and you can have it made any way you like. Every time I order the special, I'm happy I did, whatever it may be, and while I don't really believe in ordering salads in places like this, their salads are amazing as well.  My husband and I work in South Park and this is our number one preferred lunch spot because we are always in and out in under thirty minutes, which is pretty amazing!  The service has never ever disappointed us and we always feel as though the wait staff goes above and beyond to keep their guests happy.  The only downside? I never have leftovers because the food is SO delicious that I scarf it down in one sitting!!! I wish I could post a picture on here of my meals, but again, I scarf it down so fast, that's not something I think about until I'm done...  Pacos, please don't ever change!! You guys are awesome. We will be loyal repeat customers whether we live and work close-by, or happen to move far away!

This place is great!! Probably the best Mexican I've had in Charlotte so far! My friend wanted to go here as it's her fav Mexican place in Charlotte and I can easily see why! From the chips and salsa to the margaritas to the queso, the tacos, to their homemade flour tortillas! Everything was excellent. I was iffy about it at first being a tex mex restaurant but my friend knows my love for Mexican and I trusted her opinion. I'm glad We came because now this is easily my favorite Mexican here! I tried 3 different tacos and each was excellent! They are also huge portions of tacos so beware that your stomach is as big as your eyes! I got the cucumber jalapeño margarita and it was amazing as well, very refreshing! The service was also excellent! Our waitress was on top of drink and chip refills with no hesitation! I already can't wait to come back!

This place never disappoints, from the ambiance, to the service and the food. We first came here during restaurant week and loved it. We came back tonight and ended up sitting in Emma's section (she was our server the first time also) she's awesome, knowledgable and very nice. Anytime we have asked for recommendations she's been able to give us one. The guacamole is DELICIOUS, fresh and made at the table. Bring your appetite because you get a lot and guarantee to take something home. Even the kids fries are good.
Excellent food. Good size portions. The brisket was the best. Great music selection. I will definitely be back. Happy hour has 3$ IPA's. That's all I needed to hear to give it a shot.

Ordered the shrimp tacos on a wheat tortilla and the chicken tacos on a corn tortilla. The wheat tortilla held so much better, and I absolutely loved the shrimp tacos. They were crispy and warm. Their waitress was nice! My friend and I went of a Monday night and didn't wait at all. Would highly recommend... only suggestion would be more outdoor seating! I only saw four tables from where I was sitting (right behind the host stand), which were full. Other than that, I am certainly coming back.

The tacos are great! Quest blanco con chile is also a great choice. My hubby got the PacoTaco with shredded pork, said it was amazing. I had the grilled fish taco on whole wheat tortilla-- it was also delicious. The serving sizes are very generous, they have great deals and if you buy drinks it shakes out to about $15 pp. it's located in an adorable shopping center, so take a walk when you finish eating. I think this places beats out Chuy's up the street.

Originally my first choice was extremely packed and after reading some of the great  reviews here I had to give it a chance.  The food, location and service were great and I will HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone that's looking for some great food at a good price. The staff was friendly, my waiter was very helpful and although they were busy, they kept things moving and while keeping an eye on everybody. Plus, the food was delicious (had the fish tacos and chips with queso) and also I enjoy the fact you could to a reservation online as well (left my first choice at 830, set appointment online for 9pm, got there and check in at 845pm and by text I was informed two minutes later they had a table) so I was happy my second choice was a superb option.   Now, with this fantastic review you will be wondering why it didn't get the 5 stars and it's only because I was told to removed my hat. Honestly, if I'm there to eat, why does it matter if I have my hat on since it won't be bothering anyone? ***UPDATE*** MANAGEMENT READ MY REVIEW AND CONTACTED ME ABOUT THAT POLICY NOT BEING THE CASE WHICH SHOWS THEIR LEVEL OF GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE AND I THANK THEM FOR CLEARING THAT OUT. I WAS COMING BACK BEFORE BUT NOW I CAN SAY I WILL BE BACK FOR EVEN MORE IN THE FUTURE   Anyway, that still doesn't take away it is a great place and I will be back again.

Maybe it is because I neither tried Paco's tacos nor his tequila but I was not enamored with this restaurant. It was an A-OK experience overall. I will say we had an excellent server considering we were a work group of 12 and basically took up a whole back corner.  I sampled several items and here is the breakdown:  Complimentary chips - yes! Warm and salty in the best way possible.  Complimentary salsa - not the worst I've had but definitely bland.  Smoked jalapeños - my favorite item of the sampling! I thought they were perfect but the more spice sensitive members of my group thought they were too much and were wishing for some milk.   Chicken tortilla soup - more broth than substance with a lot of tortilla strips. I loved the addition of avocado.   Refried beans - strange oily aftertaste.   Charro beans - I would probably order these again over the other bean options but wouldn't seek them out.  Rice (that I didn't order) - bland. I requested two bean sides with my meal instead of rice because I am not big on rice. However my meal came with rice and I sampled it because it was there. Kind of matches how I feel about rice in general.  Enchiladas de Dennis - my second favorite item sampled! Smothered with queso and stuffed with chicken and spinach I would happily order these again.  The décor is nice and the restaurant is clean but overall the food wasn't particularly memorable. Maybe I will return one day and try some of the food after having some of the tequila and will be a more enthusiastic patron.

My friend does some catering with them so they allowed four of us to come in and try out the restaurant before it opened.  It's in a great South Park location where Manzetti's used to be.  They started us off with chips and dip which included a warm basket of chips, hot salsa as in heated not spicy hot, and a side of pureed guac.  Everyone liked the warm salsa and guac.  For apps we had the Brisket Nachos and Bottle Caps which were a combination of deep fried pickles and jalapenos with chipolte sauce...tasty!  The nachos consisted of about 10 nachos each with a piece of brisket on top with cheese etc.  Both apps were good and priced in the $8-10 range each.  The apps portion sizes weren't huge but eveyone was able to get a taste of each.  For entrees we had the Ambushed Shrimp and Brisket Tacos.  The 9 shrimp were bacon wrapped with a cheese topping.  The entree came with slaw and rice for $18.  A tad pricey but very good!  The brisket tacos are avaiable in hard or soft shell with rice, beans, and slaw and received a thumbs up.  The tacos are approx $12.    For dessert we had one Tres Leches for the whole table.  I must say it was some of the best I've ever had.  They brought out our bill for 4 which also included 8 Dos Equis beers for a total of $122 not including tip.  Our friend took care of the bill but we left a nice tip for our great waiter.  We collectively gave it 3 stars due to the upper end pricing for tex-mex but if your looking for something a little different it's definitely worth a try :)!
Pleasantly surprised. The enchilada sampler is awesome! Chips- awesome! Salsa - awesome! Waiter- awesome! Heck, even the salt around my margarita was awesome. I highly recommend!!

Absolutely love this place every time I stop in. This past visit was a girl's night out and of course Paco's impressed again. We ordered the freshly made guacamole and it was incredible. For dinner, I ordered the Paco's Taco which is one of my favorites and the chicken taco. The sauce on the chicken taco has a bit of heat to it but it adds just enough to really enhance the flavors of the meal. We topped our meal off with a pitcher of Margaritas... which of course were amazing! Paco's has a great atmosphere and we really enjoyed our evening out.
Food and drinks were great!! The waitress was super nice and did her job perfectly.
Absolutely amazing Tex-Mex food! I'm a vegetarian and I was blown away by the veggie fajitas -- by far the best I've ever had! I live in NYC and I'd like to come back to NC just for those...

Love this place!!!  Margaritas are amazing and the food is so good!  The beef brisket taco and the pork carnitas are spot on.  If you love Tex-Mex, this place is for you!  Make a reservation since they stay busy!

The manager Cory reached out to me today and apologized for the poor service I recieved.  She assured me that is not the standard at their restaurants (it's a part of a group), and explained the corrective action that was taken to ensure better service next time.   She was very kind and ensured that we were happy with our experience otherwise. I look forward to trying it again in the near future and will hopefully enjoy good service to go along with the good food.

Mediocre. Had 3 tacos for lunch...Paco, Country Fried and Fish. I've been mouthfarting ever since. Hopefully it stops soon. In all fairness, it's my fault for ordering fish, country fried steak and taco meat. Who does that?!

My coworkers and I were starving after traveling to Charlotte and wanted a drink and filling meal.  Paco's Tacos was located a super short distance from the Marriott South Park which was great since we didn't have a car.    I ordered the cucumber jalapeño margarita on the rocks and it was delicious.  The margarita was not too spicy and refreshing.  For an appetizer we ordered the chips and guacamole which was made table side.  The bowl was towering with chips and definitely a generous serving.  I tried not to fill up on chips but it was a challenge.    For dinner I ordered the pacos tacos which was braised brisket, grilled onion and a chipotle sauce on a corn tortilla.  Again, not too spicy and the onion was mild and didn't over power the flavor.  You have the option of picking what kind of tortilla you want and I went with corn.  You were also able to pick your beans and I def made the right decision with picking refried.  These refried beans were amazing... I wasn't expecting abnormally delicious refried beans.  They were smooth, creamy and had a very subtle kick of spice.  I loved them.  The meal came with rice which was good but I preferred to eat the beans and chips.    The service was great and I enjoyed my meal and experience.
Always hit this place at least once when I'm in Charlotte.  Very good food  in a laid back atmosphere.  Very friendly staff and great bartenders.

I went here for lunch last week with a friend  and let's just say the salsa is irresistible and full of flavor. We also ordered margaritas which were made perfectly. I ordered the wood grilled chicken taco which was stuffed with pure yumminess. I'll definitely be back again.
I ate here yesterday and was pleasantly surprised. The guacamole was delicious made at table with just enough kick. I had the Paco Taco with pulled pork. Yummy!

Ok.  The Mexican food here is fairly decent for being in North Carolina.   The reason for the 1 star is to bring attention to the lame young female bartender.  With only a few people at the bar this girl really made an effort to have terrible customer service.   Walked by several times without even looking or asking if we needed anything or how was the food etc.   I usually tip 20% but this was not the case this time.  This girl needs to wake up and take care of her customers.   It's a shame but the owner / manager needs to talk to her or fire her ASAP.

I've heard loootttsss of things about this place so I had to check it out!  My husband and I went right after work on a Monday.  I was excited to see the $3.00 any canned beer special.  (especially because we are heading to see the Red Hot Chili Peppers in concert later!). We sat on the patio to enjoy the weather.  Chips and salsa were brought out promptly and the waiter recommended the white queso because we wanted a smaller portion.   We devoured the queso pretty quickly and the server brought more chips right away.  We split three tacos for dinner.  We got the pacos taco, skirt steak taco, and grilled white fish.  My favorite was the pacos taco (yes it's worth the extra .50 cents).  The grilled white fish was fishy tasting, so we should've gotten it fried.    I'm not a rice and beans gal but my husband said they were amazing, better than Cantinas.   Overall good service and food!

I would come back here for the chips and salsa alone. It's the perfect storm of thin white corn tortilla chips and a delicious homemade salsa. Not too smoky, not too spicy, not too tomatoey. Tableside guacamole was great as well. We filled up way too much on that stuff. I will never learn my lesson.   They had $3 OMB pints on Sunday, thats a pretty good special in my opinion. So good that I skipped the margaritas and had beer instead.   I ordered the Too Big Taco Salad and was not really impressed with that. And I know, you're thinking well you ordered a salad what do you expect. But I ordered the salad because I knew I would be eating a lot of chips and didnt really want anymore chips/taco shell/tortilla and the salad was mostly chips.   My boyfriend got 3 of the tacos. We liked country fried steak the best. Tastes like a cheesesteak taco. His two favorite things. The other two (fish and Paco's Taco) were good too. The homemade tortillas really make them. The taco plates are very generous portions with good-sized tacos and rice and beans.   We sat at the bar and service was efficient but not friendly. The bar seats are oddly uncomfortable. It's like the backs are too curved. Would go for a table next time.   Definitely want to go back!

Oh, Paco, where have you been all my life?  And I am not talking about the Esai Morales character that was hanging out with Sean Penn in the early 80s movie Bad Boys, either.  If he learned to put together a meal like this in a juvenile detention center, then forget reform - more people need to spend time behind bars!  We actually just happened to be in the area, with no particular intention to check them out for restaurant week, but since they had it going on, we stopped in to see what was happening, and were oh-so-glad we did.  The special included a Miss Kitty's margarita, guacamole or ceviche as an appetizer, a salad, fajitas or shrimp for dinner, and either tres leches or fried ice cream and brownie for dessert.  So why just four stars, instead of five?  It was actually a close call.  The service, despite the place being slammed for a Friday night during restaurant week, was spot-on.  But the salad was limp.  Yes, limp.  There was not a crisp piece of lettuce to be found.  To their credit, the fine staff at Paco's even offered to make another to replace it - but I really had no room, and the entree had not even arrived yet.  I was impressed by the offer, however, and hopefully the next visit will see improvements here.  I totally get the desire to prepare for a rush, and putting salads in the fridge in advance is understandable.  But it does knock them down a bit.  The portions definitely did not hurt.  We ate on them for not one, but two meals after we got home.  And the food, with the exception of the salad, was spot-on.  The guacamole was much better than the ceviche (though the ceviche is good - you just get so much more enjoyment out of the guacamole it is ridiculous).  Paco's is not for everyone.  Do not take a date and expect a quiet romantic evening.  There are televisions scattered about.  It does have a bit of a noise level to it, but not so much that you cannot talk during dinner.  And it does get a bit crowded, so if you like to get up (to go to the bathroom, for instance), it might be a tight squeeze.  Otherwise, dig in.  It is well worth it.

This is probably one of my favorite places to get tacos. I recommend doing reservations!! Last time we went there was a 45 min wait. This time I called and made a reservation and we walked right in and got sat!   Their salsa is so good. We asked if they had anything spicer and they have a habanero salsa. That was delicious. I'm definitely asking for it next time.   I always get tacos with flour tortillas. No slaw with extra rice and refried beans. I'm not a big bean fan but their refried beans are the best. It's cheesy and has a smoky flavor to it. I got the beef taco, steak taco and shrimp taco. They are all loaded with meat! My favorite taco is the calamari. They only do that as a taco of the day but I would love if they bring it back!!   Service was excellent!!
Amazing. Loved it. Loved the margaritas, loved the queso dip (peppers, bacon and pineapple!!), loved the tacos and fajitas. Great atmosphere. Little gem in Charlotte
Amazing mexican food, service was amazing by Samantha P. very friendly, loved the decoration and all the variety of tequila!  Definitely will come back again!

Decided to stop in and try this place being its restaurant week in Charlotte. Their was a hour and a half wait for two. This is bad time wise, but also a good sign the food is good because if the wait on a Saturday night at 6:30pm is 10 minutes you might want to look elsewhere IMO. Our waitress Holly was very attentive and pleasant. She made some good recommendations that turned out pretty good. In short me and the wife enjoyed the food very much. The chips and salsa were very good and hard to stop eating. We will definitely go back again.
First tried Paco Taco during restaurant week and really liked it. We've gone back a couple of times. The guacamole and veggie fajitas are delicious!  The margaritas are strong. Yum!

I have a lot of dietary restrictions and was able to find many dishes which I could eat. Gluten friendly menu and vegetarian options. The resturaunt has a great feel to it and there were mostly business lunches going on during the weekday at noon time. There is a large selection of alcohol and over 100 types of tequila. The staff was very friendly. I appreciate that you can reserve a table online. Chips and salsa are on fleek! We even got a to go order and it was packaged nicely and stay led fresh! Chips and salsa came with the takeout order. Food came out fast to our table! I highly recommend the fajitas! I have no complaints. I will definitely frequent his resturaunt!

I've finally made it to Paco's Tacos & Tequila and it was worth it.  We came in with two friends from out of town pretty late and were seated quickly.    So to make it easy on why 5 stars: Food was tasty, plentiful and a good value: Of course, gotta go with the tacos, and I prefer the flour tortilla (soft tacos). I had the Pick 3 tacos: a traditional Paco's brisket taco, the chicken one, and flank steak taco. Each just a little different, so I wished there were other choices of salsa to pick from.  Comes with the traditional side of rice and three different style beans to pick from.  Of course the tequila: We only had the margaritas and they go great with any and all Mexican style food.  Prompt and friendly service from all staff: The waitress was knowledgeable, made some good recommendations, and the chips and salsa kept coming despite a request for more.  Sure, I'd come back every once in a while.  I can see the tacos getting old after numerous visits though.

Great atmosphere....wait staff is superb! The drinks are strong and delish!!!! I recommend the tableside guacamole and the chicken tortilla soup. All food was fresh and Devine! Will definitely be back for an after work dinner and drink session!

Was able to try 4 different tacos between my order and my girlfriend's and all were outstanding. Favorites were Turkey Carnitas and chicken fried steak. Charro beans on the side were great and the cole slaw was surprisingly good too. I'd highly recommend to anyone looking for good Tex-Mex in Charlotte.

Ah Paco's, I was really excited to try your tequila soaked spot. Too bad I came for lunch and didn't get a chance to indulge in a big mamma jamma margarita, but that's for next time. Onto my lunch experience...  I met a great business contact here and we enjoyed a tasty lunch. What we did not enjoy was great service - something I have come to expect from a Frank Scibelli restaurant. No, no one was outright rude or mean, our server was just kind of a dud of sorts. I don't know if he was having a bad day or just needs more training but it wasn't great.   First, the food... I ordered the Chicken Enchiladas and they were tasty. They were topped with a creamy queso and a bit of sour cream mixture. The chicken was tender and I enjoyed the two enchiladas. The refried beans were standard as was the rice. My only gripe? I wish it had a little more spice - in all components. The flavor of the chicken and the dish as a whole would be much elevated with a little kick.   The service...sorry for the long, drawn out info... Our server was just kind of absent - he wasn't engaging, didn't help much with recommendations and he also forgot a few things that my dining companion asked for on the side, one being chopped jalapenos. When my dining companion asked for fresh, chopped jalapenos on the side our server looked at her and blankly said, "I don't think we have any fresh jalapenos." Really, that's odd...we both thought. Then she said, well I'd appreciate any jalapenos please. Once our food came out, no jalapenos. So we politely asked the runner for the same request, and fresh chopped jalapenos came out in seconds. Ok....  And then the bill. So, it was my fault for not digging into the bill pad, but our sever did indeed give me the bill as I requested, on one check. There was a bit of confusion as I requested a copy of the full bill, and I didn't see one in the check pad, etc. Regardless, it was in there and that's my fault for not digging, but after the manager brought me a copy of the bill and reconciled (my) error the server said, "You need to tell my manager it's ok, because otherwise you're going to get me in trouble." Hmm. Nice. I happily told the manager there was not problem and it was my misunderstanding, I was chatting with my business contact, didn't notice, etc. I apologized but I thought it was pretty rude for the server to go there, if you know what I mean.  So, long story short, the food was good and I definitely want to come back and give it another go but I hope that server's having a better day and if not, I hope I'm seated in another section.
All I can say is. " bravo". Awsome service and best of all. The food is great.I give it  9/10 . Will be a repeat customer . Been there 3 times and gets better each time.

Jalapeno margarita + kick ass salsa = one happy Nikki.  I have always loved the food here, but the service has pushed this from 4 stars to 5 stars.  Let's begin with research I did a few weeks ago for the Weekly Yelp. For my Yelp Flips The Bird issue, I called on a super busy night. The nice young girl on the phone answered all my odd questions (I never told her who I was or why I was asking all these questions). So nice... so helpful.   This past weekend, I took my buddy Steve to bust his Paco's Tacos cherry. The bartender was our server. She was fantastic. Super friendly, so good at her job. She knew the menu by heart. And when she got tied up with to-go orders at the bar, another nice girl jumped right in to bring us boxes and the check. During the meal, the manager walked over to ask how our lunch was. I wish all restaurants did this. It's such a simple gesture, but it really does go a long way.  Okay now to the food!  Chips and salsa: I love the salsa here. Perfect combination of spice and flavor... plus the chips are so light and fresh. I could easily crush multiple orders by myself.  Firestarter margarita: Jalapeño infused tequila, fresh lime juice and ginger beer. Great heat. The ginger beer gives it a very unique flavor... unlike any other jalapeno margarita I've had.   Paco's Taco: Brisket, caramelized onions and chipotle bbq sauce. The brisket full of flavor and piled high.   Turkey Club Carnitas: slow cooked shredded turkey, sliced avocado, shredded iceberg, jalapeno bacon, tomato and avocado ranch. The Yelp family was right once again. Wow, this is a great taco.  Charro beans: Don't get me wrong, I like black beans.... but I have to go with charro every time for my side.   Fajitas: Nothing beats the smell of the sizzling plate as it comes out... making all other people jealous that they didn't order it. Huge portion size and a giant plate of fresh toppings. This easily made for two meals.   I'm a huge fan of this place... and now so is my buddy Steve. He was super impressed by his first visit.   Cheers Paco's! :)
Awesome tacos and the made-at-the-table guacamole was delicious.

First time patrons at Paco's. Enjoyed the Enchiladas de Dennis very much! Highly recommended. Can't compare the dish to other restaurants because it's quite unique..... Spinach, chopped chicken, cheese & spices, topped with creamy guacamole and roasted red pepper pureé sauces. Wow! Not spicy/hot, just pure flavor. So delicious, can't wait to return. Husband enjoyed the Chopped Salad, large portion very filling. We each shared a few bites. I found the salad dressing quite tasty.
