A flavorful chipotle ranch without the overbearing smoky spice chipotle can often be. A wonderful blend of fresh veggies with a delicious dressing. Fantastic dinner!

Being new to the Charlotte area I was excited to try a new place for Happy Hour/early dinner in the Southpark area. Disappointed is an understatement.  We arrived about 515pm, the place was dead, and it took a solid 20 minutes to get our drinks and chips/salsa. There were 5 in our party, all of us had cocktails.  Anyone who thinks the guacamole is good has never been to an authentic restaurant. It is a novel idea to have it made at your table, but it has zero taste.  Our server was rude, slow and snapped her fingers when we needed water refills. Our chip bowl was always empty and any request from extra napkins to a cocktail re-order seemed to be a huge inconvenience to our server.  The queso dip was good, but at 9 dollars, way overpriced.  I ordered the 3 taco meal; the turkey and bacon taco was verry salty, and I LOVE salt; the beef taco and chicken taco were ok and you could tell the entire meal had been sitting under a heat lamp for 20 minutes. The refried beans were delish and the highlight of my dining entire experience.  The beans, fresh drinks (although pricey) and location get it 2 stars. I doubt I will go back.
Service guy was nice and pleasant.  But if u want Mexican food you can't find it here. Mexican names on food and done American way. I know it says tex-mex but it's tasted like mex-carolinex.

We had a party of ten show up on Friday, 5/16.  It felt like the waitress had just been trained on up selling.  Order tequila shots but she recommended one of the higher priced brands. We struck with one of the lower cost ones, still $9 a shot, but she persisted. Food was good enough. Retired to the bar, ordered a round of drinks, threw $80 on the bar. Money and bill gone, we order more drinks. New bill shows up with all the drinks from the first round still listed.  Pointed it out to the female bartender and she returned the $80. She must've figured that there were so many of us, someone else would pay. She's a crook. Cute small brunette, with a black spot on her soul.  Dear managers. You've got a problem. All of us attended a party the next day and Pacos got ripped. Great potential, but ripping off customers, we'll never be back

We had a great order out meal from Paco's Tacos & Tequila a few weeksMy boyfriend got the chicken chimichanga and it was delicious! I ordered the tanked up (white fish) taco and the shake down shrimp taco. Both were great. The charro beans was a nice switch up from standard black or refried beans - very good! Definitely will come back again!
I love the margaritas and the tacos aren't bad either. Guacamole is freshly made and always a great appetizer.

I don't live in Charlotte but if this is the best Mexican in town I feel sorry for you all.  Nothing bad but nothing great either.  Overall Meh and a little pricey. The Yelp reviews fooled me- normally they are spot on. The jalapeño cucumber margarita was good.  Not very spicy however.  The no name margarita was gross.  I would have been angry if it wasn't on special for $5.  Overly sweet and week.   The volcano dip was just okay.  A little too thick for my husband and my taste.   The tortillas were great and defiantly house made.  I had the beef brisket, grilled fish and turkey tacos.   The brisket was a little dry but okay with some hot sauce.  Turkey and fish tacos had good flavor.  Charro beans were not hot.  Had they been they might have tasted better.  The worst of the night was the tres leches cake.  The driest cake I have ever had.  What kind of tres leches isn't moist.  My kids eat anything and they left the entire thing on the plate.   The server was okay.  We had to ask her for things two and three times.  She was nice enough. On a positive the salsa had good flavor.  Will I come back ?? Probably not.

Boring. The waitress bored us with her lack of interest. This is my 3rd visit and the thrill has gone. Next time I will save the money and hit the drive up at Taco Bell. I am sorry I bothered to ask for more tea. I know you we're busy texting or smoking or discussing what you did last night. I won't bother you again.

If you haven't yet discovered Paco's Tacos & Tequila in SouthPark run to the nearest mirror, take a good look, and then punch yourself in the face for missing out because seriously you are sucking at life. After your recovery jump in your car and get over there! Paco's Tacos is EVERYTHING. The rice, the beans, the enchiladas al denis, it's just too much for words right now as I'm having some sort of food flashback but trust me you need to get there. I like to go on a Sunday and sit outside with my shades on to complete my recovery from Saturday night.

All of the tacos are delicious and the salsa they give you at the start of the meal is amazing. Everything tastes very fresh and the dishes are all flavorful. It's super busy at lunch so go at a non-peak hour if you can

Simply delicious food! When the chips and salsa are excellent you know the rest will be also. We shared a 3 taco plate with 3 different meats. All were moist, fresh and finger licking good. But what really made our visit so special was the people working that day. They were super busy but were still able to seat us outside with our service dog. Thank you again Jasmine you are a wonderful hostess with a winning smile for all that you took care of.  Our server Darwin G was professional & very friendly. You rock Darwin! Plus gave great advice on the margarita special of the day! We live down the street and will be making many more visits to this great restaurant!!!

The taco was a 5 but everything else was closer to a 3... so a 3 it is.  There were complimentary chips and salsa but the chips had no salt on them and the salsa was rather flavorless and runny.  I wasn't too hungry so I ordered a taco plate for $7 (decent price for the portion). I got the tanked up taco which is a fried (or grilled) fish filet which was really tasty. My friends all got generous portions in their tacos too so it was hard to eat them without the contents falling out (not a bad problem too have, really). You could choose to have a four, corn, or crispy tortilla which is nice.  I got the charro beans which tasted like watery baked beans with shredded pork... not a fan. I'd probably go with refried next time.  The rice was pretty flavorful but the slaw was average. Service was okay. I'll probably come back for their enchilada...eventually.
Absolutely some of the best tacos I've had.  Can't wait to return.  The guacamole was fresh and delicious.  Chips and salsa was out of this world.
Make reservations if you're going on a typically busy night (Fri/Sat). Food is incredible, as are the drinks. I can't wait to go back.

I've never had a bad experience at this place. The servers are really friendly,  they give the food in a timely manner and the food itself is amazing! ! When I've gone I usually would get a brisket taco which is not good everywhere.  But here....it's so good!  Also the different margaritas with a long list of Tequila is the cherry on top. Definitely a place to go to with friends or a date night.  Check them out!

how i not review yet, been couple times?  maybe write review like my texting - all broken english.    came here with mouse, the YMCA thug, post-working out.  place gets 4 stars.  really good chips and salsa.  maybe bc i came from gym to work out and was starving, or maybe to go with margaritas. anyways, salsa is goooood - has a little chipotle or something to give it nice taste.  end result: salsa bowl empty, need more!  had 2 tacos - one chicken, one fish - both solid, not worth more description or more typed words.  mouse had salad with shrimp added - shrimps were shrimpy.  tried the firestarter margs - it hit the spot.  reminds me of homemade gin'n'sriracha (not a real thing, don't try), but better.    get table-side guac - if it ain't table-side you don't know what the guac is going in there.  :X  def coming back here - solid eats.  dmo out.

Love, love, love Paco's Tacos & Tequila. We always start off with the awesome guacamole, which they make at table side. I always get the combo so I can sample all the taco. Fish, shrimp, chicken and brisket tacos are spectacular.  The customary chips and salsa are a perfect mix of mild heat and saltiness and we have never had bad service. The waitstaff is very friendly and informative. Be sure to try the bar-b-que corn (have to ask for it). Its mouthwatering.  Big fan of Paco's and recommend it to everyone.
Wow, tried the paco taco and the grilled chicken taco.  Both were awesome.  Service was awesome too.  Will definitely be back.

Honestly, I'm not a big fan of Mexican food.  I've tried both Tex-Mex and "authentic" versions over the years at countless Mexi restaurants (my husband happens to be a BIG fan), and was never too impressed.  However, I was immediately a fan of Paco's Tacos after my first visit.  Despite it being Tex-Mex, its Beef Brisket Tacos were some of the best I've ever had!  Being a hot spot, it's best to get reservations for this restaurant, and the place is always crowded...but the food is well worth it.  I think this may be one of our go-to Mexi restaurants...at least until it proves me wrong? ;P

The chips and salsa were perfection! I had a salad with salmon which was very good and satisfying. I also had yucca fries which were super yummy and a Cadillac Margarita that was good too. The service was top notch. Our server's name was Darwin and he was amazing!

Yassssss! Guess who drinks on their lunch break? Me! (Don't Need Your Judgement). If you're friends with me, you know that your girl loves a margarita. #1 drink of choice.  Bartender-Annie- see that girl for a margarita done right. Thank you Annie for all that you do for people who work in corporate America, that get 1 solid hour for lunch to drink their faces off (me).   Anyway,... yes this place is great. The food is good, not the BEST,... but perfect for quick lunches or meeting out with your coworkers after work.   I typically just get margaritas & salsa. All the food groups are there. So yeah, ...

Something has happened to my Paco's from a year ago - we went in not that long ago and were so disappointed in the way we were treated by the snobby hostess that we nearly left before we had a chance to get seated. (Why must they act like you're bothering them?!?) We didn't want to sit outside because it was somewhat windy out - and apparently there weren't any inside tables available - so the hostess was really snippy that we wouldn't take the table outside. When we did get seated, we were happy to order margaritas and guac (both of which were DELICIOUS).... but my favorite salad was missing from the menu - (I literally used to dream of this salad it was so tasty). I ordered another and my hubs ordered tacos. His was a bit greasy when it arrived and my salad truly felt like an afterthought. The lettuce was hardly even chopped!! It was WHOLE leaves and probably could have been called a WEDGE salad since it was BIG leaves. The toppings were sparse (also not like I remembered when I was more frequent) - our chips kept coming so that made up for it I guess. I definitely left FULL of tortilla chips, salsa and guac. My salad was hardly noteworthy and my husband's tacos were weak. Hoping this was just an "off" day - or I'm afraid it's a sign that Paco's is on their way out. :(
No pics but the food and facilities were great. We went with 9 people and no reservations and they were extremely accommodating.
Best. Mexican. Ever. Everything is fresh and homemade.  Margaritas were amazing and every taco we tried was great. They make the tortillas right out in the restaurant.

Had a wonderful dinner here tonight with about 18 of my work colleagues. Food was great and service was excellent. I had the signature paco tacos with charro beans. Very tasty!  One of our group was celebrating his birthday and the server even took a sombrero off the wall at our request, crowned him with it and we all sang Happy Birthday. As you can expect on a Saturday night the place was packed. Super energy. Lots of fun.

Hello friends,  Third time (writing a review) the charm. I'm always satisfied when i come here. I like the menu. I like the menu so much in fact that I noticed I purchased the same exact thing the last time I was here. After i post my most recent pictures I noticed I ordered the same last time.  This place has more than enough reviews in which I'm sure are perfect. I  most likely won't be able to add much to the already made reviews other than the food is good.   The drinks..... well.. they are as strong as Barry Bonds, Mark McGwire & Sammy Sosa combined!! And in THIS CASE...that's a good thing.   TTFN

The Al Pastor tacos are the best things that have ever entered my mouth hole. Service is always friendly.  Id like to take a minute to bitch about Yelp and how it seems to not give a rats ass about the business. Is it not rediculous that they give no option to downvote a review? People leave the most asinine complaints sometimes clearly outright falsified reviews and the business just needs to sit there and take it.  Scroll down and read Adam J's review where he complains about bland meat. This man is clearly an idiot and his opinion is dumb. Empty tables dont mean shit buddy, you need to have a waitress available to serve you too. I hope that you dont go back to Pacos Tacos because you dont deserve to eat there.
Good food fast service great guacamole noisy bitches in da background doe but can't fault the restaurant for that a lil pricy but good size portions

It's the closest thing that I've found so far to Tex-Mex!!!!  I heart tacos...and everything about meixcan food.  I've been to Paco's three times now and it's been a pleasure.  I recently discovered that going during the week is easy on the pocket book.  :)  They have half price bottles of vino on Wednesdays...which again...Hubs was thrilled.  LOL!  He enjoys beer specials and I light up when there are wine specials.  We sat out on the patio and chatted with the waitress which was nice.  She was friendly and just laid back.  We weren't in any hurry...enjoying the cool night air while we sipped on our 1/2 price bottle.  The fresh Quac is my fav (nothing like what i make though.  *wink*) but it's fresh and oh so good.  Fish tacos are decent...chips and salsa are yummy.  All three times we've been here, the GM has come out to either greet us or bring us our chips.  So crazy, yet refreshing.  He's extremly nice.   Can't wait to go back....this place will def be on the rotation list! Plus it's close to me casa just in case....hehehe!

We just visited weekend. The location is convenient by the mall but overall just an ok place. Be aware weekends are packed, it was going to be an hr wait but we got lucky with a bar table. The service in our opinion was slow, maybe due to how busy. Server was super nice when we got grab her. We ordered cheese dip, I got a chimichanga and my husband their trio option. Dip was fine, salsa was pretty hot they served. My chimichanga with beef was ok, it honestly tasted more like a cheeseburger! My husband said his was just ok and for the price we won't return. It was over $50 for two dishes, queso and one beer...we feel we can find really good Mexican for about half that price. I'm not sure if this is a chain but felt more like that than a local place.
Great margaritas. Good food. Easy local spot that we frequent 1-2 times a month. Available on open table. Great patio.
This is our favorite place to eat! Gotta love the endless chips to start! Excellent food, great staff, cool atmosphere.
Wife and I love sitting at the bar. Salsa is amazing, service is great and tacos are to die for. I hope they come back with the barbacoa special.

I freakn love the TOO BIG TACO SALAD! You have to put it in caps for effect. You see this is not your avg throw it in a bland deep fried bowl and pray salad. Oh, no, its a plate n in-your-face creation. Lettuce explain...  Theres layers to this ish. 1st are the Herculean triangles whic holds the whole dish up giving you purpose. Layered with black beans, queso, mounds o flavorful beef (can use chicken or go vegetarian if you like that sorta thing), corn, diced tomatos, onions, quac, sour cream, drizzled im a cilantro lime dressing!!!!!!!!!!!  Whoaaaaaaaa (im my nature boy rick flair voice)

My son took me here for lunch while home on college break. He said if he wasn't a poor struggling college student, he would have tipped 100%. Our server, James, was awesome! No matter what questions we had, he had knowledgeable answers! Our chip basket was always refilled and we were well taken care of!

I work in the Southpark area so Paco's Tacos & Tequila has become a restaurant I frequent weekly.  I'll grab lunch to go or dine in after work with friends or coworkers.  Since I've had the opportunity to eat there quite a bit, I've tried most of the entrees and appetizers. Some of my favorites include: the veggie quesadilla, chicken fajita salad, paco's tacos, and the sour cream chicken enchiladas.        The service is great, which is always a reason to come back.  The wait staff and managers are always attentive and prompt; I don't think I've ever seen the bottom of a glass without a new one being brought to the table first.  If you've eaten at some of Frank's other restaurants (Cantina 1511, Big Daddy's, Mama Ricottas..) you know that poor service is never an issue.     Because of the great food and mindful staff it is defiantly worth checking out.  It's family friendly but you can also enjoy a casual date without being overwhelmed. They also have started some really good drink specials throughout the week (try the Texas Rose with pear infused tequila). The price point in the right place as well.

The few times I've been to Paco's, I have found the food to be underwhelming (it's not the best Tex Mex I've ever had, but it's not the worst, and it usually leaves me full and bringing home leftovers). I've had a wide variety of meals at Paco's, and it has always been the company and the margaritas that keeps me coming back, not really the food. The first time I went to Paco's, I got a taco platter, and while they were good, they weren't stand out or spectacular. I've also tried the enchiladas, but my issue with those is I'm more of an authentic kind of gal, and enchies (a very technical and affectionate term for enchiladas) made with sour cream chicken,  or topped with chili gravy don't really wow me (plus they were drowning in sauce, which after bite three made them soggy). My friend can't say enough nice things about Paco's salads (she loves the chopped salad and the Paco's salad), but the one time I went the salad route the veggies didn't seem fresh and the honey cilantro lime dressing was overpowering, and I was disappointed yet again. Yet, I could never write Paco's off (my friends loyally go and say I will find something I like), so I keep giving them more chances. A few weeks ago I was happy I didn't give up on Paco's.  By far the star of the show at Paco's is the fajitas. As I was browsing the menu to try something new yet again (my fallback was going to be to branch out at get some tacos I'd never tried) I stumbled upon the fajita platters tucked in the first page of their new menu. Paco's delivered on steak fajitas, and I was thrilled. The steak was seared to my liking and super tender. It looked beautiful; there were ample grill marks and it was simple and straightforward, which allowed its smoky flavor to shine. An abundance of vegetables accompanied the steak on the sizzling platter, and the peppers and onions melted in my mouth and burst with flavor on each bite. I tucked my precious steak and veggies into piping hot, soft flour tortillas, and topped them with traditional fixings (beans, cheese, lettuce, pico de gallo, guacamole and sour cream) before gorging myself.  Read the full review here: http://offtheeatenpathblog.com/2013/08/07/pacos-tacos-and-tequilla/

Service is always pretty good.  The food is very average and not what I was hoping for. I do not like the salsa, the flavor is bland and boring. Three stars are for the drinks!!! I love the fire starter! Any other drink I've gotten there was very good in flavor and size.

Service and food were excellent. I had the chicken chimichanga without red sauce and beans. It was delicious. It was a tex-mex restaurant rather than Mexican. The chips and salsa served before the meals are good, but  not great.   We enjoyed the atmosphere which caters to everyone including large groups. Our service was outstanding. In my opinion, the prices are too high. My dish was $13. It was a lot of food, but I'd rather have a smaller portion for less money. My husband had the quesadilla, which was very small (3 pieces) for $10. He ate some of mine because he didn't have enough. Because he had the same dish for lunch before, he realized the lunch and dinner portions are the same size, but the price increased at dinner.  Located within walking distance to South Park Mall and Charlotte Marriott South Park. I would go back, but would try to share a meal.

Came in with a friend and had a little wait.  Almost missed our table because they text you to let you know the table is ready, even though we were sitting 3 feet from the hostess waiting.   I had the turkey tacos and my friend had the taco salad.  We enjoyed our food but weren't blown away.  Overall the service and the food was average.

My favorite go to Tex-Mex restaurant! The food and service is always amazing. I would recommend making a reservation on weekends because it does get very busy. The tacos are delicious and packed with a lot!! The tequila flights are great as well.

Recommended to me by a coworker and it was on point!  The chips and salsa are great.  They have several salsas you can ask for, make sure to try the habanero and verde if you like a little more spice.  The chips remind me of Salsaritas...but better.  We also ordered a small queso and it was one of the better queso dips I've had.  The drinks are pricey but strong, I could only do one margarita.  The food is good, I got the grilled shrimp taco and skirt steak with rice and coleslaw.  My husband got the build your own combo with the same tacos and one enchilada.  I have to say the enchilada was the best.  Cano Fish taco still beats any tacos in Charlotte!

Pros: Parking Great venue Definitely kid friendly Great margarita Great food   This place is so consistent. It's nothing fancy or special, but it's really good Mexican and in a great location. Always a go to.

THE BEST MARGARITAS EVER! Great service, although I got a salad with salmon on it that was rancid. They replaced it with chicken and it was great. I suggest not getting seafood there. My sister had great tacos but said the beans were mediocre. Will return!

Ok, listen. Overall, it was good. Not my favorite, but good nonetheless. The margaritas were really good,  chips were warm and crispy, salsa was WAY TOO HOT and I like spicy, but I couldn't do it, so she brought over salsa verde, which useless. Not everyone like shit that hot. Just make the shit mild so EVERYONE can enjoy it. The  guacamole was one of the best I've ever had, mine is the best. Me and Baldie ordered the tacos. You have to order two or more in order to get the combo price, otherwise it's all ala carte.  I ordered the shrimp taco and the brisket taco. Baldie ordered steak taco and beef taco. We made the mistake of ordering them in a flour tortilla instead of corn, which looked like flatbread, much thicker than a flour tortilla. That came with a nice portion of choice of beans, we picked refried, it also came with rice, which was good. Frank didn't like his beef taco. My shrimp taco was pretty much filled with shrimp and the brisket was flavorful and tender.  So, I definitely go back. Next time we make a reservation, that place was mobbed!!

Stumbled upon this spot with the hubby.... for starters they have some amazing bottomless complimentary salsa, that has just the right amount of spice. But I wasn't ready for the amazing flavor packed into the "Too Big Taco Salad"! Amazeballs! I mean this salad was amazing and one of the best taco salads that I've ever had. I know some of you may be thinking "a salad,REALLY", but this was no mediocre taco salad. There was a layer of tortillas at the base, but not your ordinary tortillas. These tortillas were thick cut and super crispy to withstand all of the flavors atop of it. Next there was black beans, queso cheese, romaine lettuce, fresh cut sweet corn, tomatoes, chilli lime dressing and I topped mine with a piece of grilled chicken. Yoooooooo.... this salad was foodilicious!

Fantastic! The food is good here. We had done a reservation in advance in the day. The server was friendly in suggesting us any good options in their restaurant. The taste of the food is very authentic and we even got to know the fact that this place owner did his research to bring in the beat Mexican food in town. Pretty interesting to me and very relishing to the taste buds.  We preferred to order 3 set crispy chicken and 2 set fish tacos. Each tacos come with a side of rice and another choice of your side. Very tasty! We enjoyed the tacos by gulping our margaritas.  We also had a chance to taste the dessert , the only one which they have - tres leches. It was ok. But , I would definitely recommend the tacos and drinks. Will definitely come back for more Mexican food.
Amazing margaritas!   Delicious Fajitas and believe it or not, brisket to die for.  Go often!

Such a wonderful spot! I would recommend Paco's to anyone. On weekends there can be a bit of a wait but it's always worth it. Their margaritas are great. Their chips are salsa are DELICIOUS! I cannot come here and not get a taco. The flour tortillas are amazing. My favorite tacos are the shake down shrimp and the pacos taco. On my most recent trip with a friend, I got the taco and soup lunch special. I selected a pacos taco and chicken tortilla soup and it was amazing! The one thing I would change is that I would ask for the tortilla strips on the side for the soup because they got pretty soggy after a little while. Next time, I will order tortilla strips on the side and just add some as I go. The taco was delicious as always. My friend ordered the chopped salad with chicken and used the salsa as the salad dressing. She commented on how great it was.   This is a spot that I will go to again and again and again.

Was visiting my sister and we stopped here for dinner The tacos here were really spot on and affordable and the guac was delicious, not as good as LA but for Charlotte it's a pretty darn good spot for tasty and affordable mexican fare

Great food, great atmosphere and best yet...service. Henny was our server and did an outstanding job. Even answered ALL my sister's questions. (She always has many). If you like authentic Latin fare. You gotta go here. A+

I was in Charlotte for my family reunion. I had told my cousins that we had to try this place. It was good, but not is good as I expected.  We order calamari and queso for appetizers, both were delicious.  I ordered the combination platter where you choose 1 quesadilla, 1 taco and 1 enchilada. I had the chicken quesadilla. It was just okay. I chose the calamari taco. That was quite delicious. The enchilada I chose was the chicken and spinach. It would have been good if they didn't use american cheese. American cheese is absolutely disgusting.  The pomegranate margarita I chose for my drink was delicious.

Not your ordinary Mexican food. Very good salsa. Take some home. I get veggie enchiladas every time. Fried plantains on the side. They pay attention to the details. The beans, chips, guacamole, are all special, not obligatory like most places. Cocktails are special too. Wish I could remember the name of the one I had there last time. Something with bourbon and lime. Yummy. I'm not from Charlotte but I always go to Paco's when I'm there. Enjoy!

A clutch spot near the South Park mall to watch MLB, NFL, Premier League, even NASCAR. Very flavorful tacos and a good bar selection while their tequila options are plentiful. Guacamole could use some more flavor but overall this is a quality spot. Go let your wife/girlfriend/daughter/whatever shop while you get your taco and tequila on!
Absolutely delish!!!Waitress very pleasant. Must try the taco salad vegetarian style add mushrooms!!!

Food-wise, this place is already at 4, 4 1/2 stars.  Add in the fantastic margaritas and cocktails and it surpasses five stars.  My favorite is the Firestarter which is weird because I don't like ginger beer.  It is made with GB and jalapeno infused tequila and is a kick to your tastebuds.  The one I don't recommend is the one made with 100 year old Cointreau.  Not because it is bad, but it is not worth $16.  My wife always gets the quesedilla.  The chicken is tender and juicy and the tortilla crisp.  The quesedilla comes with guac, sour cream and pico de gallo which are all delicious.  The guac is fresh made (I've been told) and the pico de gallo also seems very fresh.  I have tried a wide variety of things but I always get the stuffed jalapenos.  They are wrapped in bacon and stuffed with cheese.  Sometimes spicier than others, but always good.  I often get the steak or chicken fajitas.  While pricier than your "mom & Pop" places, they are worth it.  You don't get a little pile of steak that looks like shoe leather.  This is real steak, cut well and cooked properly.  It is not tough at all and you can actually bite through it unlike at some places.

What a great find near Southpark mall.  The complimentary chips were fresh and hot and the salsa had just the right smokey flavor.  The taco and salad was the perfect lunch combo. The Paco's Taco on the house made flour tortilla was filled with shredded beef and sweet caramelized onions.  The chopped salad was filled with fresh vegetables you don't usually get - jicima, grilled corn, chickpeas - in addition to the typical lettuce and tomatoes.

I heard about this place at Triple C on Cinco de Mayo and figured that was just as good as a day as any to give it a go... Super glad that I did...   Clearly, as it was May 5th, the place was slammed... The upside to this being a solo mission?  No waiting for a table... I just pulled up to the bar and perused the snazzy menu... I met a nice guy named Joe who told me that the shrimp tacos were really good... I wasn't really all that hungry because of the ridiculously tasty and filling brunch I'd just had at Vida, so I didn't want a whole big platter... I noticed that they do a singular taco option, though!  Perfect... :)  The couple beside me (in from Greensboro and completely sweet) also heard Joe recommend the shrimp tacos and echoed his endorsement... I figured I'd give it a go, then... I decided on the broccoli with queso and one shrimp taco...  They're called the Shake Down Shrimp and I'm not really sure why, but who cares at this point?  They were amazing... They apparently make their own tortillas and that was a tasty base, the fillings are fried shrimp, shredded cabbage, pico de gallo, cilantro, chipotle ranch and Cholula (hot sauce)... Now, I just started to eat shrimp, but I am still a no-go on ranch, so I had mine without the sauce... I guess that would have cooled down the spiciness of the dish, but I was loving the heat factor...  The herbs, cabbage and pico all tasted fresh and delightful... The cabbage had a really nice crunch... The broccoli, you know, tasted like broccoli... That queso was insane, though... A total blanket of cheesiness with a minute fiery kick...   The bartenders were attentive and friendly... Even while they were slammed with all the people surrounding the bar and filling the restaurant's orders... I can't wait to go back and actually enjoy sitting down in this place for a while... There's something called a Firestarter margarita (with jalapeno infused tequila) that has my name on it...

Total fan of the food!  Regretfully the bar has much to be desired.  I had a margarita and sangria and both were terrible.  Very bitter. I'll be back because like I said the food was awesome, but my bar choices will be rendered to the "can't mess it up" category.

Went to Pacos Tacos for the first time and my second time was the day after.  This establishment really has it all. We sat at the bar, they were completely packed out early evening on a Saturday. The service was still amazing, want to say her name is Samantha. She even told us about her favorite tequilas and had some good convo. We had bacon wrapped jalapeños, chili, tacos, and margaritas. Cucumber jalapeño margarita and the firestarter margarita are amaze! One for flavor, one for heat. I almost forgot the bacon egg and cheese enchilada, queso, and chicken tortilla soup! I cannot wait to go back for more!

I have been to this place several times but after today I'm not sure I will continue. The waiter was friendly and got us our checks quickly that was appreciated and he did a good job. When I got my check I noticed that my bank account had already been billed the total amount plus a 20% tip included in the amount my bank showed. I asked for a manager because I felt like that was a bad practice. He came over looked at my check and basically blamed it all on my bank when this has NEVER happened here before or any other place for that matter. The manager lacked empathy and concern. I don't want to patronize a location that doesn't value their customers.

Salsa and chips were really good, salsa has just enough kick. We got the bacon wrapped stuffed jalapeños to start and they were great. Service was pretty good, they forgot our silverware and napkins until our food came and I got up and asked for some.   I got the "paco taco" which is brisket and was ok. The other taco was the Al Pastor. The pork was so salty I couldn't eat it. I told the waiter and he said he would let the chef know and left it at that.   I prefer Cantina 1511 and Cabo's tacos to Pacos.

We arrived on a busy Saturday and was told the wait time would be 45 -60 minutes. I decided to wait gave my phone number and was texted about 25 minutes later letting me know my table was ready. The service was excellent, food even better, everything came out so fast. Paco's is doing it right. I would recommend to anyone who will listen. The shakedown shrimp tacos will make you slap ya mama

Came here on a date and i have to say, it was amazing! Get the tacos! I ordered three. The paco taco, the Chicken fried chicken, and chicken Melensia. Omg so so good! These tacos are pretty large. I couldn't finish three but it's a better deal to get three instead of 2. We also had the bartenders special margarita that night. It wasn't much different from a regular margarita except it has an orange slice. The service was excellent. The atmosphere is awesome and the price is good. I'm a new fan and will be returning FOR SURE!   Also, make a reservation.

Just a classic tex mex place. It's well priced, great service, and hidden away. I only went cause someone told me about it, if they hadn't I wouldn't have known it was tucked away in one of the busiest parts of Charlotte.
Best Tex Mex place in the south east. I am here every weekend and the food is always outstanding and the service is fast, friendly, and efficient. If you haven't eaten here, then you haven't lived.

On a warm summer afternoon, there are only a few things that are more soul satisfying than chips and salsa, chicken fajitas and an ice cold margarita! This restaurant rightfully has "tequila" in their name, because they make one sick firecracker margarita!! Made with jalapeño infused tequila and lime juice, it's one of the most refreshing drinks I've had... with a kick!! (I think I may have finally found my favorite beverage.) For those of you who aren't afraid of spicy foods and drinks, this is definitely something you ought to try! Enough about the margarita! Now moving on to the food... I ordered a pretty standard dish; the chicken fajitas. This is usually my first choice in Mexican restaurants, because it's a safe choice, and usually sets the expectation for how good the other items on their menu might be; it's a good benchmark for me. Given that the fajitas were quite good, I'm definitely going back to try some of the more interesting items on their menu like the chimichangas and bbq shrimp tacos! Mmmm... I'm already looking forward to another glass (or two) of the Firecracker Margarita! =)

My husband and I were in the mood for Mexican . Thanks to google , we found Paco taco on Morrison blvd . The waitress was very nice . She was pleasant and attentive . We decided to skip the appetizers and go straight to the entrees . We ordered the shrimp fajitas and the roasted vegetables enchilada . The fajitas were good , the standard fajitas you find in any Mexican restaurant. However , we were very disappointed with the enchilada . It was very doughy, the roasted vegetables lack the taste and the beans overwhelmed the plate . The only good thing  on that plate were the empanadas . The good service made up for that enchilada . We might consider coming back .

For starters, I wonder why I have only been here twice since living near by for two years? Paco's was busy during our late dinner visiting time, however both hostesses were pleasant and in good moods, took our information and then enthusiastically confirmed that it would be fine if we waited at the bar (about a twenty minute wait we were told). Before we could even order our drinks at the bar, the sweet and extremely polite hostess came up and said "miss your table is ready".  So that was maybe a five minute wait, if that. Nice surprise because we were both very hungry! ;)  We were seated in a booth in the downstairs corner. The ambiance is casual and warm in the seated sections allowing you the opportunity to relax, but there are also TVs at and around the bar for those who want to come and just catch a game and have a drink.  The waitress was timely, polite, and patient with my boyfriend who comically tends to take forever to choose his meal. Meanwhile, we ordered margaritas-the watermelon summer one is spectacular! Just the right amount of flavor and liquor, goes down so crisp and easy it could be dangerous. Chips and salas were ever-flowing and fresh. The only complaint here for me is that the chips were pretty salty. But I applaud the freshness of both chips and salsa, and the spice kick in the salsa is just the right amount! The salsa is the perfect texture, not too chunky and not too watery.  The menu has options for vegetarian or GF, which is what I look for now as another way to bump a review up in stars. They have veggie fajitas, fiesta bowls, veggie enchiladas, corn tortilla options, etc. I had the fiesta bowl with no protein added. It was a generous amount of food, looked lovely and colorful and the avocado was just amazing on it. Everything was cooked well and tasted fresh. My boyfriend had three tacos: turkey, beef, shrimp. He loved how they tasted with the only complaint being slightly dry. He has previously had the fajitas which remain his favorite.   Overall it is a nice dining experience with no complaints. Food is fresh, people are kind, staff works together to refill water/chips/salsa/remove plates, drinks are amazing, and they do have a cute little patio out front. This is the kind of place you keep coming back to because you know you can get good food. We will return and I look forward to trying new things on the menu each time.
Good family friendly classic Mexican restaurant. I get takeout almost every week. I love the fajitas and the ones I love are the ones you get to put together yourself.
Big tequila selection. Terrible food. Bad, no, REALLY BAD Tex-Mex. everything was cold and sick.

I went back for a second visit, and I was again totally impressed by the level of service. I was also impressed this time by the food! My Cadillac chicken was phenomenal, and my friend had a salad which she said was great. I will be coming back to Pacos, and soon.

I tried something other than the tacos!! I finally did it!   Pacos has never let me down; I can always rely on this place to be a consistent win for dinner. The lady and I walked in at around 7pm and they told us it would be about a 15 minute wait. ...orrr we could just take a seat at the bar, or one of the barside 2 tops with full service. Yea, we'll go with that.  We were immediately given plates, chips and salsas, and had our drink order taken (Their margaritas are the bomb, make sure to ask for their daily special, ours were the No Name for $5). After multiple visits getting their wonderful tacos, I ventured to order the Fiesta Bowl, which was basically a 'skinny' burrito with cabbage instead of lettuce (which was really great!).  I don't think I've reviewed here before, so please don't get me wrong, the tacos are AWESOME. But it felt good to try something new.  ... And now I can say I've done it and I don't have to do it again and I can back to tacos thankyouverymuch.  Always good service. Always good food. Always leftovers. How can you go wrong?

I have been craving tacos & found this place today.. I ordered 2 Tanked Up grilled fish tacos with red rice, black beans and 2 house margaritas... Everything was delicious.. The chips and salsa they give as an appetizer was on point as well..
Yes I am definitely a fan...a place to experience a little of mexico.
Very nice place. Food, ambience and service are beyond good. Try their house margarita!! If you go during weekends, may take some time to get a table.

Wait with a reservation: very long on a Friday night   Service: pretty good. Friendly staff but took a while to take our orders.   Food: excellent. I had the taco salad and would definitely order it again.   Drinks: margaritas were super strong. I'm average when it comes to alcohol tolerance but 2 margaritas did me in.

It has been a while since we ate here, on a whim decided to give it another try and we were glad we did. We went at prime time Saturday night and they were BUSY, luckily we snagged two seats at the bar. I started with the "no name margarita" love they use fresh made sour instead of pre-made, you can really tell a difference. We started with the queso blaco which was very good.. creamy and had peppers in it which was a nice touch. For dinner I opted for the small chopped salad, BF ordered the two taco place with crunchy beef and soft brisket (for me!) with charro beans as the sside. The small chopped salad was HUGE... I had enough for the next day, nice and fresh with lots of veggies and chick peas (love them!). The ground beef was well seasoned and nice and juicy.. the brisket was a little salty, I will say we do not use a lot of salt so I would guess its at a "normal" restaurant food level... it was very tender and flavorful. BF said the charro beans were really good but I was too stuffed to try~
Service was great. Fish taco was good. Not a fan of the mystery cheese in the quesadilla.

Wait staff was friendly, we were served very quickly and the menu/drink specials were explained well to us. Had a great margarita deal on Thursdays. Margaritas were good, a little sour so drinking more than one is hard but good for the first one. Love how you are able to mix the tacos, I tried the wood grilled chicken, shrimp, and calamari and all three were delicious, and I had a few leftovers.

This is one of my FAVS to eat at and to take friends to from out of town. The place is ALWAYS PACKED, but I must say they get people in and seated quickly AND we have NEVER been rushed to order, eat, leave. Tge foods are all excellent. The spicy shrimp tacos with black beans and a mojito, of course. My friend had the steak fajita that smelled scrupmtious. His 'house' margarita' was odd tasting but not awful. They offered to replace it, but he declined.  The restaurant is crowded but not too rowdy/noisy that two people out on date night can't hear one another. The servers all know their menus well and are friendly. I will be a frequent flyer here.

It was my first time here and I thought it was awesome. Great low carb options on the menu, specified in the title as such. It was super packed in here when I walked in, but the bar tender was surprisingly really attentive. Great margaritas too! Only complaint is the lack of specials and dirty bar. They didn't clean the old people's food completely off and were too busy to do it. Other than that 5/5!!

Awesome place serving flavorful Tex Mex. got in on Sunday evening so not much wait time. But still it was near full.   Chips were really good - crispy without being greasy. Salsa was flavorful but slightly salty. Appetizer of yucca fries was good. Perfectly seasoned yucca fries with creamy ranch dressing.    Entree was vegetarian enchilada with black bean sauce- mild but very seaso

When I pulled into the parking lot, I noticed that the Paco's Tacos is in the old Manzetti's building.  Flashbacks of their delicious salads and bread came to mind. It was a warm evening, and I was able to score outdoor seating for my friend and me.  We were given chips and salsa.  The salsa had nice heat, but there was something thick and sweet about it.  The menu is meat heavy.  But, I ordered the Too Big Taco Salad without meat.  Wow!  It came with greens, queso, black beans, cheese, corn shaved off of the cob, tossed in a Ranch like dressing.  It also featured tortilla chips nestled under the greens.  Kind of like eating nachos and salad simultaneously.  Very filling.  I may have finished half of it and then our server promptly removed it.  He didn't ask me if I was finished, but probably noting my diminutive size, he figured that I should be.  In retrospect, I wish that I had asked for a box.  However, it may have been one of those dishes that doesn't keep well.  The background music appeared to be mostly country.  Not to my liking, but it provably suits a Tex-Mex place. So, I had a bit of a Manzetti's salad flashback.  I think that I will I order that same dish again when I return.

Excellent Tex-Mex. Fantastic brisket. Some very creative options on the menu. Good top-shelf margarita too!  As a solo diner from out of town, the staff made me feel welcome. Excellent service on all three of my visits.

I have definitely written a review on PTT's before but for some reason it isn't popping up!  So, out of pure bitterness I am going to keep this review short and to the point.  The best thing about this restaurant is what they could be in theory.  Creative tacos, great/fresh side items, housemade dressings, etc etc..But really everything is just OK in my opinion.  The tableside guacamole is incredible but that isn't enough to keep me as a repeat customer.    The smoked chicken taco was okay, a little bland.  The pulled pork taco was decent but a little tough and once again, bland.  The side options are solid considering you typically only get lard...I mean refried beans...so I did enjoy my black beans and rice!  Overall--I think Paco's is okay.  They are a good alternative to traditional Mexican places and we don't have very many "tex-mex" places in Charlotte so I give them credit.  I don't think they are that great but they will satisfy a craving in a pinch I suppose.

Great foods and service. Got the pacos taco ( I think that the name) quite spicy... :') the waiter was nice (thanks for the water, really saved my life). Foods could been better, but overall it is still a good mex restaurant to go to.. more Tex then Mex. but still good!

After a shiner beer dinner trip, a few hours at the bar trip, and a few just dinner trips - it's definitely a fully rounded review, but I'm pretty sure it would have sounded the same a few months back.  The food, is delish. The paco's taco (brisket) is just divine, as are both of the shrimp tacos. i think the campechana is awesome - and my mother (a ceviche expert) agreed. They have awesome food specials at the bar, and they have frito pie. (though I have yet to try it, the fact that it is on the menu makes me happy) Even their free chips and (both) salsas don't disappoint. They aren't perfect, and some items I've liked much more than others, but nothing has been "bad".  Now to the important part - the booze. a lovely selection of shiner (two or three on tap and then a few bottled) and a (slowly) rotating selection of infused tequilas complete their full bar and tons of tequila. I'm a fan of the three-pepper infused one which tastes fab alone, in a bloody maria, or in their firestarter (or something to the same tune) margarita. oh, their margaritas - I've had a couple different ones and I like all of them, especially the one that's on special that night.   What keeps this from being 5 stars is the service, and maybe a little of the ambiance. The amount of fajita plates ordered is ridiculous, and kind of makes me feel like I'm at Chili's. Not really their fault, I guess, but the constant sizzling and smoking can be distracting. The bartenders have always been great and friendly, but sometimes service has been a miss. In my book, there is a window for great service, but asking if I'm doing okay too many times in a certain time frame can be just as bad as never coming back to check in. I guess at Paco's I'm usually over-served(?), and more than once by a server who reaaaally shouldn't have chugged that second red bull right before her shift started. But hey, my water glass was continually filled to the rim, my drinks kept coming, and seconds after my food hit the window it was at the table - so I can't complain too much.

I'm really into tacos.   Like, if I could have tacos every meal, I think I'd be really happy with that decision. Do you know how much you can do with taco ingredients? LITERALLY everything is an ingredint for a taco.   I digress. Paco's is ALWAYS packed. One turn off, we made a reservation for 8pm on a Wednesday and we still waited 15 minutes for a table. If you make a reservation, why are you waiting when you're seating walk-ins? That doesn't make sense to me. With four people, it shouldn't be hard to find a spot for us to sit because this place is huge.  With awesome vegetarian options. I was pleased with Paco's except for when they forgot my stuffed jalapeno. I opted for two tacos, one shrimp and the other fish. Shimp was by far the more supperior taco. Just for this taco alone. I will be back. Can't wait for my stuffed jalpeno next time, too.

We arrived at 6:30 and was told 25-30 minutes so we ventured to the bar, where chips and salsa were brought to us immediately. The chips were light, warm, and fresh with a great salsa, and the margarita's were awesome. After about 40 minutes I checked with the hostess and we were the next table to be called. However, the wait time was over one hour and fourth-five minutes, the place was packed! We are the Paco's tacos which were great & a combination of a shrimp and chicken taco. The Paco's tacos were awesome, and the chicken was good, however, I'd pass on the shrimp next time. The sides, cole slaw, rice and beans were all good. We will definitely be back!

My wife has finally found a place that I will agree to go to when she's craving Mexican food.  I'm usually out on all Mexican food places, I just don't get it... but this place was decent.    I had a fish taco, a BBQ taco, and a ground beef one.  The BBQ one, which I believe was the actual "paco's taco" - was hella good.  The fish one was good too.    The chips were meh, honestly, if they were to make their own, my review goes up a star.

My wife and I couldn't decide on a place to eat lunch near Southpark so we searched Yelp and found this gem. She and I both grew up in Charlotte so we still thought of this as Manzetti's - an awesome restaurant with a lot of memories. We were very pleasantly surprised that, despite the very different cuisine, Paco's Tacos was just as delicious and good a restaurant.  I had a Bacon, Egg, and Cheese enchilada and it was amazing. I loved the fact that it was not enormous but a perfect amount of food (so sick of all the ginormous servings, like at the Cheesecake Factory). The chips were a bit too salty but the guacamole- made fresh at the table - was wonderful and balanced it out. My wife had a margarita and it made her very happy - all I cared about. The cost wasn't bad - about $10/entree - especially given the area.   To put the cherry on top, the service was excellent. Consistent, smiling, pleasant, not wanting for anything. And the bathroom was clean and smelled fresh - a very welcome change from a lot of establishments.   Will definitely come again.

Tried this place for lunch today, absolutely loved the atmosphere and the food was great. I had the chopped salad, ordered the small size which was huge! Also tried the shrimp taco, it was really good. Would highly recommend this place.

I love this place. The service is always great, the atmosphere is amazing, and I love the food. I tried tacos, soup and enchiladas so far - it was all great. I do recommend getting a reservation, though we were able to get three seats at the bar on Saturday night right away last time I went there with friends (wait time without reservation would be an hour).

Pat our server was really nice and friendly. I've been here before and was excited to introduce my husband to the the restaurant. The food had no flavor. It was hot--which is great, but there was literally no flavor at all. With ingredients like cilantro, tomato, pork,and fish, you would expect SOME flavor. If you want mediocre bland food but the texmex decor, this is the place for you.

First time, food was really good. My wife and I both had tacos, they let us switch out stuff we didn't like, very good. Had black beans and again were good. The coleslaw wasn't very good wasn't impressed, but wasn't the reason I went there. Wait staff was also very nice and helpful and explained everything to us.

I met up with my friend and her coworkers. They had been here on the patio but I am the late worker.  Apparently I have walked straight into a nightmare. No one greeted me, even thought there were plenty of servers walking by. Yes, the rest of the table looked pretty "done" but shouldn't the server know that there's a new person here? Say hi, ask if I want anything, pretend you care. When I finally had a server, I asked what is their drink specials, and her response was "I don't think I can serve you."  WHAT??  She offered me a water.  Turned out they have denied service to the entire table because they have a one drink an hour limit. WHAT?? Mind you I was with people who just got off work, including a CFO of the company.  We were not some youngins making troubles. Plus, I just got there, obviously haven't had any drink.  We left shortly after, still baffled. Which restaurant doesn't serve their patrons? I guess one that doesn't want any business.

Definitely one of the best Mexican places I've been to in Charlotte. I have a lot of food allergies (peanuts, nuts, and shellfish) and this place took it very seriously. The manager came over to make sure everything I ordered was something I could eat. Plus I don't often get to eat chips at Mexican places because they fry the chips in the same thing as the shellfish, but this place had a separate fryer for the chips. I was in heaven and literally could not stop eating the chips. I will definitely be visiting here a lot more once I officially move back to Charlotte.   I also got the queso with the chips and it was really good; however, I feel like there wasn't as much queso as I would get at other places.   Overall this was a great experience and the perfect lunch spot!  UPDATE: I recently went back here and was reminded how much I LOVE their guacamole and queso. My friend and I are already planning our next visit.

We had a reservation at Paco's before a show at the Filmore.  Coming from out of town and in need of tacos, we went for the place that we could get a reservation.  Paco delivered well.  I had three tacos: The Paco Taco, the Al Pastor, and the shrimp taco.  Shrimp was my least favorite.  Large well stuffed tacos.  My wife had the enchilada sampler.  She enjoyed all but the veggie one.  Great services.  Food was good, but not the best tacos I've ever had.  Pricier than a regular mexican place, with similar flavors.

Nice and Flavorful Taco in South Park.   Place is a tex mex flair with a massive selection of Tequila.  If i wasn't so deathly afraid of tequila, after one previous bad night a long, long ago,  it would have been neat to sample the margaritas and shots .  I came here for lunch and it was really nice. My strategy was just to get tacos and no fillers. I got 3 single tacos and it was the perfect amount for lunch.  I highly recommend getting the standard PACO's taco. You'll be happy with your choice.  Then branch out and get one of the crazier flavors.

My lovely wife has never before had a fish taco and after hearing me tell her over and over again that it wasn't what she though it was, and that she would really enjoy it, she finally relented. And yep, she loved it. So much so that she now wants to go back to Paco's almost immediately.  Service was very good - we let Shauna pick our tacos for us, as long as there was at least one fish taco on each plate. Good move! She asked some questions about our preferences for spiciness and allergies and got it taken care of.  Yep, we'll go back!

Paco's had excellent service, the waitress was bubbly and very attentive. My family and I all tried different tacos and we all were satisfied. The food was tasteful and very filling; they sure do fill up your plate! Overall I would definitely go back.

I love mexican, but i'll be the first to admit that  most texmex joints are not that different from each other. Paco's was different. I had the chicken fajitas and my wife had the taco's (fish, brisket & chicken).  My fajitas were some of the i've had and my wife loved the taco's. Paco's is probably the best texmex i've had in charlotte, so I definitely reccomend them. . Be sure to call ahead for reservations on a weekend night...they're busy!

I have only been here once, and I'll be back for more!  I came in for lunch, never knowing this place was hidden near the South Park Mall behind some other stores and shops.  Chips and salsa: Pretty yummy, and the salsa had a nice flavor and sutle heat to it.  Firestarter margarita: Jalapeño infused tequila, fresh lime juice and ginger beer. Great heat. The ginger beer gives it a very unique flavor... unlike any other jalapeno margarita I've had.   Paco's Taco: Brisket, caramelized onions and chipotle bbq sauce. The brisket full of flavor and piled high.   Turkey Club Carnitas: slow cooked shredded turkey, sliced avocado, shredded iceberg, jalapeno bacon, tomato and avocado ranch. The Yelp family was right once again. Wow, this is a great taco.  Charro beans: Don't get me wrong, I like black beans.... but I have to go with charro every time for my side.   Fajitas: Nothing beats the smell of the sizzling plate as it comes out... making all other people jealous that they didn't order it. Huge portion size and a giant plate of fresh toppings. This easily made for two meals.   I'm a huge fan of this place... and now so is my buddy Steve. He was super impressed by his first visit.
Great location, i got veggie tacos is pretty good the food menu have crazy names good experience  and service also super cold Beer

You guys rock!  Work nearby and I always pop in for some tacos and a margarita or a beer.  Food is always great, service at the bar rocks.  Food comes out quickly too.  The Paco's taco and the chicken milanesa taco are probably my favorite.  Keep it up y'all!

Always good food. Love the enchiladas. They're definitely a bit greasy but this isn't a restaurant boasting of their healthy food options. That being said they have a great house chopped salad! Haha. My husband loves their margaritas. We've always had decently fast service and great meals! Couldn't think of any reasons as to why they shouldn't have 5 stars

Went here last night during Charlotte restaurant week. We went with our friends. Atmosphere is ok. A bit loud but still enjoyable.  For the restaurant week menu they had the no name margarita to start with. We all got it frozen. It was a lot bigger than I anticipated so well worth it with the meal. Choice of appetizer was either queso or guacamole. 3 of us had the question and 1 the guac. Both were very tasty. Our waiter made sure to keep our chip bowl filled so we could enjoy the guac and queso. Second course was either a salad or chicken tortilla soup. We had both. Both tasted good. Main course was a choice of 4 different entrees. 3 of us got the choice of three tacos and one got the tipsy chicken. I really enjoyed the the turkey club carnita taco. It has some sort of jalapeno bacon in it and it was really good. For dessert the choice was either peanut butter chocolate pie or tres leches. 3 of us had the pie and 1 had the tres leches. The pie was really good as was the tres leches. If in the area I would stop into the restaurant again

Not sure if I'm noticing a trend or not, but there seem to be many restaurants opening featuring what can be classified as "street tacos."  Paco's has a particularly large assortment of street tacos that feature your choice of tortilla variety, fresh ingredients, and unique combinations.  First of all, I loved the chips, salsa, and guacamole here.  The guac is made at the table with your choice of typical ingredients and also your choice of consistency.  So my chuncky/spicy guac preference was definitely satsified.  I ordered three tacos, the best of which was probably the shrimp or shredded beef (i forget the exact name).  All you really need for a good street taco is well-seasoned meat, a unique topping (think cabbage or some other veggie), and a good sauce.  Paco's does all of these well and puts it on par with some of the great street taco-style mexican restaurants I frequent in Cincinnati.  As a side, the black beans were awesome.  I'd love to visit PAco's again to try the tequila selection, other tacos, or some of the other menu sections I didn't experience.
Chips and salsa were fresh and delish. Had the shrimp tacos and chiken with bacon tacos, shrimp had a kick but both were yummy.

The place is a bit hard to find (look behind the Williams Sonoma!) but it's definitely worth a trip. The atmosphere is relaxed with a really nice large bar. We were easily able to get seats at the bar at 8:00 PM on a Tuesday.  The bartender was nice enough to create custom margaritas for us and they were DELICIOUS! (but expensive...$11 each!) I definitely recommend getting a margarita with their jalapeño infused tequila.   The salsa was fantastic, but the queso was just OK. Chips were a little undercooked but the staff was great at refilling our basket! My fiancé and I shared the combo fajitas (chicken and steak) and it was more than enough food for the two of us. We subbed black beans for the standard charro beans and I was happy we did.  The staff was really friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about their products so I would definitely go back again!

I like this restaurant and think their food is very good. I have tried many different items on the menu and found them to be very good. Their chips and salsa are some of the best I have ever had.  The drinks are an issue in this establishment. Beer is reasonable but their wine prices are way to high. Louis Martini Cabernet for $12.99 a glass? The whole bottle in a retail store cost $15 and the wholesale price is around $10-$12 per bottle. So I figure they have a 4x to 5x markup on a bottle which is outrageous. The same issue exists with some of their other drinks as indicated in other reviews.   Stick with the Tex Mex and Beer when visiting this restaurant.

This place was really good. My fiancé and I visited Charlotte last weekend. I had a grilled chicken taco and their signature Paco taco. Both very good. Spicy red rice and black beans had a good Spanish flavor. The waiter recommended I try the Paco el dorado which is a margarita they serve which was amazingly delicious. Overall quite pleased with our first visit here!

Had the chicken bowl and it was great, good flavor and price right.  Host and bartender were really friendly. It is really beneficial they stay open between lunch and dinner, so hours of operation are very convenient.
This is becoming my favorite Mexican restaurant in Charlotte.  Great food and service, and always have a good Margarita drink special.

Paco's Tacos was good. Thats really all there is to it. Service was excellent. I really liked my first margarita but my second one was almost un drinkable. The food was ok. Ultimatley if i feel like having a burrito, ill skip the drive to South Park and take my chances of getting lysteria from Chipotle. There was nothing wrong with Pacos Tacos but nothing really right about it either.

I was visiting Charlotte from Jacksonville Fl to see my sister and her family..just before this I was reading a list of the top tacos in America..because i love tacos, this doesnt seem like something strange to read for me..well i told my sister that while i was in town i must eat at Pacos, cause they have the number four tacos in the US, also the name is super fun to say and the menu made me drool a little! We got there around 2 o clock in the afternoon on New Years Eve and only waited a few moments before we were shown to our table..the energy here is really awesome, and theres a bright bar showcasing all the libations available..we were brought some chips and salsa right away and then met our server David (last name Pacheco..theres more than one David here) he was super quick and attentive and was able to answer questions for me with no hesitation or giving me a really long winded non answer..i learned that the salsa is made in house, and he also was able to direct me to a fabulous local IPA, that of  course I cant remember the name of..soon we were placing orders that all consisted of tacos..and also some table side guacamole..the guac was so good..and im really picky about guac..my sister and nephew really liked it as well..then our meals came, and everything looked oh so fantastic..i got a soft shake down shrimp which had crispy plump shrimp and some shredded cabbage, pico de gallo and chipotle ranch..i also had a soft smokey and the brisket (cute name!) it had the most tender amazing brisket and some pico de gallo..they were both amazing and flavorful..the pico de gallo and chipotle ranch really take things to a whole different taste level..also with the tacos come rice and beans (i chose refried, you can get charro or black) and i pointed out to my nephew that by looking at the crisp brown cheese on top of the beans you can tell they werent just heated up in a microwave..also the rice was really on point as well..normally the rice and beans are kind of just meh when you get them as part of a meal, this was so good i ate it all! We were checked on and got drink refills very often, and we really enjoyed all the food we had..price point was really good for the type of quality that it is..I will try to head here when I am in town next!!

We always have such a great time at Paco's Tacos. The people are great, the food is good and plentiful, and it's just such a nice place to go and relax. I like sitting outside and the walk to Williams Sonoma is always good to work off the wonderful food. Good job and I'll see you soon.

I have been to Pacos probably 4 or 5 times and am never disappointed. Some of my favorites include the Paco taco, skirt steak taco, and the Enchilada de Dennis. The best thing we discovered is that you can also order just the taco or enchilada for $4 or $4.50 so if you don't want the rice and beans. Usually 2 items fills me up. Also I have never had bad service here which is a plus. The chips and salsa are always crispy and delicious.

The drinks, chips and salsa were amazing.  I had the shrimp tacos and they were ok, but the best and not the worst.  The rice was not good.  My friend ordered sauteed veggies and rice, not good.  Veggies were very over cooked/ burnt. Had to ask for them to re cook another order...if it wasn't for the drink(texas mule and strawberry rhubarb margarita) and chips I would not give a 3 star...those were a 5 star

Ive been here several times, it never gets old! Service is fast and they keep bring chips and salsa. Prices are very reasonable. The food, drinks, flavor, atmosphere was very pleasing, presentation of the food was Excellent. Offering something for the whole family. My husband and I enjoyed our meal. The shop was both clean and tidy, having plenty seating. The hostess/ waitress was attentive at all times. Staff members there greeted us in/ out when we left. The food was more than filling, loved all the dishes thus far. We will certainly be returning soon and would recommend this facility. Im sure everything is a must try! Great meal...

We came Last Saturday night and the wait was an hour and 45 minutes!?!  We regretfully had not made a reservation.  Back today (Monday) and no problem at 4 pm. Chris is our server and has a great big smile and is happy to meet a couple of Texans!  She has made us Guacamole tableside (fabulous) and here are my heart healthy chicken tacos on lettuce? All in all, outstanding!

The food was excellent. Salsa had great flavor. It was a little hot for my son, so he mixed it with the mild tomatillo salsa. Cheese dip was great too! I had some kind of turkey carnitas taco on a whole wheat tortilla with bacon and avocado on it, DELICIOUS! Top shelf margarita was $10 tonight (Thurs) and well worth it! We will definitely go back!! So nice it is just 3 miles from home too.
Visited Paco's last week with my family. The service was great from the time we walked in the door. Add to that great food and margaritas and you have a wonderful Mexican restaurant.

We had 6pm reservations for a birthday dinner last night.  We were promptly seated and our server, Darwin G, took great care of us.  He recommended drinks and had a favorite dish that I tried and loved.  Darwin was attentive, had a great personality and immediately noted that the wrong plate had been delivered to our table and corrected it.  The food was delicious but the evening was so much better because of the great service.  Thanks Darwin!  And thanks for finding my phone when I left it behind too....

The food here is so good. It is also a wonderful place for anyone with a gluten intolerance to visit. They have a pretty robust GF menu and the food is delicious. We also had really great service! Make reservations if you come on a weekend night!

Came here for dinner and WOAH!! Best tacos I've ever had. Hands down. Ordered the Chicken fried steak and oh my lanta... What a fantastic dish.   Had SUCH an amazing waitress (Ashley) who made the entire experience memorable. She's a veteran at what she does and completely genuine. Her attitude was positive and full of energy the entire time which was appreciated. She recommend the best margaritas and convinced me to try a palette of shots. (She repeated the name of all the shots at least 5x and for the life of me I cannot remember.)   Will absolutely come back to this location and specifically ask for Ashley with hopes to see her again.   On top of her perfect customer service the food was beyond expectations. Check them out! You won't be mad.

Knocked out by their killer gluten-free steak fajitas.  Went here with friends last night and had a top notch experience.  The wait staff was great, as was the food and expansive list of tequila offerings.  My fiancé said they have the best tacos he's had.  I have already made plans to go back!

Updating my previous review of Paco's Tacos due to an interesting development..  As I indicated originally they did not have a real hot sauce option.  Stop the presses!  They have a Ghost Chili sauce now that is.. dare I say.. sweet?!?  Seriously it tastes like dried ghost chilis, reconstituted with vinegar and mixed with honey - there is probably more to it than that but it doesn't matter - all you need to know is this stuff packs some heat.  Seriously, go light on it if you are not used to very spicy food.  Also the carnitas have become my new favorite, I'm quite certain they are some of the best in town.  Don't take my word for it though, try 'em.
One of our favorite places in Charlotte. All the tacos are terrific and they have an amazing tequila selection. Fun and knowledgeable staff too.

We absolutely love this place. Their El Derado margarita is by far the best margarita I've ever had and definitely worth the hefty price tag. Their food is consistently good and we've not once had an issue with their friendly staff. Best of all, they are extremely gluten free friendly with a big menu of options.

We came to Paco's for a quick lunch before checking into our hotel. My girlfriend had the pineapple mint margarita, and I had the blood orange one. Both were good! We also enjoyed a small queso and a Paco's Taco. A friend recommended Paco's, and she made a great recommendation.
This is a restaurant that is very affordable, in a beautiful area of Charlotte, and serves delicious food!! I've been here a few times and have yet to be disappointed.

I plan to try each and every margarita on the menu! The service is always friendly and the portions are huge. My date had a steak fajita after seeing it at a neighboring table as soon as we sat down. I was just glad that I wouldn't have to wait to order since I already knew what I wanted, shrimp and fish tacos!   Your bowls of salsa and chips are constantly refilled before they even get a chance to be emptied. I've been to other Mexican restaurants that will charge you for salsa and chips, and there will not be refills.  I love that they have a separate door for to go orders. Now that I live close by, I'll definitely become a regular.
